Summary: This hotel is under renovation.  The lobby was modern.  The elevators were covered in brown butcher paper.  Upon arriving on the 2nd floor, we could tell the hotel had not aged well.  Big scrapes on wall, doors, and wallpaper going down the hall.  The wallpaper in the room was bubbled and torn.  Had to really look for outlets to plug in electronic devices.  Looking behind the nightstand and beds we found the baseboards covered in dust.  Pillows were lumpy.  Parking was inadequate.  We had to park in a nearby parking garage our last night.  We told the front desk and they said they would subtract the parking cost from our bill but did not.  Tried to call to have it removed and was sent through a never-ending loop of phone tag.  Do not recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Bit dated but not too bad
Summary: Very convenient to Orange County Airport. Rooms are nice but getting dated and will need a refresh soon. Car park was full when we arrived but staff were he,Paul in letting us park in the drop off area. Bit expensive for what it was but not too bad for a short visit.

Summary Heading: Worst Hilton experience of my life
Summary: Worst experience ever. The hotel is very dated. The first night we took our 2 year old to the pool. There was human poop by the pool and we were not sure if our son stepped on it since he was excited to the get in the water. When I noticed it, I was so disgusted. I immediately grabbed my son and left. I also noticed empty beer cans by the pool. I informed the front desk but I never went to back to the pool. Never staying here again.

I was a guest at the Double Tree Orange County airport location from Dec 24-25, 2022. ﻿In preparation for my arrival, couple days prior, I reached out to the hotel to inquire about quiet rooms in the property as we would be travelling with health sensitive guest and the quietest location was being requested. Your front desk staff informed I could only make these requests a day prior or the day of my arrival. Upon calling the hotel a day before my arrival, I tried reaching out to the front desk multiple times at the end of my workday, around 5PM and not once I was able to be connected to a staff. It was over a period of 45 min trying to call the front desk. I finally called Hilton Diamond Member line for assistance as I wasn't able to connect directly with the hotel. The Customer

This location is not up to speed. Front desk does not follow reservation notes and Hilton Honors status. Still acting like Covid is still on. No room service a problem .Room amenities sub par and restaurant menu needs a complete overhaul.  Only redeeming factor is access to John Wayne Airport otherwise skip this property
Room tip: Higher floors away from adjacent room top equipment

Summary: First of all, the photo of the property on the Hilton App is deceiving to say the least.  Upon entry to the front desk, the Doubletree floor mat was dirty and fraying at the edges.  This should have been my first signal not to stay here.  Once I got to my room, it smelled musty as the AC was not on.  I tried to adjust the dilapidated unit and it took some manipulation of the controls to actually get it to turn on.  The cover for the controls was broken off and missing.  The fan was on but the air was not very cold.  I was shocked as to how worn the furniture was in the room; desk, drawers, table, refrigerator unit, etc.   The bathroom had tile and shower fixtures from the 1990's that were gross.  I was also surprised that there were no electronic chargers at the desk nor the

Summary Heading: The worst stay I ever had. I am a gold homer member and 30 plus years Hilton customer.
Summary: This is the seventies hotel with 21st century rates.  Horrible heater noise. The worst shower. Old old old bathroom, sink, hair dryer, tv etc.  I trusted Hilton name and very  very exteremly disappointed.

So, the online description is incorrect - there is no room service. I planned a fun night away for my daughter and I, and she specifically wanted room service for the first time. I am so disappointed.   The hotel itself and the room is also really outdated. I guess I just expected a similar hotel/room compared to other DoubleTree’s. It seems like they may be working on updating the parking lot…. So the construction equipment out front was “nice” to have to drive thru just to park.

Summary Heading: Terrible experience with break-in to our room and lot of stuff stolen
Summary: Our family had a worst experience at this hotel. We had stayed there as part of youth boys basketball group about 5-6 families from our league for the weekend tournament games. We checked in Fri at about 4 pm (mid-March). My husband and our 10 yr old son went to the pool sometime after and they came back around 5:45 pm and we all got ready to go for dinner with the group. We would have left around 6:05 or 6:10 pm for a nearby restaurant and was back around 7:15 pm or so.   Within that one hour we had gone, someone had break in to our room and took our laptop, air pods, son’s iPad, chargers, my husband’s and my hand luggages and my son’s medicine bag!!! Our room was closed and  locked and it was on the 5th floor and was not close to the elevator or anything. We were shocked and

Summary Heading: Check your room before settling in
Summary: The room had clothes from pervious  attendants before me  very grossed out after but it was a comfortable hotel .. just need better cleans that check floors and room better … the heater was not ideal it smelled Burnt . The staff was really nice and Hoyle was nice just needs better maintenance

The bad - The curtains were moldy, the bathroom had questionable dried orange goo on the walls, housekeeping never picks up the phone, the edges of the furniture are all tattered, the floors in the common space are filthy, there is no A/C in the common spaces once you're off the first floor and the a/c in the rooms is loud.   If you arrive late at night, good luck finding parking in their very small lot.   You're near the highway and the airport, and the windows are thin, so bring earplugs.  The good - The bed linens were clean and the bed was comfortable.    Would not go again.   Finally, try not to confuse it with the nicer Doubletree down the street.

Summary Heading: Very average and Parking Lot has People Hanging Out at Night
Summary: Stayed here 4 times in 2 years, mainly because of lowest price within the Hilton portfolio in the area.  First, its's a 5-floor hotel that has a high rise OB as the background in many photos.  Don't be confused by the photos; it's not a luxury high-rise.  It is about 40 years old which shows age, many worn-out objects, but with the Hilton brand. It's located in a very convenient location, near John Wayne Airport and access to the freeways.  All the Hilton Embassy Suites and equivalent hotels now charge $20-$30 DAILY parking; parking was previously free but it's now $27 per day.  My wife felt unsafe due to people hanging out the parking area in the evening (parking was free in 10/2021) and finding beer and alcohol containers in the morning.  I likely won't be going back.

Noisy air-conditioning, no late check out unless you wake up early and request one. Very tired appearance. Budget!!! No lunch menu but close by market. Obviously near airport so lots of air traffic and road noise. Not the best choice to rebook.

Warning, there are 3 Doubletree that you can get pointed at when searching for Doubletree and Irvine. You must know your address! Normally I would fly in, but this trip I drove and pointed myself at Doubletree Irvine not even thinking twice. I ended up at the Doubletree Spectrum. They told me there was another Doubletree, so back in the car I searched for the other Doubletree and clicked on it, Yup, there are TWO others and so I got a full tour of the properties. This is the oldest.  The Hilton App provided me with an upgraded Queen room which was quite nice.  From what I saw of my late-night arrival and early morning departure the property is in very good condition. Mt bed was exactly Hilton correct. The bathroom clean with nice fresh sealants visible if you're looking at those

Summary Heading: Extremely dirty hotel and rude staff. Insects and hair and trash everywhere.
Summary: Hair piled in the bathtub. Everything neglected. Popcorn ceiling. Old furniture. Old carpet and dirty and stained . AC unit very loud. Curtains extremely old and dirty . Better to stay somewhere else. The only good thing is the location

Summary Heading: OK Hotel, But no Hot Tub or Gym
Summary: When we arrived we learned that the hot tub was out of order and the gym was being renovated.  Seems not OK to show up and not have those things when we intentionally booked the hotel for those two things and then did not get a discount.  Also, very oddly, one of the beds did not have a sheet.  It was 11:00 PM when we discovered this and did not want to deal with trying to get it fixed.

Reasonably priced but everything about it screams In Need of an update.   Seen better days. Would not come back or recommend. Popcorn ceilings, old shower tile, peeling wallpaper, well-used furnishings.

We were in town and just needed to stay here for a bit before our AirBnb was ready. We were checked in promptly by a very friendly front desk staff and headed to our room. The hotel was a bit dated but was still updated. Our room was comfy but there was an issue with some of the pillow covers. I went down to the front desk and they were more than happy to change our room with no questions asked. The stay itself was nice and pleasant and I don't see why we wouldn't stay here again.

The last several reviews tell the story of a hotel that just doesn’t care anymore. They rest on the Hilton name, and with a lower than normal price for the region.  So, my son and I stayed on the Memorial Day holidays - the hotel was clearly practically EMPTY. There were no more than ten cars in the lot. So, they do NOT have a shuttle, so driving is really the only option: twenty bucks to park in an outside, unsecured lot. Zero effort at an upgrade, or even reading room request on my profile. I prefer a higher room due to noise. She put me on three without even looking. I asked for top floor and got it - but is it that hard to read the profile? Empty wine glass outside our room when we checked in … still there at departure time. And for the “piece de resistance”: the shampoo

Their website offers shuttle service from the airport.   When we called from the airport we were told "we don't do the shuttle anymore".  When I asked why it was still on the website they answered " we might bring it back someday".   We took a lyft to the hotel.   It was then after 9pm and the restaurant was closed,  we were told that no places in the area were open (is a commercial office area) but that we could get food from the vending machine.  The vending machine had 5 item in it, 4 of the items were clearly expired.  Took our shoes off when we got in the room and got wet socks on the carpet by the bathroom.  Apparently the toilet had overflowed and flooded the carpet.  Was given another room.  Rooms feel run down.  The staff was friendly (my reason for more than 1 star),

There are two Doubletree branded properties near SNA, clearly there is a reason this one is less expensive. Old, worn out. Walked in to a room with stains on the sheets and threadworn interiors, not to mention a clogged toilet waiting for me. As an airport hotel....one would think there would be a shuttle (3 mins from SNA) except not here, "...oh the shuttled is broken down" said the PM clerk. Uber tock $22 and 15 mins to come...but that's how it goes. What a dump. Double "Club" means a special club of LOSERS. Stay away.

No shuttle as promised.  No top  sheet on bed.  You sleep under a comforter.  That is not good.  Bathroom was updated and ok.  Didn’t feel safe at all.  Young people wandering around and partying.  Extra blanket was torn up!  Needs to be thrown out.

Summary Heading: Promised a food credit but never given
Summary: I am a diamond member and upon checkin the front desk person for that evening said I would get $30 credit per day for breakfast since I am a diamond member and also since the restaurant hours vary due to Covid protocol. Upon checkout I was wasn’t given the credit even though I did not go to the restaurant. The front desk lady said she couldn’t do anything even though I was promised 2 days ago when I checked in. It’s not the money that I am concerned about but the principal of the matter, that when promised something to a customer, honor it, especially for loyal diamond members.

I booked this hotel for the sole reason that it was advertised on the hotel"s webpage as having a free airport shuttle. Its name contains the words "Orange County Airport." The headline just under the hotel picture in large bold font says "Airport access in the South Coast Metro." The second sentence in the description under that headline reads, "We're five minutes from John Wayne Airport, and our free shuttle will take you there."   After paying for my room, I asked about how to schedule the shuttle. I was told the shuttle is not running at this time and I should have clicked the 1cm yellow bar on that hotel page that says, "What to Expect During Your St..." That yellow bar leads to all the amenities not currently available.   This is all so misleading. Presumably, this is a

This is definitely not a true Doubletree Hotel.  Stayed one night and immediately noticed that the hotel was filled with young people using the rooms for parties.  Our room was dirty, the elevators were loud and filthy, and we generally didn’t feel safe.  The front desk staff were friendly and professional but walking out at 7:30 AM to hotel “guests” smoking weed and drinking beer in front of the hotel was concerning.  Overall just a bad hotel and I’m surprised that Hilton keeps it as a Doubletree property.

Summary Heading: Outdated rooms, beware of room charges
Summary: Rooms are outdated, no restaurants walking distance, hotel charged me three times for one night. I was incorrectly charged the room rate from when I booked, spoked to hotel staff, and it they corrected it but will have to wait and see with my bank. Also, couldn’t get an explanation on why I was charged three times for one night separate from the deposit. Waiting to see if the hold will drop from my bank.

They need to make sure to clean the room especially with the whole covid issue . Sheets weren’t clean and bathroom walls had hair . I wouldn’t stay here anymore . I was very disappointed since it seems to be located in a nice area

Summary Heading: Very Dirty Hotel Double Tree By HİLTON
Summary: Last day my hotel February 12 i choose this hotel via Hilton Honors account but no any upgrade any way after i stay my room 622 evening time i saw in bad like bed bucks and i kill one second one they run a way after that i went guest service and they change my room i have allergies for this kind of animals they give us 514 after one hours later same problem there and i have 14 hours flight i don’t want change my room i put my own towels i put my long clothes and i try to sleep when i speak hotel no any details return to me no any HİLTON HONOR guests special team return to me   Finally HOTEL VERY DIRTY VERY SMELLY ALL CORRIDORS NOT CLEAN I WILL SHARE ALL DETAILS IN MY PHOTOS THIS HOTEL NOT ‘^^^ CLEAN AND SAFE Hilton Hotel .

Summary Heading: Room wasn’t cleaned well and made our allergies terrible!
Summary: When we checked in, we realized the sheets on the bed were dirty (marks on the pillow, scuff and dirt marks on the sheets, orange stuff spilled, etc). The floor didn’t look vacuumed (pieces of granola or something were on the floor). When we complained, they came in to change the sheets. But they just put a thin sheet over the mattress protector (didn’t change the mattress protector). They also didn’t change the comforter (just the thin duvet cover). So anything spilled would definitely still be on the comforter and mattress protector. The sheets and pillows then made our skin really itchy. And my husband’s nose started dripping from the time we entered the room until we left. All of my kids had allergies too from the room, so we ended up having to give all of our kids allergy
Manager Response: Dear LS202224,  Thank you for reaching out to us regarding your stay. I am so sorry to hear that your room did not meet our very high standards; this is not typical of our hotel. I do see we tried to upgrade you to another room. I will reach out with our other departments so we can work on ways to completely avoid occurrences such as this. It was a pleasure to have you stay with us, ad we hope you give us another chance to better serve you when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: Don’t be doped into thinking you’re making a reservation at a REAL Doubletree. This is an old Hotel using Doubletree by Hilton “Club” name. Staff didn’t follow posted mask requirement and were disturbed when I pointed that out. Chair in room was all soiled and bathroom was “updated” like putting lipstick on a pig. Very disappointing. Run down and old. booking easily mistaken for much nicer real Doubletree three blocks away. Don’t stay here!
Manager Response: Dear PJW7878,  Thank you for reaching out to us regarding your stay. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations. I do apologize if you feel duped; this was not our intention. We are an older property; however, we still maintain high standards. We are to soon begin renovation to the hotel. We did enjoy having you stay with us and again apologize for any inconveniences.

Summary: Hotel was nice overall, quiet, and had good customer service. Unfortunately, only breakfast was being offered in the restaurant. No lunch or dinner at this time. The shuttle service to the airport was also not available due to COVID. Would still recommend this property.
Manager Response: Dear Zafsomani,  Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback about your stay. I am so sorry about the airport shuttle currently being unavailable; we are working hard to restore this service soon. It was a pleasure to have you stay with us, and we hope to have the opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: The only reason why I booked at your property and turned in my rental car a day early was because of the services you advertised on your website.  After checking in I was stuck there with no where to eat and no transportation (as advertised)

Summary Heading: Not as horrible as some reviews, but the worst Hilton property I've been to
Summary: I expected the worst after reading some of the negative reviews.  While it wasn't the worst hotel I've been in, it is one of the worst Hilton properties I've been in.  The building looks like it belongs in one of the Eastern Bloc countries during the Cold War era and the furnitures haven't been changed in decades.  The bed was comfortable though.  Most of the room was clean but some furnitures and the bathtub weren't clean.  The surrounding artificial lake is quite nice and we liked the view of it from the room.  I didn't get much benefit of having Diamond status here as they didn't upgrade our room.  The $24 food credit didn't get us much (it was enough to cover 3 bottles of beer) as the restaurant had very limited food selection.  My biggest problem was the employees not

We’ve stayed here previously and always found the staff friendly and helpful. This trip we never encountered a single staff member. It felt like a self service cafeteria! We used digital key, checkin and out. If we hadn’t stayed before, we probably wouldn’t stay again.  I’m sure this was just an off couple of days.

We arrived to find 2 of the 4 outlets in the room not working and dried food that had been dropped on the sheets under the covers.we would have checked with someone, but did not find this out until we are getting ready for bed.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money or time
Summary: I wasn’t told my room that I chose based on the map was an adjacent room m. No vent in the bathroom, room was miserably stuffy the entire time I except at night. Their was mold growing in the bathroom.  The only good thing was the staff

Anna at the front desk was delightful she worked by herself and was working hard to check in other people. The hotel is on the older side but the room was clean and efficient for what we need for a few nights.   It’s kind of a business hotel just right outside of the airport it was easy and convenient to get to

It’s hard to pay for a hotel and then get charged to park your car. It’s even more hard to understand why you charge a guest to park a car when you don’t even have enough spaces and give them a voucher for a parking structure that doesn’t even take the voucher

Be aware of the manager at the front desk. Extremely nasty and rude! The worst experience I have had a hotel. I have traveled many to many countries, nothing has been worst than this experience. Be aware!

Super employees made this stay a true pleasure. The staff could not have been more helpful or accommodating. Anything requested was delivered promptly. Any request was fulfilled. The service rated as high as any 5 star hotel and I have stayed in many.

This hotel has great staff and is in a great location. It isn’t one of the expensive hotels in the area, but with that comes with having a hotel room with older decor, older bathroom fixtures, and older smell (unless it’s mildew coming from the AC unit, which I really believe needs a filter change).   It is comfortable and I fall asleep like a baby, but compared to the other hotels in the area, this can be defined as run down and in need of an upgrade. Place still has popcorn ceilings so that gives you a timeframe of how old this hotel is.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience because of the staff. They really make this place feel comfortable.

Not a good experience.  Pros: 1) Front desk staff very kind and fast 2) Good location  Cons: 1) Elevators did not work 2) Too much light in the room - curtains are terrible 3) Rooms are very old and shabby 4) Parking is not good

Don't  stay here. It has been mentioned by others before. Run down, in very serious need of renovations and it is just not clean. Look at the photos and judge for yourself. I would not accept this for a dormitory room and most certainly not for a Hilton brand. Banged up furniture, filthy dirty old noisy a/c unit. Bathroom... don't go there. Overall noisy hotel next to the Freeway

This hotel seems to have the worst management team. The hotel is run down. The rooms are old and dirty. The mattress and pillows are not comfortable. The floors are not clean. California is open for business, but this hotel still using the COVID excuse and offers the pitiful small bag of goodies for breakfast.  Just to be fair, the staff at the front desk are amazing and they deserve 5 stars. I'm a Diamond member with Hilton, and stay with Hilton every time I travel.  But, this hotel is zero stars for me.

As a Hilton Honor member, I didn't think I have to do any research on a Hilton property. After entering my room (617), there is a musty smell.  I am usually not the one that inspect the bed but I felt it was necessary with this one. Unfortunately I found a long hair.  Went to the front desk and ask for another room.  The second one is at least tolerable. No bad smell but I did find food crumbs on the bed. Also TV remote is missing one battery but has one in there. There are holes on the wall.  Tub hasn't been updated since the 80s. At this point, I decided to post a review so others don't make the same mistakes. Much to my surprise, there are a ton of recent reviews about how bad this place is. YES everything you read is true.  Irony is that as I am writing this review, someone

Stayed here September 3rd - September 5th during Labor Day weekend. Checked in @ 4pm  on September 3rd and was upgraded to a lake view room due to my diamond status. The dude that checked me in kinda reminded me of a old co-worker when I worked for a Hilton hotel in Vegas. But back to the review. During checking in, the gentleman asked me if I was parking a car and I said yes. The gentleman informed me it’s $20/daily and also asked for my car make, Model & color. He wrote those things down on a parking slip and placed a hang tag in my key packet. After getting the key packet with the parking pass. I asked about the cookies and the gentleman said unfortunately due to covid the hotel decided to stop the cookies which I was disappointed about but I’m not gonna let it put me down. I

Everything was great . Fast and efficient receptionist . Great stay over all. I would of wanted a room with a couch available at the time of my booking. However I understand it is depending on the day you Book .

When I arrived no one was wearing a mask, I doubt everybody in the hotel was vaccinated. They gave me the wrong room, fortunately they fixed it for me. My room did not have a mini fridge like it stated it would, my towel had stains, my pillow had a stain, the couches looked severely worn and dirty. The carpet had a few sticky spots and in one corner smells like vomit.The phone did not have any labeling or instructions so I had no idea how to use it. I was charged $20 a night for parking that was nowhere in the paperwork. There was about an inch of room underneath each hotel door so I could hear the person across the hallway talking. There were signs saying that the wife I was free, yeah I had to spend $15 for the Wi-Fi.  Never again will I come here.

This could be the worst Hilton property that I have ever stayed at. It started with front desk guy being in his car - and getting out smelling like marijuana. The room was old and dated - did not have a refrigerator, ice maker on floor didn’t work (and this was the HHonors floor!). Room also smelled like smoke and was supposed to be non-smoking floor.

Summary Heading: Not worthy of being called a Hilton
Summary: This hotel is in terrible condition. The rooms and bathrooms appear to have been updated last in the 1980s. It is hard to determine if anything is truly clean due to the condition of furniture and carpet. May offer good rates but buyer beware.

Very dirty room, bed sheets were dirty, pillows were yellow and bathroom had fungusL I will never recommend this hotel to anyone, it was not what I had expected at all. There was dust everywhere on the furniture.

The staff was rude. And we had to park off site, and still pay 20 dollars. A major inconvenience. When this was brought up to staff they didn’t seem to care and didn’t properly explain where the parking structure down the way was in the first place. I wasted time finding parking when me and my wife could have been sleeping.

If the experience of my stay a “C-“. This place is in need of some TLC. Staff that was there did what they could, but they just needed more people to help customers. Parking lot was full each night, we stayed on a weekend.

Summary Heading: Hotel is very unattended needs renovation ASAP
Summary: Hotel is old very unattended, the personal needs done training staring with management the hotel has no leadership the rooms are in very bad condition for the price you pay. At one point I thought I was staying at a ghetto the place is bad.

I did not feel I was at aHilton I felt like a walked in to a motel. I have stayed at other Hilton’s and this was the worse, iAsked for an extra blanket got sheet an hour later. This was a very uncomfortable stay.

Hotel did not match what booking.com advertised, you had to pay extra for parking and you’re lucky to find a spot to park after 8 pm. Rooms aren’t very clean and staff are not very friendly. Too crowded to even use the elevators

We had two queen bedroom that was smaller than the preview room that was shown when i made the reservation. The AC squealed the whole time and we could hear the AC in other rooms also.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Parking was a pain at night.

This hotel should not have the Hilton name on it. As a Hilton honors member this hotel was the worst Hilton I’ve ever encountered!!! Dirty, outdated, staff was uninformed and not kind. Pool was not clean and hot tub was green!

Normally I don’t write reviews, ( just read them ) . Where does one start. I checked in for 5 days. I opened the door to my room and was instantly greeted by a wrath of hot moldy air. The carpet was Stained, Dirty And very Sticky. The furniture was old, dated & damaged. The lamp shades were broken, cracked and bent out of shape. Most of the appliance’s were hooked up using extension cords ( Fire Hazard ) Wait ….. THE WORST IS YET TO COME >>> During my 5 day stay I never received Hskp. Towels soap, shampoo, etc were never replenished. When I called front desk they said they only had 2 maids, and would get to us when they could. I saw a maid in the Hallway. Borrowed her vacuum and vacuumed the room myself. When I asked for extra towels and supplies she said that she was running

this hotel is not worth the money at all.  The Room looked like it was trashed . A/C sucked … it took them 5 out of 7day stay to finally clean out room. Had to tell them everyday to clean our room . very disappointed

I can’t believe that this is a Hilton property. It is Dated and not very well kept up. One of my party was asked in the parking lot to help pay for somebody’s room. This property either needs to be updated or turned into a Motel six

Summary Heading: Terrible facilities and experience, despite the great staff.
Summary: The staff at this hotel are the only redeeming quality about it. They were cordial, apologetic, and accommodating as much as possible. However, there is little that they can do when the establishment is this run-down and poorly maintained. The cleanliness and comfort of this hotel is the worst I have ever experienced on any trip. The check-in lobby is small and poorly staffed. The rooms were old and poorly ventilated, with no windows or fans in the bathrooms or the room. The AC is an old unit that is more loud than effective, and the carpet and sheets were stained and dirty. There was a smell of mold and musty humidity in the room that didn’t improve much even after facilities tried to clean the AC.  As for the amenities, the restaurant was closed (so no cookies) and the pool

I thought a Doubletree would be a safe bet for a nice room.  The room was very basic. No microwaves in room only a shared dirty one in the lobby.  Elevators dirty. No food options on premises. If you're lucky vending machine will have something to offer. No usb plugs so bring your plug for phone charging. My only positives for this hotel was the comfortable bed and nice staff.

Probably the appalling hotel experience in my 57 years on the planet.  Only one unqualified person working the front desk, no management on site.  We arrived to a street person pawing through the trash bin outside the lobby doors (no security), a completely unqualified front desk person, TV didn't work in our Mother's room, our room had no clock at all and we awoke to two inoperable elevators which required our 86 year old Mother to descend five flights of stairs to exit the building and absolutely no management onsite to address the issue.  These are only a few of the problems.  There were many more.  Absolutely appalling that this property bears the Hilton name.

Summary Heading: Worst DoubleTree I have stayed in
Summary: No washcloth, no soap, bad parking availability, no cookies offered, old and ragged looking rooms, elevator broke. Just an awful experience for being a Hilton Honors member.  This place needs to be updated.

Summary Heading: This was not to my Hilton standards
Summary: Room was dirty, bed stained, bathroom shower dripped non stop, the room smelled like mildew. I feel like this hotel was so out of date. There weren’t any plugs to charge phone except behind furniture or far away from the night stands. Definitely needs some updating

Summary Heading: Not the Doubletree quality used to
Summary: Clean up! The ceiling in the room had dust particles hanging, the elevator was dirty, the room wasn’t stocked with necessities. I would honestly like a refund. I booked 2 rooms here and they were horrible and not the quality of a Doubletree.

Summary Heading: We will not stay here again
Summary: Stuffy room , bathroom faucets barely works , dated rooms , old squeaky beds , we had to pay $20 a night for unsecured parking that was not disclosed until check in. Other Double Trees are much better

2hours wait to clean the rooms rude staff and when we did get our room the room wasn’t certified clean with the seal on the door and the air conditioner was leaking and the whole living room floor was soaking wet and freezing

Summary Heading: Staff was awesome but unfortunately rooms did not match. Room had stained carpet sofas and lamp shades ! Room smells
Summary: Staff was awesome but unfortunately rooms did not match. Room had stained carpet sofas and lamp shades ! Room smellEd like smoke. We checked out and went to another hilton branch only a couple miles away ..total. Difference

The Doheny Suite was the room I was given and it had an order of urine and wet towel. Stains all over every piece of furniture. The pillows had hair on them. The room was clearly poorly cleaned. The restaurant was still closed and the front desk guy although accommodating didn’t seem to enjoy the job. But hey I don’t blame him. I love Hilton but was disappointed here. I actually had to leave at midnight to find another hotel.

Horrible hotel!  No restaurant.  The first room was disgusting.  A big dried booger was on the remote of the tv.  No fridge in the room.  We were staying there because we had a four day volleyball tournament and could not even keep bottled water cold.  Front desk staff was so unhelpful!

We stayed at this property for a single night, prior to a flight.  The property is definitely under serviced.  Floors were very dirty and services are non existent.  Stay at the DB down the road, it’s just as close to John Wayne.  This property has not opened the restraint, does not offer any food or coffee service in the morning, and is generally bare bones by Hilton standards.  I’d recommend avoiding this location.

There are two Doubletree hotels make sure you do not book the this one. Hotel is run down, overcharge for Parking with no security. Staff is trying but understaffed poor management and maintenance non existent. They blame Covid but lame excuse others are functioning without shutting down everything and refusing to handle customers

Room service was slow. Did not answer phone calls when needing room service. Room was nice, location was nice. Plenty of things to do around the area. Not far from coast. Restaurants in area were very nice.

Summary Heading: Do not stay here- not clean and unsafe
Summary: I have never checking into a hotel, walked into our room and immediately walked out and asked to cancel our reservation.  Do not stay here. It is not clean, the hotel is sketchy and felt so unsafe. Immediately as I drove up the hotel grounds was so dirty (both trashcans overflowing, bottles and trash under plants) I had a bad feeling about the hotel. I sent my cousin in to “check it out”. She came back and said it was disgustingly dirty and she couldn’t believe that during a pandemic it wouldn’t be clean, and no one was at the front desk. We ended up trying to give it a chance. Checked in-  a sign was on the front desk stating someone would be back in 10 minutes and was time stamped 6:33pm. It was 8:00pm and no one was there. Someone finally came, very disheveled and nervously

Summary Heading: The absolute worst overnight rental experience I have had
Summary: To begin with, there were people hanging around in front of the entrance smoking and it smelled.  Difficult to find the place because you enter through a parking lot and the signage is unclear since it says it is a Club. Drove around it twice before realizing it may actually be the Hilton.  There was no cart to move baggage. Evidently there is only one and someone never returned it the entire time we stayed there.  While waiting to be served at the front desk I overhead someone ask for blankets and they were told they could have additional sheets because there we no blankets.  The day before I was to stay I went online TWICE and cancelled the second night but it was still in the system as a 2 night stay. When I entered the room I turned on the light switch by the door but it

The front desk staff appear to hate their jobs. Upon arrival, the gentleman by the name of Evan rudely assisted us because it appeared we disturbed him from whatever it was he was doing in back but before we disturbed him, we waited awhile before hitting the bell because he has a sign out stating he was going to be back in 10 minutes.   If we had not rung that bell, I don’t believe he would of ever come out of hiding.   We asked for clean towels, we were given ones that looked like they were stepped on.   When I inquired about fees just to get a better understanding, Evan rudely rushed me off the phone by cutting me off and speaking over me. He also hung up on me.  Apparently some of Hilton’s locations do not have refrigerators at their properties.   All of the ice machines were

Dirty surroundings. When I arrived at the hotel parking lot, it was littered with garbage and birds were all of the place picking through it. The hotel had no small convenience store where I can buy food items or medication. They did offer beer, wine and pre-made sandwiches. Just the wear and tear of the building and linens provided was not what I was expecting from Hilton brand of hotels

Reasonably clean with a convenient location. Not many services are available here. Not a property I would seek out for vacation but somewhat well located. There is a pool and hot tub outside next to the freeway with sunshine between 10 and 5.

bad customer service  room not clean hard to reach the stuff  very uncomfortable  as hilton member i was surprised that this hotel wasn't taking care of the cleaning of the room especially in covid-19 period . we woke up sick with allergies and dust everywhere

When we arrived, there was a cabinet for a fridge with no fridge inside.  So we then searched for an ice machine to cool some drinks we had and the one on our floor was broken, so we went to the second floor and there were 5 ice cubes that came out, so then we went to the 4th floor and 5 more cubes came out.  There was blood on my bed spread.  To top it off their jacuzzi (the main reason I booked here) was not heated.

Horrible. I've been a loyal Hilton Honors member for years but the quality is no longer consistent.  There is a good reason that this is the least expensive Hilton hotel near the airport. Though that said, it is NOT worth the price.  It is seriously almost as bad as staying at a Motel 6.  The outside photos may look nice, but the rooms are horrible.  The parking lot was dirty and old and most parking spots were tiny.  The room uses the old wall ACs still and it smells like a mix of smoke and urine. The shower looks like it hasn't been changed since the 80s. The head is low and the water pressure is weak. Also, it wasn't cleaned thoroughly. There were some hairs in the tub.  I did not receive the usual cookies and water bottles upon checkin like usual.  The lobby was small and

We called before we arrived to see if they had a restaurant there. The man said no it had been closed for a year. My wife asked if there are restaurants close by so we could before checking in. The man said we have a zillion restaurants in southern ca. He said just use your phone to google. We have been Hilton Honors member for over 10yrs. This is the service and addditude we get.

I generally like the staff at DoubleTree, but 4 out of 5 locations desperately need remodeling. This location is no different with faded carpets, a faucet that barely turns, and scrapes on doors and walls. No food here, but you can walk 5 minutes to a Starbucks.

unsatisfactory .. TV service was down vending machines we’re horrible condition taking money non-refunds staff was careless. will definitely not be staying here again.it was unfortunately sad.hopefully gets fixed

Summary Heading: Decent but  much room for improvement
Summary: I it was a decent stay. I’ve stayed there before some years ago and it Was really nice then. I was sad to see the hotel had deteriorated. Also we were not given the complimentary cookies and in such cases the hotel should give vouchers to order online

Very very OUTDATED & in desperate need of repairs on so many issues.    1 - Booked a corner room for a view - no view! 2 - Room assigned - room locked to adjourning room was BROKEN!!! 3 - End table lights with light bulb hanging outside the socket!!! 4 - Changed room - then - bathroom water faucets keeps running after you turn it off!! 5 - All the fridges were removed from room because they'll be updating soon per front desk. 6 - only one microwave for ALL their guests in lobby!! 7 - not enough outlets for electronic devices!!! (this is a necessities for many customers) Buyers beware!!! Definitely won't book this one until there's a complete overhaul -- not acceptable at all.

This property is awful. Stay across the street in the other Hilton Doubletree. If you're a Hilton member, you will be treated like dirt.The General Manager is unprofessional, inexperienced, and immature.

Summary Heading: This is the hotel for you if...
Summary: This is the hotel for you if...  You enjoy worn out sofas with stains You enjoy sticker residue on your headboard You enjoy not being able to get ahold of the front desk for extended periods of time (30+ Minutes) You do not plan on using the sleeper sofa as advertised because you will be informed there are absolutely no extra blankets in the entire hotel that is half vacant.  You enjoy poor customer service reminiscent of the buh-bye flight attendant sketch from SNL

It's cheap but isn't the hotel I wanted to be poor of cleanliness I don't like the smell of my room and their linen smell bad. Especially their parking rate 20$ a night. Customer Service unsatisfied..

We had a great night sleep. Very comfortable and great customer service by Kim when we checked in. We will stay here again and recommend to our family. The location is very accessible. Property was clean.

Nowhere did it say parking was an additional $20 stay on Priceline and because of the miscommunication through both parties they wouldn’t even comp our vehicle. Along with another problem which was water was being shut off from morning to afternoon around 4:30 PM which I was told on check in just one day. This happened several days in a row. Very upsetting

Summary Heading: Out of control dark and dirty old hot steamer
Summary: I am shocked they can call this place a Hilton. It's old, dark and dirty. Poorly trained and creepy staff . No breakfast, they use Covid to justify their 0 ability at hospitality. Poor wifi, stained carpets and furniture everywhere, old flop house mattresses, popcorn low ceilings, ancient tv's , old school motel type non working AC units. Bathroom reminds me of my old high-school locker room. No wash cloths, one power outlet to in the room, loud location next to a freeway, elevator takes forever, zero recognition or benefits of my Hilton Diamond status. This place is running a bait and switch!!!!!! They have no accountability for Hilton's standards and could care less. Avoid this nightmare. Josie at the front desk is awful. Maids not wearing mask. No airport shuttle for a

Summary Heading: Room Burglarized ** Beware ENTER/USE HOTEL AT OWN RISK ** Hotel takes NO Responsibility or Liability.
Summary: ** Beware ** DO NOT STAY HERE.  You use this property at your own risk. ** The hotel does not take any responsibility or liability for my Suite # 433 being broken into on Friday, February 19, 2021 between 4:15pm and 8:10pm.  Door has physical damage of being broken into.  My room was ransacked from top to bottom.  All my personal belongings were completely taken.  Items included 2018 MacBook Air, iPhone 12 Pro, Computer Bag, Portable Bose speaker, Beats Noise Cancelling Headphones, 2TB External Hard Drive, LG Cell Phone, Clothing, multiple phone and electronics chargers, Battery Pack/Battery charger, medications, toiletries and personal items.  Approximately $4000-$5000 in losses.  I notified Josie at the front desk about the incident and was told the General Manager, Quinn Su,

Summary Heading: $20 for the parking and no Free Wifi.
Summary: The room looks fine to me. It is basic, I can't complaint for the price. I was spending a lot of time looking for a budget hotel that is decent. The price was ok but they .charged $20 for the parking and no compliment Wifi. You have to pay $9.95 for low bandwidth for 3 days. There's gone my low  budget room. This hotel seems to attract the type of clients that smoke and placed trash on the parking lot.

Summary Heading: Horrible Service from a Hilton Property
Summary: First of all, I know Pot is legal in California but does the entire floor need to smell like this.  I complained to the front desk staff about this and was told when they check out they will be charged $300 for smoking in the room. The rooms are old.  I checked in online, which was welcomed during these COVID times.  I got to the room and tried to turn on the TV and noticed the TV, Refrigerator and coffee maker did not work.  I checked the extension cord and everything was plugged in.  I called the front desk and they sent the maintenance staff to fix it.  Maintenance came with a mask and fixed that.  I then noticed no toiletries in the bathroom.  Again I called the front desk and they told me they would send all this up.  Again the Maintenance staff came by with the toiletries.

Summary Heading: Non-existent service and worn out rooms - Won't be back
Summary: In a normal year, I average 40-50 hotel nights and this one stands out as the worst in my recent memory.  Front desk was completely incapable of providing any service so I asked for the GM who also did nothing until I gave him specific instructions on how to handle the situation.  And although I had what was supposedly the best suite in the hotel, the carpeting was threadbare, furniture upholstery was torn, paint chipped everywhere....you get the picture.  I also found that not all of the staff were wearing masks.  The location is good, but there are lots of other options and you'd do well to choose anywhere but here.

The room had no blowdryer and no longer providing wash clothes. Had no half-half cream. They removed the refrigerator and we were told we would have one. No sanitizing in the lobby. Elevator floors were filthy dirty and food stains on the ground. Entrance to the hotel with overflowing trash cans and trash on the ground. Parking lot full of trash.  Dangerous situation when the cars were double-parked and no access. Parked in the red curb. Had there been a fire, it would have been fatal. No access to enter by Fire Dept. Immediately informed Josie, Manager to please leave her post to observed all violations. She wouldn't but confirmed it was all true on her way into work. Only have 4 housekeepers for entire hotel. No proper cleaning. It's not SAFE and NEVER STAYING. Lost my

I am a frequent traveler and loyal Hilton diamond member.  My choice tends to be the DoubleTree line.  But this hotel was the worst I have ever stayed in.  I was scheduled for 5-day stay, but called the HH desk that evening and checked out. They had small rooms, horrible beds, the carpet was gross and the configuration of the rooms (bathroom to hotel door) was problematic.

I love DoubleTree properties and I stayed during the virus lockdown. Firstly as with all Hilton properties lately there was no upgrade for room. Just a standard for being a Diamond member. They said they only had a single housekeeper on staff and people were in The lobby waiting for a room. My first room would not open after reprogramming the keys twice, so I was given a second room.  Older, worn, but clean. Decent view, and surrounding area is nice. All rooms have the fridge removed, just a big empty cabinet. Even Hampton properties have a small fridge! Then They charged $20 a night for parking, when during the virus there is about 5 cars in the entire lot, no shuttle working. No restaurant, no gym, no pool, and no cookies. I can forgive most of that for the virus- but to then

There are so many Hiltons around this area, do make sure you know which one you're staying at and that you have the correct address!   Our bed was a Super King, which as you can imagine, was huge! However, it could have benefited from a mattress topper, as you could feel the join between the two beds that made up the Super King. Spacious bathroom, and a nice view of the lake from the window; this made for a good jogging track around it at sunrise the next day.   At breakfast, I had the delicious (pre-made) omelette and the seasoned veg with potatoes. If you want a coffee you have to ask for it – there aren't any big flasks with them ready-made.

Dated  has NO USB plugs in the room so bring your own,  had to request that a refrigerator be brought to room.   First time that's happened to me,   when it arrived the gentleman said that they had had complaints about the noise and that's why they were removed.   I can't even hear it running

Summary Heading: Great Hotel. Shuttle for the Airport.
Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel for a business trip. The hotel is very new. There are plenty of restaurants in a walking distance: Starbucks, Rubio's tacos... I did not have time to use the pool and fitness center, so I can not say anything about the hotel installations.  Rooms are spacious and very confortable.  They have a free shuttle that takes you from the airport. When I called, the shuttle was not available, but they arranged a free Uber ride for me. The ladies at the front desk were really helpful. The parking is very expensive $22 a day.

First of all, the Manager, Joann, is very unprofessional and is running this old hotel to the ground.  You can tell by the staff how unhappy they are and it stems from the management.  I am a Diamond member and felt like i was treated unfairly.  The rooms smell like dirty feet and after walking in my socks is exactly what i got.  The rooms are very outdated and carpets are filthy.  The pillows are flat and matress is old.  You can tell by the lack of care this manager puts into her property.  The breakfast was run of the mill and being a Diamond member, i had to pay for breakfast. Other Doubletree hotels have it complementary for thier higher tiered members. There were little black bugs in the room and knats flying around.  Glad I only had to stay one night. Joann needs to go so

The location is great for many reasons including freeway access. This Doubletree is in a quiet and easily accessible location. The hotel room was dated but very clean. There was a coffee maker but no fridge. Comfy bed. Two travel companions said the a/c in respective rooms was loud but I did not experience that.   The price fit well into my work travel budget and was just fine. We all had a drink and dinner on the patio lakeside which was very nice.

The hotel was clean and the service was good. The breakfast lady could have been a little nicer, but overall had a great stay. It was near every thing that you could need around. I walked to go get food from a nice little Pizza spot called Roman's. Also Disneyland is only like 8 miles away so I might be taking my family sometime next year.

The Doubletree hotel was located in a very good location which was nearby the John Wayne airport. The room I had was a corner room and it was very nice with great windows. The bathroom was a little dated but the room was nice and clean. It did not have a small refrigerator like most do now and that was a negative.

Summary Heading: Great location for John Wayne (SNA) and OC business
Summary: Very convenient location to SNA and all of OC. Easy access to I-5 and I-405 as it is right off CA-55. Starbuck’s close by at corner of McArther Blvd. Good food selections close by. Costa Mesa is also convenient.  Love the lake for walks with my service animal while staying here.

Very thin walls you can hear everything going on in the neighbor's room, including the person they are talking on the phone with.    An alarm went off at 5 am and we were frantically looking for our phones to shut it off before it woke up the kids... only to find out it was the neighbor's phones going off, not ours!!!  The staff was not friendly at all.  We are Hilton Diamond members and have always felt welcomed at other properties.  This property was full of attitudes and unpleasant demeanors

The Surf City Marathon package is fantastic, especially if it is your first time.  The shuttle will get you to and from the race without the extra hassle of having to park and rush to the start line.  They also provide an extra early breakfast for the runners. You can have a pasta dinner right at the hotel or eat at one of several restaurants close by.  We really appreciated the late check out to allow for showering before we met family for lunch and then hit the road. The staff really wanted its guests to have a memorable race experience. We did.

This is the fourth year that we’ve stayed here and we LOVE it! The staff is so friendly! They make the runners feel special by providing a big breakfast, a race shuttle to the starting line, giving us a late (2:00) check out, and even cheering for us as we return through the lobby! The only bad thing was that there was no fridge in our room. The beds were super comfy though. We’ll stay again next year!

Summary Heading: Third time here. Will stay again.
Summary: They put together a package deal for the Suf City Marathon. Price includes shuttle to and from the race and a good hot breakfast.  Carb dnner is served the night before. Staff is very friendly. Clean, quiet rooms.

great experience. really no hiccups. great location for the brand. I have stayed before at other double trees in the area. Needs some plant life or something to liven it up. would stay here again, no questions asked

Summary Heading: I had a lovely short stay
Summary: We were only here for one night. My boyfriend and I checked in pretty late that night and the woman at the front desk was very informative and friendly. She answered every question and we were delighted to receive complimentary water bottles and cookies. It was a nice treat after exploring all day. The room was very clean and comfortable. I was worried that there would be lots of noise being that we were so close to the airport. We were able to completely forget that the airport existed. The only thing is that the room did not come with a mini fridge. There was a coffee pot, hair dryer, safe, desk, and pullout couch in the room with a queen bed. The shower was clean and long lasting hot water. We had a very comfortable night and were able to sleep in with a checkout time of

This was our 4th year choosing the Doubletree as our home base for running the Surf City race. Michelle and her team do the greatest job of taking care of and even emotionally supporting the runners. What a fun experience it is to stay here for the race! We will always come back to you:)

I stayed so I could run the race. This hotel is so accommodating for all the runners. Extended check out time of 2pm Free breakfast free parking shuttle to and from the race and a fanfare when you arrive back with water and a chocolate chip cookies

Summary Heading: Cost for everything and smells terrible!!
Summary: Nothing is complimentary  The room and hotel basically is very smelly and outdated.  Food costs Water costs Parking costs $20 There’s no way I will stay there ever again.  It was our first trip back to California in years.

My wife and I stayed here our last day of our Vac. Hotel within 4 mins of Airport. Check in was fast and the staff was very nice. The room was ok, no frig or micrwave. We went to breakfast before we checked out, being a Diamond member only gets you a box of cereal and some kind of bread.  But no spoons. Told the staff they said they will wash some have them out in 5 to 10 mins. We never did see any clean spoons.

Stayed at this property while in town for training. The business I was visiting was directly across the street so it was convenient. There did seem to be a bit of a lack of good restaurants nearby. Plan to use Uber to go get dinner probably.

For the price, needs remodeling but location is good. I stay in the area at least 30 nights per year and wanted to try new hotel...not worth the money and will go back to my normal hotel or may try a Hilton south closer to Spectrum.

This is a very nice but simple hotel. The room was clean, regular size, comfortable. When we checked in the receptionist had a weird attitude. Much better was the receptionist when we checked out. I had to pay $20 for one night parking!

Inexperienced/ apathetic staff and outdated and worn finishes and infrastructure appear to be the norm.  Had an issue which occurred on premises and staff ignored me. Would not happen at many other hotels I stay at.  Shower water temp fluctuates a lot.  Finishes are worn and outdated.  Hallway lighting is sub par.

Summary Heading: Not like me it used to!
Summary: Unfriendly housekeeping staff, looks like they’re not happy working there!  Do they not know they’re in the hospitality business? Air conditioner/heater in room is noisy. Building needs updating & refresh as the whole place has a smell! Just as other said, parking fee is outrageous, same amount for self park or valet!  As Diamond member, no hot breakfast & there continental breakfast is a joke! I skipped my second day!

Very dirty and not maintained  AT ALL.  Not at all. The room service was horrible and the parking outrageous. Do not stay here until they renovate and hire new maids!!!! They didn’t even let me check in til 5pm !!! I was in the largest suite they had and it was filthy with wrappers in the drawer and no frig even!!!

I felt discriminated. Was given an unclean and lots of problems in the room. I felt weird staying in. The internet did not work and the clerk said that they didnt want to see my kind come in and come out.

There are TWO Doubletree SNA hotels within 4 blocks of each other.   and to make things even more confusing, the automated texts reminding one of the reservation doesn't specify WHICH property we are to check in! and to make matters even worse, this Doubletree is currently signed as "Club", and the text reminders, and reservation systems don't differentiate! Front desk said they were getting rid of the Club designation and changing their signs, but that may not fix the basic challenge. Room was spacious and quiet.  No refridgerator. Restaurant staff were very unimpressive, bordering on uneccesarily rude. Generally checkin, bell and valet and cleanliness were very good/excellent.

Summary Heading: Your Hilton Diamond business is not appreciate here - stay away!!
Summary: You have to pay for parking - even as a Hilton Diamond member - lifetime status no less.  Hot breakfast is extra - which is usually standard at most Hilton properties but not here.  There "Customer Service " manager was less than cordial in their email response.  STAY AWAY HILTON DIAMOND MEMBERS - BAD SERVICE!!!

Summary Heading: Disgusting, Dirty, Would NEVER recommend this place
Summary: Have you ever stayed in a hotel room with popcorn ceilings? How about a loud blowing AC that is unusable? Hair on the walls of your room? Peeling wallpaper? A sink that doesn't drain? I visited for a business trip this past week. The front desk told me I was upgraded, I absolutely was not. My room was awful and dirty with popcorn ceilings, wallpaper coming off the walls, and a sink that would not drain properly, I had a 1-night stay only. When I was checking out, I told the front desk how dissatisfied I was with my stay and how the "upgrade" was not at all an "upgrade." The front desk told me they didn't know why I was told it was an upgrade since they don't do upgrades at this hotel. Absolutely FILTHY ROOM. Their reply was there was nothing they could do because I didn't call

Summary Heading: Excellent Location and Staff, Bad Policy Change During My Stay
Summary: I have been staying at this hotel for 3 years now when traveling for work. The location is convenient for my work and the staff are always professional, knowledgeable and friendly. Rooms are kept very clean and pricing is good. I do find the mattresses a little to firm but that is just my personal preference. However during my recent stay I had one major issue arise. The 2nd day of my stay I was informed that hot breakfast was no longer included with my room and would now cost an additional $6. The breakfast is a nice inclusion but not worth paying extra for. I was allowed to keep eating the hot breakfast after speaking with management but it left a very bad impression. It is a small amount of money but was a glaring problem with what was and has been in the past a great place

The hotel was clean and comfortable, but a bit old- wall AC/heat units and bathroom was basic tub/shower combo. But very nice for the price (used reward points). Staff was friendly and helpful. Conveniently located near airport.

The meeting room was small and no place to put visuals. The rooms were good size, the food is excellent. Happy hour prices are decent. not much variety on wine, beer or hard liquor. Small but cozy place. will definitely  be back

We had a relaxing 2 nights stay but very disappointed when I found out that they don't have a refrigerator,even a microwave ready in each rooms weeks after I booked our reservation.When we requested for them ,the fridge has missing rack  so we had a very hard time putting all our food inside the fridge.Our bathroom door was hard to lock,as in doesn't lock which kind of disappointing too.No free breakfast and the fountain that i was imagining every time I will look by the window was not even working which I reserved the room with the fountain view.So sad that we never saw the fountain in the center of the lake.But most of the employees are friendly like our housekeeper named Erika{Erica?}

Everything was very well kept and looked nice. The bed was clean with soft sheets, comforter and feather pillows, which I love & is what a care about most when staying at a hotel- I hate cheap, itchy sheets. Everyone was very nice & made themselves approachable for any needs. Checkout is later than most places- noon, so we were able to sleep in a little & take our time getting ready for the day.

Every motel whether it is 1 star or 7 star have complimentary breakfast..and we sat down and having breakfast and all of a sudden a guy came around and was asking ‘Did you guys paid’  C’mon guys we have paid enough for the room and top of it you guys charge for breakfast..so before asking the survey check your self that are we making business better or not

Front desk was not welcoming at all, parking was not very good as it was small parking lot room does not come with a refrigerator I had to request one and the front desk seem Disturbed when I did that

Summary Heading: Not a good showing of the brand
Summary: I don't know if it was policy for everyone or I just didn't present as well to do because I was charged a $50 per day upfront holding fee as well as having my credit card on file for incidentals. Front staff were disdainful and un-welcoming. Housekeeping staff was very helpful and accomidating. To get to pool area you must walk thru lobby, outside front doors, and around to the side of the building. It was kind of embarrassing.

Expensive for what you get. Rooms need USB ports. Overall a good experience though. Clean room. Great variety of channel. Safe area near South Coast Plaza Mall. They have a shuttle. I wasn't made aware of that, but nice to know.

The staff sucks! They are very rude. My room rate came out to more than what my reservation said in the email. They basically said "too bad" contact booking.com to fix the issue. Every interaction with them was terrible. Very rude and unfriendly. NEVER AGAIN.

Summary Heading: ROACHES AND GRASSHOPPERS! BAD ATTITUDE FROM STAFF
Summary: Worst experience EVER. I had to sleep with the lights on because I had grasshoppers and roaches. The staff never even apologized but instead ignored. lied and ran my card without my permission! Disgusting place and people working there. No one has returned my call or email to hopefully this REAL review will help people not deal with this.

Parking was terrible.  The tables in the restaurant at breakfast were not bussed.  There were few people and every single table was dirty and had dishes.  There was one person taking care of everything.  There was no manager on duty at the hotel at any time we tried to find one.

Lakeside rooms could be nice if you could actually see the lake. Do not expect a refrigerator or microwave, and good luck hunting for ice and vending. Room service button on phone, and the “care line” were both dis functional.

The stay here was fine. Room was large and comfortable. The bed was firm and the bathroom had a large counter area for all items. Airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes. Staff was very accommodating. There was street noise on the side facing the main road but the ac drowned  It out.

Summary Heading: Staff nice but room was disappointing
Summary: Staff was super.  Room wasn't the cleanest.  Had moldy smell.  Air conditioner wouldn't adjust, it was cold.  Noticed bug bites all over me after departing. Cookies were really good.  The common areas were clean.

Comfortable King bed in room overlooking the little lake below. Staff courteous and helpful. Disappointed by the snobby and biased man at the valet parking booth outside when we arrived. Otherwise, our stay was lovely. Great location for running to and from several beaches, as well as luxury shopping nearby.

Summary Heading: If it weren't for the parking charges.....
Summary: I was really happy to find a rate in Orange County under $100/night. But when you add a $19/day parking charge, there goes the value quotient. The location is great. Convenient. And the room was clean. Again, if it wasn't for the parking charges, it would've been an ideal stay.

We stayed here last minute last’s night due to a terrible experience elsewhere. Nice warm cookies right at check in which was also nice and speedy. Beds were super comfy and everything seemed very clean. A tad outdated but overall a wonderful experience!

While the staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the room was adequate and clean, there were a few things that made the stay a little less enjoyable. #1 - No book in the room describing hotel amenities or room service menu. #2 - Fryer in the kitchen was broken Friday evening and the "Daily Special" of fish and chips was not available. #3 - When I returned to my room late Saturday evening, I discovered that no sugar had been put out for the coffee (only artificial sweetener). I called down and asked for sugar, and they brought more artificial sweetener. I went down to the dining room and picked some sugar on my own.   I am hopeful that once this location finishes its renovations, these oversights will be corrected. I did enjoy the ambiance of the dining patio by the lake.

the room was smelly and not clean the staff was not friendly, and they did not want to honor my free upgrade as a diamond status member. this hotel does not live up to Double tree standards it was more like a Hampton inn once inside the hotel.

This property should not have the Doubletree sing as service, rooms and breakfast were below norm standards. I will have to reevaluate whether to stay at a Doubletree in the future. There are two Doubletrees across the street from one another and this one should be closed

Summary Heading: Front Desk Incompetency & Lack of Customer Service Skills
Summary: Proactively called 48-hrs and 24-hrs prior to our scheduled trip out from Phoenix as my Autistic son was receiving medical treatment there in Orange County. Upon check-in the Associate seemed to know nothing about my request as my son was in discomfort and falling asleep while the front desk associate attempted to figure it out.  As I attempted to inquire later in the day with an Isabelle regarding my points being used for a Suite when in return we had to receive a standard room her reply was "it was your choice to forfeit your points."

I am usually not very critical but this is one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had, check in was terrible, room was of motel 6 quality. I am terribly turned off by the Hilton brand now. Stay away.

Stayed here using points as it was the least required in the area. I quickly found out why. The arrival experience is particularly bad. A confusing parking lot with cars and trailers randomly parked made it difficult to find the check in. Dark outside. The lobby is run down and consists of about six chairs and a check in desk. The attendant did not mention my Hilton Gold Status or even offer one of their cookies. The rooms are run down by any standard and did not feel clean. The A/C is controlled by a until under the window and was weak. Mattress not comfortable, just a single queen size. The free breakfast was average. 19 dollars for parking in their huge lot was insulting. This hotel needs to be leveled or significantly updated!

Poor service, receptionist was rude and short.  Took family to Disney and this was how they welcomed us with no water for Diamond member, no trash bins in restrooms and shower head not working properly.

When I arrived they had my status as Blue, not diamond.  Not a big deal but difference between free breakfast and not.    Room is ok, small TV.  Room and bath pretty standard.  Corner rooms do have lots of window which was nice.   Very small gym. Only had one treadmill and it wasn’t working all the time. Expect a better gym at a Doubletree of this size. The gym at the Courtyard down the street is much larger with more equipment.   Service in the restaurant for breakfast was nonexistent. I was only offered the Buffett, which was pretty standard.  Not very exciting.    Just an ok hotel. Love the cookie though.

I enjoyed my stay here at Double Tree. The rooms were very clean, spacious and great air conditioner. The only downside was connecting to the wifi and they didn't have a large quantity of mini fridges. I had requested one and never received it nor got a call back to be informed they didn't have any. Overall, it was a good experience.

We had a terrible experience during our stay. I addressed the issue to the front desk, who refused to call the manager to witness the problem.  I called the manager at his direct line the next day after our checkout. No one has ever got back to me.

Very affordable room my daughter and I stayed at for a weekend getaway to Disneyland. Staff was very friendly, hotel was clean. Beautiful pond outside with seating for a great place to eat or just relax. Hot tub could have been a bit warmer in my opinion.  Otherwise a great option when you’re looking to save some $$! Warm cookies at check in were a nice bonus.  Biggest complaint would be the limited parking although valet cost the same as self parking $22 a night!

Summary Heading: Doubletree was ok,  Parking is outrageous
Summary: Stayed here for one night.   Hotel was fine, a small step above Garden Inn or Hampton inn.    But Parking was $19.   And there were no alternative parking locations for less money.   I don't think that I will be staying here again.   Parking was too expensive.

We had to wait to check in because our room wasn’t ready, but other people were given their rooms and they didn’t have a reservation. We got stuck right next to the gym where our room shook every time someone walked or ran on the treadmill. It woke the whole family up at 6am. We were laughed at when we complained to the front desk. Horrible experience, glad we only stayed one night.

Summary Heading: fine for business or short stay
Summary: The hotel is outdated, but clean.  The pool leaves something to be desired.  There were no lounge chairs and the lots of debris floating in the pool and it was right next to the highway.  The location is nice, and the rooms were quiet.

I expect a Doubletree near an airport to fit the needs of east coast and Midwest business travelers. When you’re up at 4:30 and want to work out, the fitness center should be open. It opens at 6:00. Room service doesn’t start until 6:00. Next time I’ll stay at a hotel that meets my timetable.

Room was worst I have ever stayed in. No plug ins to charge phone . Extension cords all over. Air conditioner was so loud  that my ears were ringing in the morning. This property is a tired old property. It needs an entire over hall.

I was expecting a better experience, but it just met the needs. There was a used coffee cup outside our door from previous people, and I look forward to complimentary coffee or tea at service desk and there was none.

Awesome location, very clean and wonderful staff. Breakfast buffet was good, rooms are clean. Centrally located in Irvine CA. Parking was easy. Beds are comfortable and clean. Shower’s water pressure is a bit weak but good enough to use.

Make sure you double check for parking fee - we flew in and they charged for parking fee. They automatically charge even though you don't have a car and did not park on their property.  Not great exp..

Summary Heading: I would NOT stay here again!!
Summary: I got this hotel because it had a 1 BR Suite that I needed for the people travelling with me.  When I got there, it was not a suite at all.  It was one huge room, that had a bad partition that had tv's on either side breaking up the room.  There was a bed on one side and couches / sitting area on the other.  The partition, which was like a cheap tv entertainment center did not go all the way to the ceiling or the wall and made for an uncomfortable stay.  I also paid extra to get the corner 'Lake View' room.  I got a great view of a bunch of huge trees and a tiny little glimpse of a "lake".  Some swimming pools are larger than this "lake". The ice machines on the 4th and 5th floors did not work so I had to go to the 2nd floor to get ice.  Parking costs extra ($18/day) even though

No towels Had to pay for parking yet there was no parking Had to be on the phone with customer service 3+ hours for 3 days in a row and problem isn’t solved  No new towels once they took the dirty ones  No refrigerator  No microwave  AC broken

My daughter had surgery at UCI and your hotel was the closest so that Is where we chose to stay.  I've stayed at DT's in the past so I was hoping this hotel would be the same but it was not. Your property is run down and in in desperate need of a renovation. The valet and bell staff were lovely. Your front desk staff not so much. We checked in to room 303 and we were disgusted with the room. The bathroom drains smelled like sewage the carpets had stains there was dust on all the furniture like no one had stayed there for months. The furniture was so run down it reminded me of my broke and desperate college years. We requested another room and ended up in 310 which was slightly better but not what we requested. We travel often and will never take the risk on staying at another DT

Cookies were offered with my complimentary water, the employees were super nice and gave a lot of great recommendations. Our room was spacious,  clean and fit everyone without being crammed, I would go back.

Summary Heading: Location is good, but had to pay for most everything...
Summary: Besides the "no support" mattress that pretty much killed my shoulders each night, I had to pay for coffee in the lobby of the hotel!  Most hotels at least offer some free coffee in the lobby.  Also, for not being in an inner large city, parking shouldn't cost $19 a night...

Summary Heading: Hotel Facilities are Old, far from nearest restaurant
Summary: I won't recommend this, especially when you have Hilton Tier Class, as you received nothing. The facilities are old, and they don't provide anything not even a tooth brush (as they don't have it stocked)

The hotel was nice, staff was excellent and meeting space was sufficient and went well. I would recommend this location for business or leisure. Beds were comfortable and Restaurant food was nice. There is a walking path right outside the hotel around a pond, that was a nice perk.

Cookie upon check in. Pleasant front desk staff. So far, so good.  That's where it ends. $19 to park. $19 for breakfast - sorry, not worth it.  I thought I was getting a great deal on room rate. Room has dated fixtures. Air had to remain on the entire time. I think there may have been mold on a bathroom fixture. Had to move a lamp to the other edge of the desk just to plug in my phone.  Cooked eggs appeared stuck to the pan. Pancake was too stiff to eat. No real variety when it came to food choices.   Great for a family on a budget. Not my style anymore.

This hotel is clean, affordable and in a very good location with access to the freeway very close by. The rooms could use a little updating. And, newer TVs, too. The hotel staff was very friendly and engaging. Overall a good property to use!

When you charge $159.00 a night, you should have a microwave and refrigerator in all rooms. The in room menu was ridiculous, I mean who charges 17-19 dollars for a hamburger? Then another $19.00 a day for valet weather you use it or not. We went there for a celebration of life, not to be ripped off., so needless to say we will not be back to this location.

Summary Heading: DoubleTree by Hilton Orange County Airport
Summary: Staying here is good for the price, especially for a short business trip. Breakfast items are limited to a small selection of fruit, bacon, potatoes, and eggs. Difficult to eat as a vegan staying here.

I have stayed at this location multiple times in the past, but I had a very bad encounter with the front desk named Jackie on the night of 5/11/19 who was extremely rude to my kids and myself.  She refused to give out cookies and stated that they were reserved only for guests still to check in.  When I came down to talk to her myself she was just ast rude and told me the same thing.  I began to tell her that I checked in on the app and have not received any cookies but she cut me off, gathered a few cookies and slammed them against the counter.  I asked for the manager and was told she was the only one on for the whole night.  I feel ridiculous complaining because of a cookie but that service ruined my whole stay and essentially the rest of my weekend because I was upset and my

Summary Heading: Quiet rooms & very comfortable beds at this hotel !
Summary: My husband & I were very pleased with the friendly, helpful staff. What impressed us the most was the comfortable (soft) mattress we slept on. I woke up w/ NO back pain, amazing. The breakfast buffet was outstanding!

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but not up to the usual DoubleTree standards
Summary: I booked this hotel last minute at a fairly good rate and overall enjoyed the stay with no major complaints and a major complement to the very friendly staff I met at check-in. That said and as many other reviews suggest, the property is just not up to the level of other DoubleTrees and nothing I would suggest at list price.  Don't get me wrong, the rooms are decently upgraded and fairly modern right until you get close in.
