For example, the shower was super low (like good luck 5'8"), charging ports non existent, really old remote style, just small details to consider for sure but with another DoubleTree literally down the block, it doesn't sell booking here (unless you get a much better rate or just need a comfortable room to crash in of course!)  Wandering the property, the

Great location right off of 55.  Minutes away from John Wayne and Newport.  Unfortunately, those were the only positive things I could say about my stay.    Throughout the entire duration of my stay, the parking lot was over capacity.  Not just full, but, overcapacity to the point that cars were parking in the fire lanes and on the grass over the curb.  One night I got in particularly late and there was no one to indicate where to park so I had to park outside of the lot in a lane of traffic.    As other reviewers have mentioned, the fridges were removed from the cabinets.  This is the first time I've seen this in a Doubletree property and when I asked if they had any they told me "they're all in use," so basically no.    On the last day of my stay I wanted to bring this and the

Family trip which was turned out very disappointing.  Room was not cleaned until after 3pm. We had to maneuver around the suite while getting dressed.  While house keeping cleaned up. Over 2 hours late..

Summary Heading: Awful hotel, un-worthy of it's Hilton flag
Summary: This hotel is unworthy of its Hilton flag. Overall the rooms are tired looking and in need of a refresh badly. Particularly in my guestroom, there were deep, yellow stains on the bedsheets. (Picture attached) When I showed the front desk a picture of the stain and requested to speak with a manager, I was told all manager are in a meeting, which was understandable as this was 930am in the morning. Further to the stains on the sheets, I also shared I had to wait an hour the night prior for a bathrobe that I had requested. The desk agent who recorded the delay failed to note this in the property management system and I had to explain the incident over to the agent (Joel) at check-out. As a follow-up to the feedback I had offered I was promised a call later in the afternoon from a

Good airport location in business complex area.  Diverse eateries conveniently nearby. Beware- No Refrigerators in rooms, hotel removed them from (now empty) fridge cabinets.  May be management ploy to have guests utilize overpriced restaurant, which didn't stock my beverage of choice. $18 parking fee, with inadequate parking spaces; thus many parked in NO Parking Fire Access Zone.

Great central location with extremely easy access to freeways.  Basic lodgings ideal for wanderings around the greater LA area. Staff recognized us after a day and were very friendly, keeping the crew supplied with warm cookies each day.

Nice property. It was able to relax every day after a long day at the office. I like the pond that has a walking path. Helped me unwind a bit after work. Paying for parking seemed a bit odd, but, I know it is right by many office buildings so I understand that. $18 a day. The staff was good and friendly. Overall a good stay. Only wish it was in walking distance of more restaurants.

Worst service,They have young kids employed for night service who doesn't understand the seriousness ,doesn't know how to treat the customers and having fun with their colleagues.Checked in the middle of the night ,Traveled with a baby requested hours before checking in microwave and refrigerator,promised it will be there.Got a rude response from the front desk once checked in and finally did nt give both.Be informed before checking in here if you are with young kids.Not worth the money ,have other good hotels in the area.They are spoiling Hilton brand.

Fast, friendly check in and check out. Clean room but could use more electronic friendly outlets.  TV was a small for room.  Walking distance to good casual dining options.   Nice walk/exercise around lake.  Good choices at restaurant with outdoor patio.  Only 5 minutes from airport.

The staff was prompt, receptive, and helpful.  I’ve stayed at other Doubletrees and this is by far the best one I’ve visited in a long time.  King bed room was spacious and clean.  I was particularly pleased by manager Roy Rios’ attentiveness and hospitality.

I was impressed with the professional staff and happy greetings. Everyone was so pleasant and helpful. The shuttle service was wonderful and the driver was extremely friendly. The food was excellent and the service top notch.

Both queen beds had dirt between the sheets, and the shower had hair in it. I am Gold with Hilton, and almost didn't get my complimentary breakfast because the guy taking reservations said I wasn't on the list, and didn't believe me when I showed him my Hilton app. Thankfully the front desk got it resolved.

Summary Heading: Don't expect Hilton just because it's in the name
Summary: Don't expect a Hilton hotel here! Th hotel is only partially updated. The rooms smell musty and old. Even after turndown, I had black specs of dirt on my sheets. The outlets were loose and did not securely hold a plug in them. On a positive note, the staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Clean, but dated. Terrible fitness facilities.  Terrible breakfast choices
Summary: First and last time staying here.    Pros:  1) Convenient to SNA. 2) clean.  Cons: 1) they used a small room to serve as the fitness facility. One treadmill, two elliptical, one recumbent bike that will not stay energized.  Weights. Terrible ventilation (converted hotel room -duh).  Sweat running down the windows.  Smells like a high-school locker room.  2) terrible breakfast. Standard buffet, but eggs had clearly been sitting there too long and had dried out.  Asked the staff for eggs to order and they would not prepare.  Extremely limited choices if you are low carb - everything other than the meat, eggs, and oatmeal is nothing but sugar sugar sugar.  3) really dated hvac unit which is incredibly loud/interrupted sleep.  Hard to regulate temp out of the unit  Overall, while a

We held our company business seminar at the hotel and the staff supporting us was excellent. Great, convenient location. Restaurant was fine and the hotel is very attractive. Front desk staff very friendly and welcoming.

The website promises a restaurant lounge with reasonable dinners and a bar. Neither was actually available. The room was there, but, at 6:45 PM, it was deserted. The full service bar was unstaffed and the only restaurant staff who ultimately showed up was not trained to make mixed drinks. Wine and beer were the only choices. The wine list was pathetic, with only a very limited selection of mediocre wines. The nearest real restaurant was beyond walking distance.

I enjoyed my stay here.  The lake view was nice.  Lots of room in the business suite meeting area.  The staff was very helpful.  If you want a refrigerator, ask for it in advance. $20 is a little high for self service breakfast although the food was good.

Hilton is a good brand and value. We are always surprised when the staff lays back and allows us to haul our own bags. My husband doesn't care, I go out to be waited on and expect my bags to be carried but chose not to make a fuss. Hubby thinks I overtip anyway. I saved lots of money on this trip because of this. Your loss - black people DO TIP WELL!

Summary Heading: Old outdated Hotel!  Not worth the $$$!
Summary: Breakfast is not included, parking is $18 daily, Old outdated rooms, no USB ports, no fridge. Laundry room - old rusted washing machine.  Definitely one of the worst Hilton properties I have stayed in in the USA!

The Diybletree provided all the necessary experience we needed for this couples group getaway retreat. The service, rooms, food quality were par excellence. We have come for this getaway for five years running and our group will continue to do so. Great location and accommodations.

Summary Heading: Leaky windows and excessive parking rates
Summary: I booked a stay at this location and was very disappointed. For some reason I overlooked the $18.00 per day parking fee. And also this fee is approximately the same form self parking.  Beyond the excessive parking rate, my room 613 experienced a large rain leak through the windows or the HVAC system. The floor near the exterior wall was wet through out my stay. The hotel is older and not maintained to a level for me to ever consider staying there again.

I loved my stay, all staff was so nice and helpful. The room was perfect with a beautiful view, the restaurant was really good too. And I love the welcoming with warm cookies they were so good. I will definitely be staying here again :)

Stayed here as part of the Surf City Marathon.  Staff went out of their way to support us, even cheering us when we returned.  Dinner/Breakfast buffets were great and tasty.  Room was comfy, especially the bed.  Close to city buses and the airport

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Surf City Marathon!
Summary: The staff spoiled us with a great breakfast, extra cookies, late check out, free shuttle to the race and free parking. They even had a big celebration welcoming and congratulating us after the race! Our only complaint is that there was not a refrigerator in the room.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel for the Surf City Marathon
Summary: The staff here really does everything they can for the guests. For the Surf City Marathon, they are super organized, with attention the on shuttle to the race and back. The location is convenient, with some restaurants and a starbucks nearby. The bedding is comfortable, and the rooms are quiet. The staff even does a special celebratory greeting upon return from the race! (2018 and 2019 at least) If you have any issues, the staff does everything to help. one of my favorite hotels!

My worst hotel stay with any property. this hotel has a great location with very nice lake view, but the hotel staff will challenge your patient and boundary lines .I was trying to reach out to the front desk on the first night of my stay, I called more than 5 times and listened to hold music for more than 3 minutes but still forwarded to voicemail. When I checked out, the office manager accidentally charged parking fee without my authorization. The office manager didn't apologize or felt sorry even I explained to him that I do not even have a vehicle during this visit. Instead, he said, "Are you sure you didn't park onsite?".(Seriously?)  After a few minutes, he finally agrees to refund the parking fee BUT will call me if he finds out I parked onsite. As a silver member, a

Stayed here for a tournament that was in Irvine. Decent place. Wish there was a fridge and microwave and parking per day was pricey. Overall it was fine. Convenient location and food and drinks nearby

Excellent hotel, staff, internet, freeway access and conveniently located.  Stayed on Thursday and Friday for reasonable rate.  Valet/Self parking daily rate is same price.  First time having their chocolate chip cookies...THE BEST!!!! Thank you,Extremely satisfied

staff are nice and polite but ineffective. Room service isnt edible. property is old and needs renovation. half of the rooms are facing the highway and the noise is crazy loud!  Front Desk staff are incapable of getting it right. and they charge $1 to your CC before you arrive and call it "standard practice" - beware fraud alerts from your cc company!! just save yourself a headache and stay at a different hotel in the area - there are LOTS to choose from.

It's an older building that has been renovated in places...   My room was nice enough- there was space for everything, it was not really "spacious" but lots big for me and my short stay.  The king bed was good- linens were fine, not too worn but not in excellent condition either.  The "upgraded" room was overlooking the small "lake" and had a surprisingly nice view.    Great desk and chair for working, sofabed sitting area with coffee table.  No fridge in room.   The shower was too low... the water came out at about 5'8", so if you are 6'+... it's not a real comfortable relaxing setup.  Typical of older buildings... this place has had a few cosmetic lifts but is in need of an overhaul.  Don't get me wrong- there were no real significant problems, but missing some of the more

There are two Doubletree properties less than a mile apart so make sure you know which one you want. I've stayed at both and liked this one better.  The suite has good space. The property and the rooms are a bit tired and run down but it was fine for a night.   The suite did not have a fridge - which is odd for a suite and really odd for this suite given how much space was just sitting empty. There is actually an opening in the cabinet where a fridge belongs so....  The room was very quiet. I could see traffic out the window but they have good soundproofing. I also didn't notice any hallway or through-the-wall noise.   The A/C is con centrally controlled with is interesting. There are two units in the suite and they worked fine.  The wifi was just ok - not very fast but was at

I stayed at the Double Tree Hilton Orange County because it was nearby the Segerstrom. Center where I attended a play.  After driving three hours, the last thing I wanted to do was get back in my car and find the theater, even though it was under two miles away.  Someone from the parking staff took a hotel van and drove me to and from the theater.  What a pleasant surprise, and I really appreciate the gesture.

No refrigerator.  Bed was too firm.  Rooms need updating.  Entrance and lobby was very small.  It was not what I expected.  Then we drove past a Doubletree By Hilton less than a minute away to get here which is odd.  That is when I realized that this hotel is Doubletree Club By Hilton.  I checked out price difference of both, only $10.  I was too quick when booking the room as we were driving.

Old property. No microwave or fridge in the room. There are only 13 microwaves for the whole hotel and none were available. Bathroom with no exhaust. Bathroom door getting stuck. Stuff is aware of of the problems but all say is "I'm so sorry" with a big smile. I heard that phrase a lot on this stay both with me and other guests. AC was not very good. I can't imagine staying there in the summer.
Manager Response: Dear Dennis K,  Thank you for your review. We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues encountered, and we are working with our team to correct the problems and avoid recurrence going forward. Your feedback is genuinely helpful, as it is the first step in identifying areas where we can better our guest services. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again.

Summary: Had the opportunity to stay here for a night.  It is in a great near the 405/55 freeway.  There is a small but charming artificial lake in front of the hotel.  Great to have coffee or a drink in the evening and enjoying the view.  The hotel itself is showing its age but the decorations help!  Room is a decent size, clean, and beds were comfy.  Staffs were friendly and sociable.  Went over all the details and showed me where everything are.  Bonus points for the cold water bottles and warm cookie!  The Good: * Services  * Free toiletries from Crabtree & Evelyn * Mini-market, Starbucks, and a few restaurants within walking distance   The Bad: * Parking fee is ridiculous * Skip the restaurant  * Room views

Parking was included on my reservation however when i ask about the $18.00 charge Jackie at front desk said there was nothing she could do about it!  The breakfast was not fresh at 745 a.m. really sad because i stay in this area 3x per week

Summary Heading: Once We Found the CORRECT DoubleTree... We Encountered Some Problems...
Summary: I’ll say up front that The DoubleTree Club is a clean hotel, in a very nice neighborhood, convenient to the airport - but not AT the airport, so air traffic noise is not a problem.  The staff are friendly.  Perhaps being on the road for a week made me (more) cranky (than usual), but my wife & I discovered a number of problems with this hotel.    I suppose this might have begun from the moment we approached the intersection of McArthur Place and McArthur Blvd, following our GPS unit in search of the hotel.  My wife & I were confused upon seeing a DoubleTree at the intersection, yet our GPS indicated we were to turn at McArthur Place into a grouping of tall buildings across the street (McArthur Blvd.) from that DoubleTree.  About two blocks later we came upon the DoubleTree Club

Convenient location near the airport if you are passing through for short stay.  There is self parking option for additional charge.  The hotel is easily confused with the other Doubletree location.  Luckily both are fairly closed to each other.

Summary Heading: Fine Hotel, but better options nearby
Summary: good hotel, weird location, gym is on the floor with rooms and doesn't open early enough.  Not terrible, but think there are better options nearby at similar prices so I wouldn't stay here again, and I stay at tons of OK hotels for work

This property does not come near Hilton’s usual standards.  Rooms are in disrepair and filthy. Food served in their breakfast room was inedible. Towels were threadbare and dingy. Staff was indifferent to all guests. Absolutely no benefit for loyal Hilton Honors members. Avoid this dumpy place at all costs.

Internet not included with room. Scam to get you to join Hilton Honors to get free internet and then it didn't work. No way to easily contact front desk from room for help - phone in room doesn't connect to a live person.

Summary Heading: Treadmill less than 2 feet from my head
Summary: One of the worst experiences of my life.  I flew in from Boston, 12 hours door to door to reach the hotel. It was 1am, and I collapsed in bed. I had a critical meeting / presentation to give the next day.  I set my alarm to wake up at 9am. Happy to get 8 hours of sleep. At 5:43am, I heard bombs exploding. The room was shaking. Boom. boom. boom.  It turns out, my room was adjacent to the gym.  My head was literally less than 2 feet away from a treadmill, which some animal was using, and causing my entire room to shake.  I called the front desk. They sent security to ask the gym users to be quiet.  No effect. By 630 I moved rooms, and was unable to sleep thereafter. I lost more than 3 hours of precious sleep. Sleep is the ONLY reason I needed a hotel room to begin with. I could

Summary Heading: Small (4 floors?). Odd location. Great staff.
Summary: There is another Doubletree literally a half mile down the road from this one. Cannot understand why. Did this used to be a timeshare or something? So odd; have never stayed in a Hilton that's only four stories--esp when this is surrounded by high rises. The low ceilings gave it a bit of a creepy feel, I have to admit. I had the last parking spot in the lot, not sure what others would do when they arrived. Room was decent though, clean and great pillows, etc. Fridge and coffee maker (but older model, not Kureg). Restaurant staff and front desk was terrific.

There are 2 Doubletrees in the area so be sure which was the one you have a reservation with. I git an Uber to bring me to the hotel from The Waterfront Beach Resort and he actually drove me to DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Santa Ana - Orange County Airport. I noticed the mistake and we moved on to the correct to DoubleTree by Hilton - Orange County Airport. This place offers shuttle ride with the neighbourhood and I used it to get to and back from the nearby South Coast Plaza which is a good place to shop and dine.

Booked hotel online for about $160 for one night. On arrival staff were unfriendly and slow. Had to pay to park in an empty parking lot. Nothing included in this hotel. No wifi, no breakfast, no parking, no microwave or fridge and even no fan in the bathroom. Pool facility was dirty. Gym was tiny. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone and most definitely would not stay here again. Wouldn't be as bad if it was priced like a budget hotel. Not at all like a Hilton hotel, they shouldnt even have that in their name.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at end of September, had a great stay while we visited the area, room was spacious and clean and quiet, Staff were very polite and helpful and the welcome cookie was a nice treat. Ate in the restaurant on the first night as we had just arrived from England food was nice and well presented.  WiFi was free as Hilton Honors members so not sure if there was a charge but signal was good.   I would definitely  stay again if in this area.

The front desk was nothing but rude and unpleasant. They never made any attempt to show that they cared about their job, and certainly not the hotel guests. Our 18 month old got locked in our room and after multiple calls to the front desk, no one ever came. I finally tracked down housekeeping on our floor to open up the door. We were leaving at 9pm but had reserved our room for the full night in order to keep our children happy and satisfied since they are young. We let the front desk know we were leaving and they retorted “well you’ll still be checked out tomorrow morning”...okay!? Nothing else. They also has not done cleaned our room when we got back from the day at 8pm. The beds were unmaid, no new towels or shampoo/conditioner for our family of four. We are Hilton Grand

I have stayed at this Doubletree Club Hotel every Fall since 2010. As an event planner I found the staff competent, friendly and helpful. Excellent accommodations. As a guestrooms were comfortable. Food fantastic.

Summary Heading: Don't Expect the Usual Doubletree Experience
Summary: Don't confuse this with the nice, new DoubleTree down the street. Or any other DoubleTree that you may have stayed at.  This is an old dingy hotel hidden amongst office buildings and is a 'DoubleTree CLUB' hotel - whatever that means.  Guessing an old hotel with a new logo slapped on it.  Room was dingy with saggy beds, noisy/funky a/c unit, no refrigerator, and super unhelpful staff.  Would NOT stay here again. The only pro is that it is close to the airport, but with so many other better choices - choose elsewhere!

I chose this hotel because it was less than 10 minutes from the John Wayne airport plus the room charge was less than a hundred bucks per night.  Valet parking was the same price as self park.  Since I arrived so late they just left my car out in front which made my departure quick the next morning.  Upon check in, I was given the standard warm  cookie and a free bottle of water.  Check out was fast with my option of getting a printed or emailed folio summary.  The first thing I noticed after entering my room was the musty smell.  I had to crank up the air conditioner to try and move the air around.  I don’t like these through wall air conditioners as they were too noisy (especially when the compressor shuts off)  The room condition was somewhat updated but still looked old.

The hotel charges a $16 a day fee just to park (as if you have other options) they charge for internet access and the rooms smell of heavy mildew and are incredibly humid.  This hotel is not worth it!!!

Parking Guys were very pleasant. They wouldn't even take a tip. They would run around and open your door.  Please enjoy your stay.  Please let me know if yiu need to he shuttle anywhere.  Would visit aging

I stayed here with my son for an Angels game on 9-29-18. The hotel seemed nice from what I saw on the internet so I booked it through Expedia. When we were being checked in, I was told there is an $18 per night parking fee. It was too late in the evening to look for another room so I didn’t complain. We made it to our room and the first thing we noticed was the smell. The room smelled like a damp musty older hotel. Then I started noticing that the room was an older hotel that had gone through some renovations. TV was rather small, no refrigerator, oh well it’s my sons Birthday weekend so I keep my mouth shut. I call down to the front desk for the WiFi password. Get hooked up to the internet and find out later I’ve been charged $9.95 per night for WiFi, really??     Next morning

I had a meeting in Anaheim and an early flight out of SNA, so I stayed here. This was a very good stay. The place is conveniently located, in front of a lake, and very close to SNA. Rooms are comfortable and nice. The staff is friendly and the breakfast buffet was delicious. I would easily stay here again.

This is an older property ...  1.  the sliding door to the bathroom is not smooth 2.  the wall paper in the bathroom is visibly peeled at the edges 3.  Lobby is small 4.  I had to report to the staff multiple times that the door to the building from pool was not working  5.  Ventilation is not good -- very humid  The pool is impeccably maintained -- water sparkling and the plaster seems new. The chairs had fresh towels draped over them 1st thing in the morning.  Breakfast at the lounge is decent ( potatoes are dry).  Per DoubleTree traditions, we were offered warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in

Summary Heading: A great place in Orange County - a real find!
Summary: This Doubletree Club is very reasonably priced.  Staff are exceptionally friendly - everyone from valets out front to breakfast staff to front desk and housekeeping.  They all seem to really like working there and make you feel very welcome.

Great GM, and the hotel staffs. Made me feel like I was at home. Thank you guys a lot for making my stay the best. Greeted me every time I came in. Also the bus boys was awesome as well. I even brought back pizza to them. Those guys was always on it. 💯

Have been traveling here for two years, and the hotel has been in constant decline.  It’s dated.  Staff is great, but amenities are inconsistent.  It’s a hotel needing a refurbishment, but a decent value for what I’m paying and tolerable for a weekend.

Excellent hotel the staff was very friendly and helpful, we came to play a soccer tournament for the weekend, all the amenities we needed were excellent lost of restaurants around and the hotel breakfast was excellent.

Old and dirty. Very surprised that this Double Tree has similar rates to other local hotels but this one is very old. The rooms need updating and also a thorough cleaning. It is close to the airport if that is your need.
Manager Response: Hello Mail_pnewman  Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay at the Doubletree Club Hotel Orange County Airport, CA. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any aggravation or inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Please be confident that we will follow-up on the points you have outlined to the executive team. The time taken along with the effort made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. Feedback from our guests is vitally important in our mission to be the first choice of the world’s travelers. We want you as our guest and are hopeful that you will afford us the opportunity to provide lodging services in the future.

Summary Heading: Never come back to the same hotel again!
Summary: I had a very hard time to park my car after my business meeting. I had to wait almost 20 mins to have someone take off before I could have a parking spot. Secondly, I have a longhair need to have more shampoo to wash it. The room service would come with extra shampoo in abit. I had to call to remind them 4 times after 1 hours later. End up I had to go the the lobby get it myself.
Manager Response: Thank you for participating in our Guest Survey for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. I am sorry it was difficult to locate a self parking spot, but we do also have valet services that could have been used at no additional charge so you did not have to wait. As for the room service not delivering these extra items, will certainly be following up with the respective department heads to ensure we are following through with each request. Again, I am truly sorry you encountered these issues with your stay but am very thankful you reached out to advise.

Summary Heading: Stay at the Marriott across the street
Summary: We were there for my son’s wedding as well as all of our out of state families and friends. We checked in on Fri 8/24 and soon found out one of their two elevators were out of service. They assured us they were working on it. This is a large hotel with 7 floors and just about sold out. We spent at least 15 to 20 minutes 4 or 5 times a day waiting, all the time being told “we are working on it”. Taking the stairs was not an option for my husband who is disabled. This continued throughout the entire weekend. One elevator for hundreds of guests and we just kept hearing the same thing.  On Sunday upon checkout they decided to open the service elevator to their guests. The woman who checked us out was rude and extremely unprofessional. When I requested to speak to a manager she
Manager Response: Thank you for participating in our Guest Survey for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. I would like to apologize that our services fell short of your expectation. Comments such as yours are great tools for us as we use that for re-training our team to ensure each guest has a great time whilst staying with us. The issues you mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary: The hotel is clean and has a great view of the man-made pond from some rooms and the outdoor sitting of the restaurant/bar.  What makes it very good is the staff ....and especially manager Michael at the front desk!!! Helpful, expedient, funny and professional!!! Thank you!!!

The hotel is about 5 min from the airport yet it took multiple phone calls and more than a half hour for the courtesy shuttle to come pick me up. It is an older hotel and is so-so concerning the rooms. Just don’t look at the dirty ceilings and you may be able to sleep. I won’t be staying here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey in regards to your recent stay. I would like to apologize that we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned. We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Good option near Orange County Airport.
Summary: The rooms are starting to look a little old, but they are spacious and clean.  Decent price for what it is.  Good service, which counts for a lot.  $17 for self or valet parking is unfortunate, I gather this is the norm in this area, or I'd be upset.

This is a lovely area with a relaxing pond in front. It's close to the airport. Nothing fancy, but clean and amenable, with comfortable rooms and helpful staff.There is small pool to enjoy too, as well as fresh baked chocolate chip cookies.

I came with my daughter soccer team. I booked two reservations and the service agent was able to help me separate the bookings. It was quite late and I had a headache due to driving from Santa Barbara with two children. The agent, I believe Bernice, kept a conversation going and was able to lift my daughters spirits up with warm cookies and cracking joke, She made a difficult and long process easy and fun. Before we knew it we were on our way to our room. She said it was her first day on the job on her own, but she was a natural. Great service all around. Will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Customer Service is a foreign language here.
Summary: The Manager Joann is completely incapable of holding a job in CUSTOMER SERVICE. We needed a place for our Daughter & Granddaughter to stay during a recent evacuation from the fires close to their home. I made the reservations for this location for them to stay due to the location & easy access to the freeway. I am a Hilton Honors Member & booked the hotel direct using my CC. Joann would not check them in because they didn't have the credit card in hand. I spoke with Joann via phone in attempt to resolve the situation due to extreme unforeseen situation of fire evacuation, Joann could only repeat "unfortunately we cannot check them in unless they have the credit card" x4. I was helpless. She had no offer of solution other than find another place to stay & cancel this reservation!
Manager Response: Hello Renae M,  I would like to thank you for taking the time to fill out this survey. I am truly sorry to hear of your family having to evacuate due to the recent fires. I want to also thank you for your loyalty with Hilton. I understand that the reservation was made using your account and the  credit card that was used to hold the reservation is for guarantee only, as we require a valid credit card and matching ID at check-in (for safety reasons for our guest). I truly apologize for any aggravation or inconvenience you may have encountered and thank you again for your understanding.

Summary: Comfortable hotel. Decent breakfast.  Quiet rooms.  The only problem was red long hairs found on my pillow case. My hair is short and black and my girl's is blonde.  The only way to get to the pool is outside front door of hotel.  Friendly and helpful staff.

Weekend stay for daughter's soccer tournament was blocked as quite a few people of from the team stayed there.  Complimentary breakfast was sufficiently stocked with many options for all from fruit to cereals.  Found a couple small insects in room we stayed in.  There appeared to be a small fridge in the room where we stayed but when we opened the cabinet, to my surprise no small fridge.  Overall experience was okay.

Staff very helpful and courteous.  Had dinner in hotel one evening and it was wonderful.  Kids loved the pool and a nice lake to walk around.  Kids loved the ducks, fish and turtles in lake.  Laundry room available for guests.

Doubletree in OC was great. Firm beds, clean linens, friendly and easy check in and out. The restaurant staff gave good local recommendations. Valet service guys parked our rental car closeby. No problems.

The location was convenient but everything else was so bad that I checked out after only one night. Was put in a first floor room that was only one of two on that level. I raised concern and was assured by the gentleman at the front desk that it was one of the better rooms. The musty smell from the loud ac units was barely tolerable. The noise and light from the parking lot was not the worst. The debris on the carpet looked like insulation from the ac units. The 3 silverfish that scurried from the bathroom are lucky to be alive as they made it back under the carpet before I could smash them. But the spider that greeted me on my morning trip to the bathroom was too much to handle. Upon checking out, I barely got a response from the front desk clerk. At least she didn't charge me
Manager Response: Hello KH2432,  Thank you for taking the time to write us in regards to your recent stay. This survey helps us in improving our customer service as well as address any and all issues encountered by our guests. I do sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your. This is certainly not indicative of the standards we are measured against for our guests, and I have discussed this with the rest of our team so we can make necessary changes. I appreciate you letting us know of your stay.

Summary Heading: Hotel NOT to Hilton Honors level of service and cleanliness
Summary: Stayed July 26th-28th, 2018. One person at front desk at check in at 2:30 P.M.while four people in line. Though fast at desk, no extra help provided to get folks to their rooms.  My wife had clean white socks on as we walked around our room. Within little time those socks were very dirty on the bottom and she took them off. Soon, the bottom of her feet were dirty. The bathroom sink smelled as though it was connected directly to the sewer below as I brushed my teeth.  My concern over HIILTON HONORS consistency is this: traveling 30-40 nights a year, I use the chain almost exclusively and I do not know of another Doubletree where Diamond/Gold members are charged for cafeteria-style food without choice of ordering items from a menu (ie eggs, omelettes, etc.) Those items are extra,
Manager Response: Hello 594barryp  Thank you for participating in our Guest Survey for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. The comments are insightful and helpful for the hotel team’s goals to improve the service, rooms, and the public areas of the hotel. Please accept our team’s sincere apology for the failures in service that resulted in any inconvenience and lack of comfort. The issues you mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary: This Hotel could use a modernization, rooms were ok but definitely need an upgrade, old and musty smelling, air conditioning units are loud and work marginally, the $17 / Day Parking fee should not be charged to hotel guests. definately wont stay here again, would rather pay a little extra to get a better nights stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay at the Doubletree Club Hotel Orange County Airport, CA. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Please be confident that we will follow-up on the points you have outlined to avoid recurrence. Again, thank you for your time and review.

Summary: Inadequate parking for number of rooms available. Water, especially warm felt sticky. When I got home to get a real shower, whatever was in the water came off in my home shower. Front desk somewhat aloof and self-absorbed.
Manager Response: Hello Hamiltonlb,  Thank you for participating in our Guest Survey for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. The comments are insightful and helpful for the hotel team’s goals to improve the service, rooms, and the public areas of the hotel. Please accept our team’s sincere apology for the failures in service that resulted in any inconvenience and lack of comfort. We are very grateful for the choice you made to be a guest of the hotel. We will continue striving to provide a hospitality level that exceeds other available lodging choices. The issues you mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary: Horrible experience.  Please stay somewhere else.  Property is pretty but the room and customer service and attitude were horrible.  We were charged fees that we were told we would not be, we had a request a refrigerator after arrival and our room smelled horrible moist and moldy.  They changed our room immediately as if they had heard this about that room before and weren't surprised.  Line to check is was long. Staff not apologetic about problems, just had an attitude.  Won't ever stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Krys J,  On behalf of the DoubleTree Club OC Airport staff, I would like to first thank you for filling out this survey. This survey helps us in improving our customer service as well as address any and all issues encountered by our guests. Please accept our team’s sincere apology for the issues you encountered. This is certainly not indicative of the standards we are measured against for our guests and have brought these issues to the attention of the respective department heads ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I truly apologize for these issues and would like to thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: I think the average rating speaks for itself
Summary: I expected more from a Hilton property. I always thought Double Trees were supposed to be a step up from Hampton properties. Not this particular property.   Location was nice. Front desk staff were AWESOME.  Pleasant, flexible & efficient. LOVED the fresh baked cookie at check in! As close as hotel is to the airport, I never heard any airplane noise.   I didn't get to try the breakfast items - I think I misunderstood whether or not I was eligible for comp meal due to my status.  The room: In need of some updated furniture. I think there was 1 lamp that had usb ports, but not near the bed. Pillows were awful! Never got more than a couple of hrs of sleep throughout evening. Suffered next day w/pain in my neck. Bedside desk lamps caked with dust - there isn't too much furniture in
Manager Response: Hello Joanne R,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. I appreciate the kind words about the front desk staff and am so glad to see that there were able to exceed your expectations but, would like to apologize that the room did not meet those same standards. Please know that I have passed along your comments in regards to the room condition to the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated.

Summary: Lobby was nice and staff was Great. It was getting towards the end of breakfast and the french toast dried up. I would have ordered from the menu but no one ever asked me. They just took my money, said welcome to the buffet and walked off. I would stay here again, it's a good spot overall.

My first stay at this property was a disappointment.  Front desk staff seemed disinterested in general.  I understand check in is 3pm but when I tried to check in early I was told it was not possible.  I asked if the would call me when a room was available.  In previous experiences with other hotels, this was not a problem but I was told "no" and I could call them later.  Eventually checked in and the room was a bit dated. I found a used fork by the side of the bed and the bathroom had hair in the tub and broken shower curtain.  My biggest concern was the valet parking.  I had an early AM flight and checked out before the valet came on duty.  I was given my key and pointed in the direction of the valet parking area.  I could not find my car.  After a few minutes a guy comes over
Manager Response: Hello Gary O,  Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey in regards to your recent stay. I would like to apologize that we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned. We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and truly apologize for these issues.

Summary Heading: Old dirty hotels long in the tooth rusty plumbing dirty rugs just an old hotel that needs upgrade
Summary: Okd dirty hotel Needs a rehab Rusty vents and plumbing fixtures Smelly noisy air conditioner That doesn’t cool Disgrace of a hotel Embarrassing  Dirty rugs  Staff was nice  We were told if we checked our early there would be a $50 fee, now we know why, everyone would back out and go elsewhere We were trapped.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for your comments about your recent stay at the Doubletree Club Hotel Orange County Airport, CA. I would like to express my sincere apologies for falling short of our commitment to extend a rewarding experience due to unsatisfactory services during your stay. The Voice of our Customers is critical to ensuring our guests receive a rewarding experience when staying at the Hilton Portfolio of Brands. I have passed along your comments to the respective departments and again, thank you for bringing this concern to our attention.

Summary: We recently took our family to Knott's Berry Farm & Disney's California Adventure Park over 3 Days. After driving from Las Vegas in time for Knott's to open, & spending the day there...we made our way to our hotel, The Doubletree club by Hilton Orange County. Valet & check in were painless! After getting kids settled, we ventured to the main lobby to enjoy a cocktail before bed. Awesome bar lounge with great specials. The view from our room was amazing with the beautiful fountain outside. Room service was always brought up in a short amount of time from placing our orders. We're already booked for our next trip to Miami, and the Hilton Miami was a no-brainer!. Trust in the brand & the name, and you will always be more than happy with your stay. Join the hilton honors program,

Great location and service from the staff.  Clean room with comfortable accommodations.  The food at the restaurant was also good.  It is close enough you can walk to Starbucks as well which is a plus.  I would definitely stay here again.

The rooms were nice, it was very quiet at night, so that was nice. Given there was a lot of vacation traffic in the hotel.  My only beef is that for a business traveler the hotel doesn't have enough plug ins to support all the electronic devices needing to be charged. Had I been here for pleasure with a family, this could have been problematic. Staff was nice, restaurant is good in a pinch!

The room was great and comfortable.  Got it at a great price.  The service was outstanding, from the front desk to housekeeping. The location was a little confusing at first but near a lot of restaurants.

Wow I’ve never seen such a bad DoubleTree. I stayed here for a conference. Upon arrival there was one person working the front desk with a long line. This was on a Friday afternoon with a conference arriving. I had already done digital check in but that didn’t matter. Upon getting to my room I was hit with a terrible smell. I thought it was just from an obviously old room but eventually I couldn’t stand it and switched rooms. The new room was marginally better but still had a musty smell. I was given a new room but no assistance with luggage or anything else. I ordered room service on Friday night. On Saturday the housekeeper didn’t clear the tray and just put it right in front of my door. On Sunday when I checked out it was still there with 2-day old food on it! The elevators
Manager Response: Hello Katshif,  I want to thank you for the time you have taken to inform us about your recent stay. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any aggravation or inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Please be confident that we will follow-up on the points you have outlined to avoid recurrence. We want you as our guest and are hopeful that you will afford us the opportunity to provide lodging services in the future. Thanks for your ongoing loyalty and understanding.

Summary: Beautiful, comfortable hotel!! The lake next to the hotel is great. It has a walking trail next to it. Restaurants close by.  It is very quiet.  The beds were so comfy. South Coast Plaza is also so close .
Manager Response: Hello Tiina D,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. I was so glad to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay and our comfy beds. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: The staff was friendly and professional.  The hotel is definitely older but it was clean and everything was in working order with no issue.  It was a safe environment.  Room service was really great as well.  There is a parking fee of $17 which is something that really irks me but maybe that is standard for this area.

Only one person at check in desk on a Friday evening at 5pm, poor restaurant staff, rude and barely comprehended English.  There was a cabinet in room, which normally house a small refrigerator, it was bare.
Manager Response: Hello fredbrownjr2,  First I want to thank you for taking the time to fill out this review for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. I would like to apologize that our services fell short of your expectation. Comments such as yours are great tools for us as we use that for re-training our team to ensure each guest has a great time whilst staying with us. The issues you mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Do not stay at this hotel
Summary: Got in late and the front desk person refused to give us the room with 2 beds. They lie and said all their room sold out when their website shows available. I will not pick this hotel, their customer service is terrible. The room was very small, room has one full size bed and a pull out sofa size of a twin bed. The heat was noisy,  the room smell. Stay away from this hotel. There are many available hotels within the area. This hotel was not provide the typical Hilton experience.

Was at hotel 10 hours to sleep.  Got in late and had many problems with room.  Anxious to sleep, didn't change rooms (already unpacked, problems discovered serially, drip-drip).  Worst was that Heat mode caused smell of burnt dust (skin).  I felt like I was literally breathing the skin of past months occupants.
Manager Response: Hello jimbjamn,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay at the Doubletree Club Hotel Orange County Airport, CA. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any aggravation or inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Please be confident that we will follow-up on the points you have outlined to avoid recurrence. The time taken along with the effort made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. Feedback from our guests is vitally important in our mission to be the first choice of the world’s travelers. We want you as our guest and are hopeful that you will afford us the opportunity to provide lodging services in the future.  Thanks for your ongoing loyalty and understanding.

Summary: Double Tree is Always a great choice. My daughter goes for the warm cookies. However, We need milk to go with them. We could not even purchase at time of checkin. It was very disappointing to say the least.

And really close to the fwy. I was reasonably certain I could change lanes on the south bound 55 freeway from the relative comfort of my bed. Nice staff, but breakfast was served beneath construction workers pulling CAT5 cable over us.
Manager Response: Thank you for participating in our Guest Survey for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. I was glad to see that the staff interaction you received was a nice experience. However, please accept our team’s sincere apology for the failures in service that resulted in any inconvenience and lack of comfort. The issues you mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary: Overall a good experience. Location of the hotel is not noticeable. However  the lake/pond enjoyable for everyone .BEAUTIFUL. nice to walk around and even  take a walk around the pond/lake  to site seeing and grab a bite to eat or get STARBUCKS
Manager Response: Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. I was so glad to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated.

Summary: Be prepared to carry your own luggage. I arrived 10 at night, i had to carry my own luggage upstairs. They didnt have a luggage cart available. Hilton members make sure you ask for your bottled water. This did not feel like a Hilton property.
Manager Response: Hello JenniferO1256UY,  I would like to thank you for taking the time to submit a review in regards to your recent stay with us. I would like to apologize that our services fell short of your expectation. This is certainly not indicative of the standards we are measured against for our guests and your comments mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Charged twice, front desk people were rude.
Summary: My card was charged twice resulting in most my funds being inaccessible to me during my vacation. The front desk people were so rude I was almost in tears. I called corporate and the manager, never received a call back.
Manager Response: We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.

Summary Heading: Good Value, but a bit dated. Nice Duck pond nearby.
Summary: This hotel is a bit dated, with yellow tile in the shower, a “thick and small” flat screen TV and almost tiger print carpeting on the floor but the price was right for a quick get a way. Located in Santa Ana (very close to Orange county airport), it only a few minutes to the beach cites like Newport.  Rooms are fairly good size (I had two queens so maybe one King feels less cramped) but a wall jetting out from the bathroom for no particular reason for it to be there made moving around less then comfortable for us in the room.   Rooms were clean upon arrival however the in room safe was locked and no one was able to unlock it without removing it and replacing it, a bit more time consuming then we were willing to wait for so we let it be.  Beds were comfortable along with the

Summary Heading: Another stay. Great location. Beautiful lake with ducks and geese. SyaShere once or twice every month gorr work. Great s
Summary: Great location and wonderful staff. Can beat the serenity. Only negative is the old outdated ac units. They are noisy at night. The breakfast is super. Lots of choices. You can even take your meal out by the lake..
Manager Response: Hello Ed,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Good, clean and moderately priced hotel close to the Orange County Airport. 10 min drive to the tech offices in Irvine & Spectrum center and 10 mins to Newport beach. Like the self-checkin option, and use of Digital key (Go green!!).
Manager Response: Hello Neell0hit,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay and the Digital key option. Thank you again for your time to fill out this survey.

Summary: Staff was excellent. Valets helpful and efficient .Room was clean and comfortable. Would very definitely stay here again. Check in quick and easy. Just loved it. Bed was the most comfortable bed ever.
Manager Response: Hello I3029EYhenrym,  On behalf of the DoubleTree Club OC Airport staff, I would like to first thank you for filling out this survey. I'm very happy to hear that you had a wonderful experience with us! We pride ourselves in bringing the best in customer service, and I'm happy to hear that we were able to do just that! We sincerely thank you for the warm comments and the great TripAdvisor review.

Summary: Close to the airport.   Older building with other DoubleTree properties near by.   Parking is very limited.  Breakfast is decent.  Quantities limited.  and valet parking is the same as self park.  Nearest restaurants about 1 mile away.

Summary Heading: Great stay while attending the NPE trade show.
Summary: While this hotel is miles from the Anaheim convention center, when you have a major trade show in town, it's nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of a busy show. It was basically a $22 Uber ride each way, a lot less then a rental car and parking would've been!  This hotel is in a business park area, had a great breakfast buffet, and does have a bar and a happy hour.  At the front desk, Jessica and Leslie were so helpful!  Anything we needed during the trip, they were happy to assist… This included the shuttle for the airport, recommendations on things to do in the area, and assistance during our stay.  I will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Loved my stay here! I did not get my usual survey in my email so I wanted to let everyone know they did a great job! Jasmine was super nice and generous upon check-in and Jessica was very helpful with requests!   Breakfast was great and the views on the 6th floor were awesome! 100% would recommend!
Manager Response: Hello Gina P,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. Thank you again for your loyalty and for being a Hilton Honors member.  We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary Heading: No longer our first choice in Orange County
Summary: This used to be our "go to" property when flying into SNA and going to Disneyland. The hotel is convenient to the airport and provides a shuttle if you don't have a car. However, it has really gone downhill over the years.  Long ago parking was free, now it is a $17 fee for a very small lot. If you come back late in the evening or if they have an event going on you are going to be forced to use their valet service. While it is the same price, you will feel obligated to tip which of course raises the cost of the service.  The rooms themselves are ok but nothing special. It has been quite a while since they were last remodeled and the age is starting to show. The rooms can be somewhat noisy as the hotel is right by the 55 freeway. We stayed in a corner room, but were far enough
Manager Response: Hello wwwdrich,  Thank you for participating in our Guest Survey for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. Please accept our team’s sincere apology for the failures in service that resulted in any inconvenience and lack of comfort. The issues you mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary: Went there for a business trip, good hotel and conveniently located from the freeway. There are a few restaurants near the hotel as well. The restaurant at the hotel was also good and can give it a try. Breakfast was good with quite a few options, not for vegetarians though. Beds were comfy, rooms and bathrooms were reasonably big. They have a parking lot if you want to park your car but they do charge for it.

So if you have a certain standard or expectation of a Doubletree...this is not it. This particular location is more akin to a Motel 6. The staff were helpful and polite. No issues there. The property is just dated and the rooms have the "grimy" feel when you walk in. Dirty grout in the tile. Hair on the counters (that is not yours). And wires randomly running through the room which are pseudo hidden by the baseboards. Our plan was to stay for three nights on business. We were able to stay one night and then cancel the remainder (thanks again to the hotel staff) and go elsewhere. My recommendation if you need a hotel in this area - stay at the Doubletree about a block and a half away on MacArthur.
Manager Response: Hello Richard M,  Thank you for taking the time to fill out this survey for your stay at the Doubletree-Santa Ana, CA. I would like to apologize that our services fell short of your expectation. Comments such as yours are great tools for us as we use that for re-training our team to ensure each guest has a great time whilst staying with us. The issues you mentioned have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience. Once again, I would like to thank you for your review.

Summary: My quick one-night stay at the Doubletree was perfectly fine.  The property appears to be a bit older, but is in very good shape, with not much noticeable from the wear and tear.  The staff at the front desk was excellent.  The bed was comfortable, although the pillows were a little hard.  All in all, this was a perfectly fine business stay.
Manager Response: Hello Matt S,  Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey in regards to your recent stay. I was so glad to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your positive comments about the excellent front desk staff has been passed to the entire staff and complimented on a job well done! The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary Heading: Awful Day Staff!!! Night staff are the best!!!
Summary: I checked in for my guest who was visiting from out of town. My guest had an unpleasant experience. This is her comments: "Where do I begin? It was a 1 day stay on the 16th.-17th. The Day front desk/check in staff must go through a refresher on how-to-treat-customers-better course over again. (Avoid checking in between 9am-3:59pm. The night staff were fantastic, attentive, and was treated with respect and care...like night and day.) Anyways, I called beforehand to ask about parking and did not get the proper help and answer I was looking for, instead what I got was a snippy and dismissive response when asked about description of the parking. All she have to say was "There is no parking structure, it is an outdoor ground level, open air parking lot just in front of our main

This is the 3rd year ive stayed at the Doubletree for the Surf City Marathon weekend and i highly recommend it.  They really cater to the runner's from the carbo loading dinner to the free breakfast, shuttles, late check out, etc.  And i think the staff cheers louder for us upon our return than people at the finish line!  Thanks again to Michelle + staff there and as long as i continue to do this race, i will stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated.We are looking forward to welcoming you back next year!

Summary: We stayed here as the host hotel for the surf city half marathon, they were very accommodating to us,  they served breakfast earlier so we had time to eat and run (lol) and they gave us late checkout at 2 pm!!  When we arrived back from the race we were greeted by a line of staff cheering us on.  They also handed us a cold bottle of water and freshly baked cookies (yum).  Thank you for making this weekend great!!

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay Surf City Half Marathon
Summary: The hotel was so comfortable but the most impressive thing to me was how well organized the hotel was for the Marathon participants. The shuttle service was well organized, the breakfast was great and was provided early for race participants and their families EARLY so we could actually eat BEFORE the race. Upon return the staff lined up and clapped and made lots of noise and welcomed the runners back and we were given one of those amazing cookies and a cold bottle of water. We were also automatically given a 2pm check out as well as having our parking comped. I will ALWAYS stay here for this event and hope that they pick up any other races in the orange county area. I was soooooo impressed!! Thank YOU!!

Our stay here was wonderful! We've done tons of races over many years all over the country and never seen a hotel so accommodating to the racers. Michelle did a great job arranging our shuttle and we had no worries the whole time. Definitely would come back thank you.

The DoubleTree Club offered a race rate for those of us running in the Surf City Marathon & 1/2 a few miles away in Huntington Beach. The rate included free wifi, breakfast, shuttle to and from the race, and free parking. It was great. I don't know how I felt about the race itself but if I ever do it again I will come back and stay here. The whole hotel staff was waiting in the lobby to cheer runners as they returned from the race and they gave us a free late checkout.   The room itself was nice, clean, and quiet. I wondered if it would be loud because it is near John Wayne airport and that wasn't the case at all.   The free cookies, of course, are always a big hit :]

Incredible hotel for those participating in the surf city half or full marathon. They catered to the runners and made our stay wonderful. Comfortable beds, quiet rooms. We enjoyed the carb load dinner buffet and the convenience of it all. Fantastic breakfast early enough before the race and the shuttle was great! Will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay and the convenience of the hotels accommodations.  The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated.We are looking forward to welcoming you back next year!

Summary: Quiet location, rooms very clean, beds very comfortable. Every single employee I interacted with was pleasant, helpful, cheerful. This is my fourth time staying at this location for the very reasons stated above. I wouldn't pick another hotel when visiting this area.

Far from the beach and the towns in the coast. I had to take Uber every time so I spent more money than what I expected. The staff was nice, friendly and very helpful. They all speak Spanish and English.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments about or staff. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated.

Summary: Exceptionally helpful and friendly staff--from the front desk to the valet to housekeeping Very comfortable bed. Quiet hotel though close to the freeway. We look forward to our next stay. A terrific value.

I had to make several changes to my reservation and they kept the rate the same.  the day I checked in I requested to cancel the next nights reservation and Octavio at the front desk assisted me, very much appreciated!!  Nice, smaller hotel in a great area.

Great property, close to downtown but on lake away from hassle. Lake with ducks made for a nice walking trail. Convenient to SNA airport. Shuttle service easy and prompt. Wonderfully helpful staff. Food was quite good.

We had 9-10 rooms for our party. It was a bit louder on the highway side but all in all very pleasant. There was a nice pond which we strolled around and entertained the very old and very young in our party. I was surprised how good the catered food was and the staff doted on us. It worked out very well.

Summary Heading: Weekend stay for conference,at nearby hilton
Summary: Great room..has coffee pot yay! Ahhh gave free wifi! Our bed clean,comfy,bathroom very nice with all amenities. Staff very quick on room service and front desk were very good too! We also had a very efficient shuttle service to the host hotel of even t..Thankyou for a great stay

Large business group at the Hilton and DoubleTree was the overflow hotels.  Service at the Hilton for the conference was spectacular, however I cannot say that for the DoubleTree.  We had several issues, including the maid entering to clean one of my groups rooms even when the DND sign was on the door.

The room was dark, old and felt dirty. We had some specific issues with the mini-fridge, the faucet and the toilet. There were some general issues as well such as chipped paint, hair in the bathtub, stains on the wallpaper, etc. It's an older property and it certainly showed.

So we legit stayed here because we heard from a friend that you can get hella cookies but they really shorted us on the cookies. Our friend said that they gave him and his girlfriend 10 cookies at check in and we only got 2. I mean everything else was great and the service people were chill but they should be more upfront about this whole cookie thing cuz my girl was really looking forward to that.

Summary Heading: Be aware of Self Park Fee
Summary: This hotel does not list that it charges for parking. Only signs when you drive up are for valet parking. Nothing regarding self park. Nothing mentioned when you checkin or out either. Just a bill after you get home stating the charges for each night in the bill.

Hotel management was excellent in accommodating family, food and beverage was top quality and service was great. Hotel staff was over the top and seeing that we had a outstanding stay, wouldn't hesitate staying there again

Stayed for 4 nights and the beds were just perfect. First time at any hotel I have been able to say that.  all amenities are great, but if the bed is less than good, it doesn't matter. I slept each and every night blissfully. The hotel staff went out of their way to make our stay the best. From the car valet to check-in to complimentary breakfast (very good with real food), to check-out, all was so professionally well done. I would rate this hotel superior to any Ritz-Carlton I have stayed. If you will be in the area for business or pleasure (disneyland id close) I would streongly recommend this hotel.

Loved our holiday stay.  Very clean and comfortable.  Nice to have a mini fridge for those after dinner leftovers and a refreshment before and after sleep.  Very friendly staff at front desk as well as room staff.  Very comfortable bedding.  Beds had that fresh clean like-new linen fragrance.  Perfect location for trip to Disneyland.  Good professional business region.

Summary Heading: Unfortunate decision to reserve with Doubletree Club
Summary: Poor service and poorly equipped room in dire need of upgrade. Will not return. I'm unclear about the need to brand several hotels in the Santa Ana/John Wayne Airport Area as Doubletree Hotels. Clearly, it may be an unwise decision since the hotel did not deliver a Doubletree experience.

I found this hotel on a whim at night after reading the reviews . The night shift checked us in and was so polite . Breakfast alone makes this place worth it ! If you are staying here definitely pay the extra 10-20$ for breakfast. The way to get a deal and points is to compare the Priceline rate to the hotel website price. The third party websites can not guarantee breakfast but booking on the Hilton website does it’s only a couple dollars more . If you have 2-4 people in your room I would definitely recommend it . The hotel bistro staff were amazing to us at breakfast and were so helpful and went out of their way to get us a tray to take to the room so my husband could rest and eat upstairs. There was so much variety for breakfast as well and clean food. I appreciate their

The parking was not sufficient, nor was it explained that you would have to pay for parking. My car was never parked overnight. I decided to check out early that evening due to extenuating circumstances and asked if I could get a refund as I had physically stayed in the room. We arrived at 3P CST. Left the hotel. Returned at 10P CST. The manager swiped my card nonchalantly, said sorry without much empathy or eye contact and pretended I wasn't standing at the counter and proceeded to check in the next guest with such zeal and enthusiasm. What takes the cake is that she promised to not charge me for parking. And guess who paid for parking? I have my thoughts on why she might have been more enthusiastic with the other guests. But I'll professionally decline to insert them here. If

Summary Heading: rooms OK, food and bar weak
Summary: food and bar are weak but there is an Indian restaurant down the street.  Lack of spirit selection is a big minus and the bar is small.  Food was weak at best.   what I ordered they called greek food but it was not even close to greek.  They should just stick with hambergers or something like that because their efforts to do ethnic food was poor.

Friendly staff.  Rooms are large, but furniture shows wear & needs updating.  not enough outlets near bed.  my room was facing part of the highway & was noisy.  breakfast needs work - bacon/sausage was burnt and some pastry was old. shuttle to airport (close by, about 10 minutes) & within 4 miles.

The front desk staff fixed my errors in booking at no charge and even gave me an upgraded room!!  Very friendly and helpful.  The bar and restaurant staff were very accommodating.  Great value for the price!
Manager Response: Hello E2833TDpatrickd,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary Heading: The Double Tree Club at Hilton was one of the best hotel experiences I have had in a long time.
Summary: This hotel's location is fantastic.  Shopping and incredible restaurants are within a 4 mile radius.  The Orange County Airport is less than 5 minutes away and Disneyland Resort is within 10 minutes.  Although I would not usually consider this a primary place to stay as a Disneyland option, it is so much better than the surrounding hotels.  The breakfast options are terrific and there is no fighting crowds in the immediate Disneyland area.  The staff and service is excellent, and the rooms and amenities are of high quality.

Summary Heading: A/C Works Great, Outrageous Parking Fee
Summary: I haven't stayed at this property in years but I found myself back in the area last weekend for a two night stay. The hotel has had some minor renovations and the soft furnishings in the guest rooms have been updated but the bathrooms still look old and sad (especially the shower tiles). Otherwise, I found my room to be comfortable with a soft yet firm bed, a spacious work area, and an a/c unit that I had full control of (no annoying motion sensors shutting off your air in the middle of the night)!  At check-in, I was welcomed back as a Diamond HHonors member and given Doubletree's signature warm cookies. The front desk clerk was polite and cheerful and check-in was a breeze. I did notice that the lobby smelled like sewage but thankfully it was only temporary.  Big, big negative

Was on a one day business trip and wanted to stay longer once I got to this very nice hotel.  From water feature was tranquil- I would have sat out there with a nice glass of wine!   Will do that next time.  I’m sure I will go back.
Manager Response: Hello Micaela,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments. Your message has been shared with the entire team and we are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Great hotel and staff very quiet and peaceful hotel. I went to a concert the night I checked in and the staff was very accommodating. Very clean as well. If and when i visit Santa Ana. I will definitely be staying there again.
Manager Response: Hello Amberl13,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Doubletree Club Hilton Orange County Airport. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us. I was so pleased to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: My family and I love staying at this hotel.  Service at restaurant is great.  Perfect hotel to have some quality family time.  I recommend you try the food at the restaurant, service has always been top notch.
Manager Response: Hello Horarcior520,  I would like to thank you for the kind words. Please know that your comments have sent to the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary Heading: Great Room, Superb Staff, Excellent Value
Summary: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel on an HHonors rewards stay.  It was conveniently located next to the airport and their shuttle was minutes away.  I was greeted at the desk by Alycia who was courteous, efficient and helpful.  She made me feel right at home after a long day of travel.  During the stay their valet, Front Office Manager were helpful.  The hotel is walking distance or a short drive from just about anything you'd need.
Manager Response: Hello RyanLove,  I would like to thank you for taking the time to fill out this online survey. It is always great to hear of such stories from our guest.
