The hotel rooms did not feel clean especially the bathroom, smelled of old wet towel.

With a very nice lake view, the Doubletree Club is one of the nicer places to stay in this part of Orange County.  Just minutes from John Wayne Airport and UCI.  The lake provides a nice walk.  Staff is always wonderful! Breakfast and Cocktails for Gold members.  Don't forget the cookies!

I love this hotel.  It has a beautiful lake/fountain patio area and the staff are very courteous and nice.  It is close to the freeway, but far enough away that you don't have the noise issue.  There are eateries and Starbucks just down the street.

The staff and service is a 10 through out the stay. Wonderful breakfast and dinner. Rooms are nice size and clean. The check in and check out is a breeze. Would stay here every time. Location is great starbuck in walking distance beautiful outside walk around.

A standard typical Doubletree business hotel, dated but clean. The rooms are a good size, clean, but looking dated too. There is not really much more to say other than you get what you pay for.   I chose this hotel for it’s “lakeside setting” but this is not as special as they make it sound and very underused by the design and layout of the hotel. The staff lacked enthusiasm and don't really go out of their way to make you feel welcome.   I have a minor gripe; the use of paper cups and plastic glasses at breakfast. If I was prepared to accept that, I would have stayed in a Hampton Inn. This is such an American thing and should be stopped in favour of using proper washable service items.  There are a lot of hotels to choose from in this area, I have stayed in better and would not

Summary Heading: Super long queues, dated checkin, poor traininh
Summary: 1. 8pm and waiting 4th in line only one agent to do checkins  2. Rooms are really dated  3. Gym is a tiny room at end of 2nd floor  4. Airport shuttle isn't regular need to call to have them collect you unlike the Hilton  5. Diamond booked as two guests only given one breakfast voucher   6. Meager toiletries in the room  7. The slowest two lifts I've ever encountered.  Will I stay again? Probably  Does this hotel need a lot of work? Yes

Stayed here because of early am meeting to avoid traffic driving from Los Angeles area. Check in was courteous and friendly.  Parking lot is just that, a large lot outside of entrance. The hotel is a bit dated but it was clean. Bed was comfortable.  I wish they provided larger bath soap bars. Had room described as lake view, but actually was more of a large tree in front of window view. Buffet breakfast although not extravagant was actually quite good, scrambled eggs, sausage,  bacon, potatoes, assorted breads and cereals. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Located in business park a few minutes from South coast Plaza. Free airport shuttle.

I like this hotel.Convenient to the airport and major highways.  Clean rooms and friendly staff.  Parking rates are inexpensive.  The bar staff are great.  There is a lake view from some of the rooms.  The outside patio is a nice are to read a book.

Summary Heading: will never stay at this hotel again
Summary: ruined my weekend. couldn't sit by the pool because it smelled of traffic pollution. the shower head was too low for me to wash my hair. the bath tub too old and stained for comfortable bath. i had to pack in the dark because of power outages and left a personal item there i can't get back now. the coffee was awful. no point in getting the corner room bc my view of the free way and lack of privacy with people walking by.

Summary Heading: Pictures look better then in person
Summary: The hotel was average not bad not good. just a clean place to stay on business. One perk that I did like was it has a small refrigerator in the room. Also the location is good with close proximity to freeway, Costa Mesa Mall, 24 hr fitness etc.

I stay at this Double Tree quite often the staff is superb, whether its the front desk, housekeeping, or the restaurant! The rooms are always clean, the location is close to everything. Its Double Tree so the beds and pillows are the BEST! The only thing that could use some attention is the pool area, there were not enough umbrellas out there.  Overall, you could not go wrong staying at this location it's one of there smaller properties but it gives it an intimate feel. If you have kids they have a huge pond adjacent to the property so you can go and feed the ducks or take take the walking path around it.

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be....
Summary: The room are starting to get tired and need updating. No trash can in the bathroom.  The breakfast was horrible. Food was cold and poor selection. Staff in restaurant not responsive.  We have been staying here for annual event for 5 years but will not be returning. Front desk staff was great and very helpful.

I expected more from a DoubleTree hotel, which I think of as a premium brand. This hotel was run down and needed some maintenance. I didn't receive the cookie upon check in and the initial room I was put in had a stale body odor smell so I had to be switched. I'm a HHonors Diamond member and didn't receive an upgrade nor was I put on the HHonors floor. Front desk staff was just ok, valet staff was very nice and helpful.

The bed was comfortable. The room was quiet. The staff was attentive, and the breakfast was well prepared.   This Doubletree is nicely decorated. It was everything we required for our trip to Orange County.

Parking was a great thing !   Valet parking for $11 ! Was super happy about that . The hotel was clean the staff was very friendly . Beds were super comfortable . No complaints . I will  definitely stay here again

Rooms are very nice and clean.  Parking limited and not free.  One of the elevators was not working so that made for a couple of long waits to get to the 6th floor.  I would recommend valet parking, since it is the same cost and locating a parking space on your own can be hard.

I thought I was going  to pay one total price but they made it higher then I thought... please help me get another room I did like the location but room had stuff wrong with it wet spots on the floor....

I was forced to go to this small property because the large property down the street was sold out. Not the experience I was looking for on a business trip.  Very small bar and the food in the restaurant is nothing to write home about. The staff were nice but overall not the kind of property I was looking for.

Summary Heading: Great Staff ! Really clean and well kept for older property
Summary: Every staff member I encountered was smiling and said hello. Housekeeping did a fantastic job of keeping the room clean. The front desk handled our check in, check out and misc. requests in short order. Even the Valet staff was outstanding and friendly. This has been an annual stay for me for a few years, and some of the staff even remembered me. WELL DONE !

We've stayed at this property before with great satisfaction. Hotel seems a bit tired and in need of some improvements. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean when service was provided. No housekeeping service one day and no explanation why or any offer to freshen room or bring  up towels when front desk was notified. Only one elevator is working resulting in very long waits. This is a great location and with some attention to important details this could be an excellent choice.

I was on the sixth floor, facing the freeway. I had wanted a single queen room but these are a rarity here. I settled for a double queen. The room was typical cramped room. The desk chair was nice, the regular upholstered chair was jammed in a corner due to no space. Bathroom has a pocket door.   The bathroom floor is slippery when dry. When damp, it is a fall hazard. I barely caught myself before I fell, averting disaster.   The room was clean and tidy, but the furniture has nicks and gouges in places. The carpet was clean. As per usual, there were not enough lights in the room. The outside hallway was also dimly lit, lending a spooky air to the place. The closet was dinky but adequate.   There is no little sundry/food store in the hotel. The restaurant is open for breakfast,

Put some of our employees @ this property for a work trip - everything was GREAT! from the comfort/cleanliness of the room, to price, to professionalism of the staff, to over all experience. STAY here - you will not regret it!

We have stayed at this hotel two or three times. I really like it. The housekeepers are great and it makes me feel special when my face towels are expertly folded like a blooming tulip. I actually use the pool when I come here and I don't always use the pools at the hotels we stay at. This one is inviting for some reason. Plus it's off to the side of the hotel so everyone doesn't watch you swimming as they come and go in their business attire. The restaurant is nice - we've only eaten breakfast here. There is a pretty nice breakfast buffet. There is a kind of man-made (I think)  water feature (pond) in front. It's pleasant. I am sure we will return to this hotel about a half dozen or more times and I am looking forward to it. They have this in-hotel review program called "Catch

hotel is average - dated and average.  Staff seems nice.  Breakfast - hard to find staff, breakfast mediocre.  Better to go elsewhere - even if you are gold or plat. location is great and rooms are ok.  good view of lake.  downside, soap left in soap dish in shower was gross.  Upside, staff seemed nice at counter

everything went well. stayed here for personal trip because the location is good and near the airport and UCI Very friendly staff, clean, spacious, liked pictured, would definitely stay here again, when using maps,it was difficult to find the entrance of the hotel

Great stay. The room was nice, bed comfy and wifi was strong. The staff was pleasant. I ordered room service and had the breakfast downstairs. Both we very good. I will be returning again for  sure. And they gave me a cookie!!!

The staff were all extremely friendly and very helpful.  The dinner food was very good and a good selection of drinks.  The downside was the breakfast... It was a bit pricey and not very good.  I would recommend this hotel for people traveling on business, it seems to be more aimed towards that.  We didn't mind staying there, but would prefer something with more to do for personal travel.

Summary Heading: Hotel room needs to be refreshed
Summary: Room 631 - Balboa Suite - is in desperate need of an upgrade / refresh.  Carpet old and stained, couches old and stained - coach secondary pillows tattered and stained.  Bathroom missing hand tool rack.  Wet bar sink dirty, curtains tattered and need replacement.  A/C noisy and not overly effective.  We were staying here as part of a destination wedding event for my best mate and his fiancé.  Price and location were right, other than that the bar is tiny and the rooms are in desperate need of remodel/refreshing.

Nice room with refrigerator but no microwave. Very clean. Easy check in. Stayed on 6th fl with view of pond. Comfortable bed with pull out couch. There is a $11per day parking and $50 per day incidental charge. You can walk or jog around pond or feed ducks.

We had a Wonderful view .Had fun watching the turtles and birds that live in the pond. Enjoyed the  Nice accomidations. Central to many beaches and theme parks . Great friendly staff. Great with are wedding party of all ages.  Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: A Great Hotel for Costa Mesa/Santa Ana Area
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding. We didn't book a fancy 5-star hotel because we wouldn't be here most of the time. We had the suites, which were roomy and adequate (although the bathroom can use some updating.) Overall, it was a pleasant stay. The hotel staff is very friendly, which made the stay very pleasant.

This hotel's location, price, and staff are hard to beat. Close to SNA and major freeways, it is nice to retreat to this quiet hotel located in a series of office and apartment complexes. Staff, especially the front desk and the dining area crews, are very friendly and responsive. Definitely a place to consider if you are in Orange County or nearby.

Warm room. Poor air circulation. Bad food. Keycard didn't work. Staff got irritated with me. Restaurant was dark. Location was good. Walking path around the man made lake was awesome! Felt like all the staff were 'in- training'

My family and I stayed here for 2 nights, check in staff were amazing, our room was not ready and we did have to wait over 30 minutes, they gave us free breakfast vouchers for our stay as an apology. The famous cookies at check in were nice too. Our room was clean and what we needed for our stay, we overlooked the pond and business area. The pool is small, but its all you need for a quick cool down. Bar staff were very friendly.  I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in the area.

If you are looking for a great room, good service and good food, you should be happy with place.  It is not too big and is definitely upscale.  Management makes the difference at these places and it is excellent here.  The property looks relatively new and extremely well maintained.

Convenient location to Laguna Beach; John Wayne airport; and local businesses.   Hotel is very clean and comfortable; staff very nice.  However, property is dated and could use new furniture, etc in guest rooms.

Convenient to airport,freeway,and places to eat. Calm atmosphere with man made lake. The parking is awful but valet works when in a bind. The breakfast which was included in our reservation was very good.

Summary Heading: Nice accomodations and friendly front desk staff
Summary: My 30th high school reunion was being held at this hotel.  The rooms were nice and comfortable.  The party was in one of the conference rooms down stairs next to the bar, which was nice.  Our party was over at midnight, and yes people linger, so the security person came in rather rude and told everyone they needed to leave so the staff could break down the tables.  We walked outside of the conference room and we were told to leave that area too, mind you, the bar is there as well (yes, the bar was closed).  He said the staff needed to set up for breakfast so we couldn't chat in that area.  Thankfully the weather was very nice so we went outside to sit in chairs they have out by the little lake.  Would I stay again, yes, but for a function, no.

Summary Heading: Clean Low-Budget Hotel with Inadequate Service and Staff
Summary: I am a frequent business traveler so I was looking forward to my weekend trip to Orange County for a friend's wedding.  I chose this hotel because it was centrally located near the wedding events and the airport.  From the moment I arrived, I knew I had made a mistake.  This hotel is loud, and when I say loud... I mean LOUD.  There were a bunch of high school soccer teams staying at the property and even after 10 PM, they were running around the halls and yelling.  I don't blame the hotel for that, but I do for the fact that the doors do not insulate from any activity going on in the hallways.  Even just a person walking by was enough to wake me up!  The problem with this hotel is that they have taken a decent hotel in a decent location and then they added the Wal-Mart concept

I need to start this review with the admission that the following is 100% my fault!  I visited this spent three nights at this hotel and after arriving back home, I realized I left some clothes at the hotel.  I phoned that night and was not at all pleased with the immediate feedback. I called again in the morning and still felt as though my request wasn't being taken seriously. In the end the hotel was unable to locate 2 company logo golf shirts, a pair pants and some unmentionables... From the beginning, it was clear that the hotel staff had zero interest in helping me recover my list items.  As a result I can only recommend...  Buyer beware!

Welcome/Check-in:- warm friendly and efficient Bedroom:- lakeside view on 6th floor, adequate size and comfort, doors thin, noise from corridors Quality of sleep:- perfectly fine Bathroom:- clean and fresh,slightly small, dated Breakfast:- Included as Hilton Honours gold member. reasonable selection all round Parking:- self or valet parking -same cost $11 a night -inadequate spaces for self parking, valet parking took the car a fair way away . If you want a prompt departure, I would advise self-parking if at all possible Location:- convenient for business park and airport, nothing in walking distance Check Out:- prepaid, efficient Staff:- all warm friendly and helpful,  Value for money:- We paid $143 incl taxes and parking on a weekend for a standard room, comparing with what we

Summary Heading: Conveniently Located, Good Budget Choice on a "Lake"
Summary: The DoubleTree Club is so reasonably priced that you get more than you pay for at this older, small property that's conveniently located for the airport and for many North Orange County attractions.  The restaurant is small, and it's not often open, so the hotel provides free shuttle service within a four mile radius, which includes the airport.  (There are fast food options within a short walking distance.)  The rooms are typical in size and layout for older hotels.  Nothing special, but not bad.  The best feature, aside from the budget room rates, is the "lake" in front of the property.  It's an artificial lake, but it's quite pleasant and well-maintained, with a 1/2 mile, concrete path all the way around.  We run several miles every morning, and it was easy to extend by

Room in a corner of the second floor across from the workout facility and overlooking the lake. They have some pretty good sound proofing in the rooms, I didn't hear any noise from the gym. But, that could have been because my in-room AC was very noisy. They are the older style that sit on the floor under a window. I had it on it's lowest fan speed and still it stayed on all night. I would liked to have been able to open the window instead as it was a nice night.  The hotel is pretty clean, but housekeeping could have done a better job of picking up room service remnants. A couple of trays were in the hall when I arrived around 7:30 PM and were still there when I left at 10 PM to go to a show, and unfortunately, still there when I got back a little after 2:30 AM.   The hotel

Was in town for a show at the Pacific Amphitheatre, this location was a short Uber drive away.  Nice Hotel, Clean, Friendly, Excellent Service, Friendly Staff, Safe. Room:  excellent AC, Comfortable Beds, Frig that actually worked & Safe. Toiletries are basic nothing special. Maid  Service excellent. Parking $11 Self or Valet.   Grounds: huge pond area with walking paths.  Tranquil ambiance –places to sit along the walking paths. Uber has fast service to this location, went to the Silver Trumpet in the Arts District for cocktails it was just a few minutes away. I would stay here again, comfortable, safe and quiet

I am a HH Silver member and I/we liked this hotel.  I booked the BnB package and all was good.  I will say that the room we had reminded us of the rooms we had in Europe this summer, a bit small, but still comfortable.  The breakfast buffet the next morning was good and we sat outside to enjoy the nice cool morning and to watch the ducks on the lake.  Also we had a room with a Lake view.

Summary Heading: Older Hotel close to Fair and Airport
Summary: Clean but older building near John Wayne Airport and OC Fairgrounds.  We are Hilton Honors members but were not placed on the HH floor.  Room is on the small side and only had one Queenbed.  Bed was very comfortable but would have preferred a King bed for wife and I.  Room had all the quality amenities including flatscreen TV and fridge.  Room was very clean.  Too tired to change rooms.  Pool is right next to Freeway and is very noisy.  Bistro has very limited service hours.  Valet is only $12, same as self parking, so a good deal. I would not rate this a 3.5 Star, but a 3 star...maximum!  The other Doubletree Hotel, which is three blocks away is a much nicer Hotel.  Try to get that one if you like the Doubletree brand.  This one is just OK, and be careful with rooms with only

Summary Heading: Decent hotel for a roadtrip stopover
Summary: We picked this hotel due to its location (close to South Coast Plaza which is one of the stops on our roadtrip).  Almost drove to the wrong Doubletree as there's another one just one block over.  Overall it was a decent hotel.  The rooms and hallways seemed a bit dated, but clean.  The walls were a little thin and we could hear our neighbors talking quite clearly.  The freeway noise wasn't so bad since our room was the one farthest from it.  There's a Starbucks and a surprisingly good Indian restaurant just a block over.  For the price that we paid, this hotel was alright.

Highly recommend this hotel!  Great customer service from the minute we walked in. Greeted with a smile and warm cookie. Good warm breakfast and perfect patio with view of a pond. Beds were soft and shower was hot. Can't ask for more than that.

Room not available at 3:30 even after digitally checking in. Ice machine broken on 5th Floor. Parking was stressful and not convenient given that it's $11 a day.  No one answered the Careline. Needed to call twice to extend a late checkout to 1:30pm. Noticed that a lot of other guests were hanging around the lobby prior to checking in.

The hotel was great! Very clean and everyone very nice. The breakfast was  Delishous over looking the water  And the complimentary warm cookies did hurt either. We didn't get a chance to use the pool , We were there for soccer tournament. We also decided to stay an extra night. The only upset was the parking lot was very small only like 60 spots for 100 rooms so make sure you park early or you will have to do valet. I would go back!

The lake was nice .. Front desk , restaurant and valet very friendly .. Free airport shuttle .. Parking was $11.. Best Starbucks .. Easy access to shopping and food. Quiet . Staff helpful and friendly

The hotel is older and in need of an upgrade.  For the immediate area of the Orange County Airport, the rates were the lowest to comparable hotels.  Valet and self-parking both cost $11.00 a day, which is also quite lower than other hotels near in the area.  The staff is helpful and friendly.  The rooms have an air conditioner wall unit.  If you want to keep your room cool you have to leave the unit on.  You can pre-set the temperature however the unit does not turn off when it reaches it.  The air conditioner turns off but the fan continually blows while the unit is on.  The unit is very noisy and will keep you from having a good night's sleep unless you can sleep with continual noise.  The bathroom does not have a fan in it.  The bathroom is separated by a solid wooden door on

Summary Heading: Comfy room - Bad In Room Breakfast Experience
Summary: Great location for a quick overnight; reasonably priced.  But we had a bad experience with the in-room breakfast -- cold food, missing english muffin, missing cream for coffee.  The restaurant manager was less than apologetic about the complaint.  Otherwise the hotel is very nice.

Double Tree is in a very nice area that is a $5 Uber ride away from the airport. Courtyard area has a lovely pond in the front. However, it is difficult for Uber drivers to find at first. Great stay, breakfast was good as well.

Summary Heading: Very nice rooms Hilton Orange County
Summary: The Hotel is beautiful inside and out and is easy to get to off of the 55. The customer service was okay and the rooms were not ready when they were promised  Pricing was great, parking was reasonable and the valet services were excellent! Overall a good stay and was super conveinent distance to our event

Summary Heading: Does not live up to DoubleTree standards.
Summary: If you are into mediocrity, this would be a great property for you.   When your signature amenity is a cookie, they should always be on hand and offered at check-in.   One hand towel and one washcloth in the room? Not even Hampton does that.  The charging for parking is ridiculous. If you want to charge for parking put in professional parking gates and stations. Instead of your tacky make shift barriers. Not all, but a couple rude parking attendants.
Manager Response: Dear SPGDaveDrew1108 :  On behalf of the DoubleTree Club OC Airport staff, I would like to first thank you for filling out this survey. This survey helps us in improving our customer service as well as address any and all issues encountered by our guests. I do sincerely apologize for the lack of room amenities and cookies.  This is certainly not indicative of the standards we are measured against for our guests, and I discussed this with our team so we can make necessary changes. I appreciate you letting us know of your stay. Your opinions matter to us at the DoubleTree.  We are happy that you chose to stay with us.  We invite you to come back if ever in the Orange County area so we can make it right for you.     Sincerely, Sanjay

Summary: This is just an OK hotel.  Customer Service was fine when I checked in, but my business associate checked in right after me to find that her reservation had been cancelled.  No options were made available, a meager apology and that was it. The next day, our room locks had been changed to upgrade their hotel, we found out after a long day of training, and with our  arms full, we had to go back to the front desk and wait in the check in line to sort this out.  Then the key cards didn't work...  Repeated calls for extra towels were ignored, housekeeping only replaced one daily even though there were 4 of us in the room.  Parking was hardly available, even though you pay for it, you can pay extra for valet though!  It was clean and quiet, but I won't be rushing back.

Summary Heading: Nice once you find in and  get a checked in
Summary: Be aware that there are two double tree with blocks of each other and this one isn't the one you see when you exit the freeway a little tricky to find, and also the check in was a little rough when I tried to check in and no rooms available. Once I found in an checked in the staff was nice, clean and of course can't beat the cookie!

This was as a wonderful location, great food, and nice and clean rooms; would definite stay here again. Had an opportunity to run around the man-made lake every morning; and sit outside and read by pool.

Great place to stay. We wanted to be close to attractions and beach. This hotel had it all. Very close to Disneyland, Newport Beach and Angles Stadium. Easy access to all of the freeways and even got to go to the OC Fair.

We stayed here in order to go to the OC Fair and a concert. We got a great deal using the Hilton Summer discount promo, especially since the OC is such an expensive place to find a nice hotel. We had a King Lakeview w Pullout sofa room. It had a nice view of the lake and was quiet...no hint of the freeway.  The room was clean and nicely appointed with granite surfaces, coffee maker, refrigerator, good TV selections  and had everything we needed except for USB ports on the desk or lamps.(that we could find at any rate) There were regular outlets that were accessible on the wall that we used. The bed was comfortable.  Self parking is VERY limited, but both the self and valet parking are $11 per night. We had to valet when we came in late after the concert.  LOVED the late check

My stay was with me and my husband and we were celebrating my birthday.  When we drove up I was a little disappointed ( it was a 5 story building), but then I saw the lake with the ducks and the grounds which were serene and romantic. It was also extremely quiet.  Inside the hotel; the room was decorated nicely with a big picture window overlooking the lake. At night you could walk around the lighted lake.  It was very convenient to have breakfast in the hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly as were the cleaning staff. It had a pool, but it was very small.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone because it's close to restaurants and shopping as well as to the airport and freeways, but it's like a hidden Oasis!!!!!

It is a hotel with a great location, close to the freeway and several attractions, like Disney, Knott's Berry Farm, Angels Stadium. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms, parking fee is around $15. Wi-Fi is also available with an extra fee

Not what I'm use to, but appreciated their attempt to minimize inconvenience during their modernization of the room doors. Ice machine doewnt work on the 5th floor which is a hh floor. Had to go to the 6 th floor. I room dining was disappointing.

The property was nice and room was clean. The halls had a nice spa like smell. The elevators were a little slow at times. The front desk staff were very friendly. It wasn't clear when making the reservation that there would be an additional $11 per night parking fee. I would prefer if that was just rolled into the fee for the room.

Summary Heading: OK room with a nice view
Summary: Parking was a hassle the first night. You have to use valet because there is no where to self park on the weekend. Price is the same for either. Shower water fluctuates between hot and lukewarm.  Rooms look old and tired. No hooks for towels in the bathroom.

Summary Heading: Not the usual Doubletree experience but okay
Summary: We spent three nights at this hotel this weekend for a softball tournament my daughter's team participated in. Let me say I've stayed in a few Doubletree properties and I'm accustomed to a certain expectation of them--love their cookies on check-in and their properties are usually spotless and above par. That being said-  Pros: The grounds here are very nice. There is a pond near the entrance and cute grounds to walk around and enjoy the view. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was your usual fair of scrambled eggs, bacon, French toast, juices and coffee, and muffins but they all were pretty good considering. The location of the hotel near the airport is a plus and there was easy access to the freeways.  Cons: On check in we were assigned a room next to

Summary Heading: Gave away my room that I booked via the Hilton app and substituted with the worst room in the hotel
Summary: I had booked a room via the Hilton app, top floor, away from elevators, facing away from freeways.  This was confirmed, all set to go.  They got booked up, and when I arrived they had given away my room and stuck me in 202, next to an elevator, facing the freeway.  No notice at all about this, didn't get a room even close to the floor/ positioning that I had booked.  Worst customer service ever.  Avoid.

This hotel is older, it is out of the way, and much smaller than the newer, flashier Doubletree across the street. That being said, the inside is remodeled, and it is quiet and clean. It is well priced for the area (heart of Orange County, where nothing is inexpensive), and close to anything you may want to do in the area. I've stayed at this hotel 4 times now, and am sure I will be back again.

Thank you for excellent service. The rooms were clean and the staff were accommodating. Breakfast was good, only one suggestion is being open longer for breakfast. We will definitely stay at double tree in the near future. Thank you for having us.

The hotel is close to the airport and provides shuttle service.  The employees are GREAT!  The desk personnel were extremely helpful and courteous. The food was good and the wait staff was excellent. I would use this hotel again.

The picture on the website are very deceiving.  Run down hotel, no towels at the pool, room service didn't provide any towels on the 2nd night, did not refill the coffee items. The water was very difficult to turn on in the sink, very old hardware.  The light switch to the closet didn't work half the time.  I didn't like the selection of television options to watch.

After making reservations 6 months in advance and confirming our room 3x plus e-mails from the hotel confirming our reservation, my wife and 13 year old daughter where told at check in they had no room. Even though they did, after close to 2 hours of phone calls to hilton honors they where kind enough to give them a room. Been a Hilton honors member close to 10 years, even married at the Hilton las vegas 15 years ago. Treated with no respect and ruined our whole weekend. We hardly get away due to our work and love having a couple of days off. They suck. Oh they gave them a cookie. Thanks Hilton.

Even I got 2 room was disappointed cuz later check up was at 1. So I ended up paying an extra night instead....but I love Hilton that is the reason I stayed here. I hope they improved customer and late check up as people that we fly. Thank you very much for listening to my request.

Everything was great about the hotel stay except for the price of breakfast. I thought it was a little on the steep side as most hotels have complimentary breakfast. Not many other food choices within walking distance. Other than that, it was a good stay.

Hotel staff is very friendly. The hotel in itself is well kept and clean. There is a $11 self parking and valet parking fee for this location with a parking garage across the way that charges even more.

Easy Parking, Easy check in, instant Acknowledgment, Cookie and water up front was great, bar area was great, drinks were reasonable not outrages such in other areas, beds were excellent, very comfortable

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great service, AMAZING cookies
Summary: Great hotel if you here for business or leisure. Room does the job for a stay. Only thing that bothered me was that the room could use some renovating. But cleanliness was up to par. Cookies are AMAZING

The Double Tree Club Hotel is in a nice setting, a man-made lake/pond on one side of the hotel.  The rooms are clean and quite.  The amenities in the areas are minimal since the facility is in a business office area. You need to be out of the area to find good restaurants.

I cannot recall the last time I stayed at a hotel that did not have a USB charger. When I went to the front desk to ask if I was just not seeing it; they called maintenance. Within minutes a nice man came and looked at my cable and said: oh no we don't have special plugs. I picked this hotel because its a Doubletree and for one person, it was like 135.- with taxes. Very close to McArthur Blvd & 405 ramp. So its convenient. Bring your wall charger and there is a Starbucks nearby. The little coffee maker in the room did not work. But keeping in mind the price I paid for the room; I did not complain.

Late check in after delayed flights. AC not working in room. 2 attempts and still failed. changed room at 10:30 pm. New room ac works but no hot water.. cold shower hot water in the am but for a short period
Manager Response: We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is certainly not indicative of the standards we are measure against for our guests, and we have addressed the issues with AC and hot water. We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.

Summary: Hotel did not honor the feather free request which was made when making the reservation, again when checking in and again when I had a room change due to pungent air freshener smell in the first room.  I still had to have house keeping come back to make the room feather free.

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for business and pleasure
Summary: Have business in Irvine but wanted to have easy access to good restaurants and entertainment. This was it. And who could pass up the cookie?! The staff was very nice and accommodating. Wanted to take a nice safe walk and the pond was a perfect choice.

An older hotel with a nice location at lake.  Easy freeway access and walking distance to restaurants.  Rooms could use some renovation.  No ventilation in bathroom.  Otherwise, nice hotel. Friendly staff.

Stayed at this hotel for convenience to pick up family arriving at airport for my mothers funeral. All staff at this hotel was very pleasant and helpful, I had myself and two other family members from out of state staying in their own room. They even accommodated a last minute reservation for another family member

For me traveling with a pregnant wife and being put on the fifth floor was kind of ridiculous. With one of the elevators being out of service on a busy weekend and it taking sometimes 15 mins for a ride down or up we were resorted to taking the stairs multiple times and putting strain on my wife. This is completely unsatisfactory and being part of Hilton hotels this is shame.  These hotels used to be good,  Because of this I will no longer stay at one of these hotels against.  We also booked a room that had two queen beds but were given a room with a king. So we had our kids in our bed all weekend as they were out of all the other rooms because of sports tournaments going on. I wouldn't stay here again. There are a few hotels around the area that are not on any hotel search
Manager Response: We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.

Summary: Overall this was a very nice hotel, I was there for two nights (Fri/Sat) for a softball tournament and for the most part everything was nice. Pros:  Very nice location, situated in a business area fairly near the freeway but with some features (like a pond) near it that makes it seem nice.  The restaurant was good, though the bar doesn't open to 5.  One nice thing, it offered a 4-person pasta (spaghetti/alfredo) meal for only $40.  It really saved us some money, but there are restaurants you can walk to as well.  Also, the morning breakfast was pretty good, with both hot and cold options.  Parking is relatively cheap, though for some reason self-parking is the same cost as the valet.  We spent a good deal of time at the pool, which was decent.  The room was clean and spacious,

Summary Heading: good but be aware of the pool
Summary: We stayed over the weekend with friends and family and the hotel grounds are good, decent and room was clean.  However the pool was so tiny and the entire pool area smelled like gas.   really weird... we didn't use it at all bc of that.

The hotel seemed fine although the gym leaves a lot to be desired.  I wasn't impressed with the staff but they weren't overtly rude.  We had some issues that were out of the ordinary, the pipes were being worked on so the water was out when we arrived.  Great lunch meal in restaurant our server was FABULOUS!!!

Very nice staff, valet was able to recommend great restaurants to eat around town. First time i have stayed at a hotel that water was off for 3 hours but other than that, i would definitely stay again.

Restaurant and wait staff quite good.  Room outdated, lack of outlets for electronics - important to us business travelers.  Bedspread not very clean, shower had very poor water pressure.  Not likely to stay at this Doubletree again and there is another Doubletree that is much nicer only 2 blocks away !

Summary Heading: Getting tired, but reasonable and convenient
Summary: I think they remodeled in 2012, but it already looks worn.  They may do a lot of business, or the remodel wasn't quality.  I stay here mostly when I fly into Orange County.  It's close to the airport, but doesn't seem like it's in the air traffic path.  At least I don't hear the airplanes.  You can take a taxi here or drive by rental car.  It's close to the 55 and the 405.  It's close to a lot of business buildings.  It's comfortable.  The bed and rooms are comfortable .  The gym has mostly cardio, but the machines worked well.  The staff are nice.  For the price, I'd stay here again.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money you spend
Summary: I arrived to the hotel at 10:30 pm.  Was in town for a college graduation.  Drove from Las Vegas, to Orange County, attended graduation festivities.  When I checked in the hotel, both elevators were down.  My room was on the 6th floor.  They only had 1 staff member help me.  I still had to carry a luggage, purse and computer bag up 6 flights of stairs.  Not only that, the next morning needed to break a $20 bill.  The front desk said they could not break it.  Told me had a lot of guest needed change.  This was a graduation weekend not only college but high school.  You think they would have been better prepared.  Will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Mary Eleanor S,  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues encountered with our elevators and we’re working with our team to ensure the situation doesn’t happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again and give us an opportunity to show improvement.

Summary: We escaped for a weekend trip to Disneyland and this doubletree is our choice every time. I love the atmosphere and it's about 20 minutes away from Disneyland. The only part that is unfortunate is that you have to pay for parking. Management and staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. I love this property. There are awesome qualities like the lake out front and the walk around it. The rooms and hotel were very clean and minimalistic. Definitely recommended for a trip where you won't be spending too much time at the hotel.

Summary Heading: Not bad but there are some stuff you cant neglect
Summary: I stayed for business trip. The hotel its ok, great people at valet, at front desk, and in restaurant. But... First of all, what is an empty freezer doing in the room turned on making noise. And in the other hand, great breakfast buffet, a lot of breads you can choose but, imagine this...there was no cereal. Howcome a Hotel with breakfast bufet had no cereal. Not a single type. Unforgivable.

Staff is always great at this hotel.  Don't hesitate to try the hotel's restaurant.  Great lunch and dinner.  Easy access to airport and within walking distant to South Coast Plaza mall and many restaurants.

I tried this hotel because I got a great online rate. It is a very nice hotel. Even though it is located close to two major freeways I didn't hear any traffic. It's a little hard to find because it's in the middle of an business park but great proximity to shopping, dining, beach, and airport. I parking seems a bit limited but we found what seemed to be the "last" spot each time. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: Dirty tub, hot AC, missing refrigerator, breakfast is over priced.  Valet is same price to self park and they limit self park spaces so you have to valet and pay a tip to walk across the small lot. My tub was missing hard wear and had stains.
Manager Response: Dear Brian J,  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues encountered and we’re working with our team to ensure the situation doesn’t happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again and give us an opportunity to show improvement.

Summary Heading: Nice Room - Other Ammenities Little to be Desired
Summary: Nice staff, nice room.  Have stayed here before, but will not stay again due to 1.) Parking fee, 2.) Fitness center doesn't open until 6:00 AM (not good for East Coast visitors) and 3.) Very ordinary breakfast menu.  If they change these things, I would consider coming back in the future...

Clean and comfortable. Perfect for any business trip. The staff was super friendly. My room was cold when I got in there and my hot shower set off the alarm. Good range of channels and the wifi worked well.

Not impressed with the "Club" at all; so/so bedding and mattress, torn and moldy shower curtain and towels that were see-thru thin.  I chose this location because of the HH sites price and the fact that there was a shuttle to and from SNA airport.  I will most likely use a Hilton or regular DoubleTree in the future and avoid the "Club" as it seems to be the lower end of the HH spectrum.

Summary Heading: No hot water , no ventilation  in bathrooms,  over cooked breakfast
Summary: Don't stay at this hotel , blood on pillows , no hot water , stale breakfast,  no towels, no pillows no ventilation in bathrooms elevator  breaks down. Shared all elevators with staff over priced for lousy service.
Manager Response: Dear Jason T,  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues encountered and we’re working with our team to ensure the situation doesn’t happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again and give us an opportunity to show improvement.

Summary: Centrally located for the OC marathon, not to far and everything was drivable. Great hotel with such a friendly staff. Also wanted to mention the associate Jacqulien that help us checked in was so helpful and friendly it made our stay in the hotel worthwhile.

Summary Heading: Terrible experience -- I will book elsewhere next time!
Summary: The wonderful Hilton name is compromised by this Doubletree Hotel. So many shortfalls: old property without updates, 1970s furnishings, poor bed & bedding, 20 year old bathroom, leaking faucets, elevator not operating, inoperable room safe and an unheated pool. Manager and staff members merely up-selling upgrades. Little attention given to make the stay for the guest either enjoyable or pleasant. Food was terrible. And finally, total disregard to my Hilton Honors membership.

An excellent place to stay where the hotel is well-maintained with staff thst is the top of the line. Additionally, the location is surreal with the lake next door and the trees shading the patio dining in the afternoon along with the light sparkling on the lake ast nigt. More importatntly, it is in close proximity to all of the tourist spots in LA

Summary Heading: no surprises just a grat stay
Summary: A one day business stay made better.Very helpful front desk staff, even scanned a series of documents for me. One of the best values around. Have stayed many times at Doubletree and have never been disappointed.

This is perfect for a business trip. If you are looking for a resort with a nice big fitness center and Olympic size pool or a family oriented atmosphere, this is not that hotel. It's a good choice for a business trip that is not lengthy. Comfy beds and good service.

This is a terrible hotel and we had an awful experience with the cleanliness and quality of finishes in our rooms.  Old.  Outdated.  Very loud wall unit a/c that will keep you up at nite.  Shower is an old standup shower with old tile and a lot of caulk and grout to cover up the dated materials.

I stayed at this hotel based on the previous reviews; however, I'm thinking some of the reviews weren't honest stays. I wasn't happy with my stay overall, and if they offer you room 230, please decline it.  The room is next to the fitness center, and the walls are very thin.  It was so loud that we thought they were actually doing renovations. I told the staff at check out, and they were extremely apologetic.  She offered us extra cookies, but after being startled at 5:30 am, it really didn't help. We paid approximately $150/night, so cookies after that type of experience doesn't make it "sweeter."

The rooms have Very noisy air conditioners and poor wi/fi connection that need re-access constantly.  I was very  surprised to be charged for parking in an area that does not need to charge for parking.

For a chain airport hotel, this Doubletree surpassed all my expectations. Located close to freeways and with coffee shops and small restaurants within walking distance, this hotel is a bargain. Staff were exceptionally welcoming and helpful.

Great hotel. Great staff.  This hotel is clean and quiet with a top-notch group of employees.  It is smaller than most hotels in this area but I like the boutique feel. Very relaxing. Plus, you can see ducks everyday. Who doesn't like ducks?

Summary Heading: We were on to visit family in the area and found the location to be convenient.
Summary: The rooms were average.the bathroom and the closet needed some fixing.teficiencies were brought to the attention of front desk .closet was was fixed. The bathroom sink leakage and slow drainage problems did not bother us too much for our short stay of two days and mentioned to the front desk upon checking out so that the guest does not experience the same

Excellent start for a day to enjoy breakfast by the pond and nice California morning. Nice view, pleasant atmosphere, no noise. Location is very good. Easy reach from highways. And likewise convenient to go for nearby beaches.

but the rooms could use an update.  We stayed on the club level and even there it was in need of a really good cleaning.  Taken aback by housekeeping walking through the stairwell and hallways spraying a 'febreze' like product on the carpeting!  Gross.  And it's a hazard to those with asthma and allergies.  How about just steam clean the carpets.  Security could be better when I saw the door to the stairwell propped open with a brick on a morning and no one watching.  The staff was super friendly and ready to please the guest which is always nice!!

In this day and age with the choices hotels have to make their rooms quiet, modern and comfortable, this hotel falls way short. This is a Double Tree, not some cheap brand, yet everything in it felt and was cheap. Unfortunately I used points for my stay and I feel like I wasted them on this property.

Viewed a lot of negative comments prior to booking this hotel. The breakfast does indeed leave something to be desired and the hotel is on the older side but other than that, room was fine and service very good. One annoying thing is the fact that couch in room faces away from the TV but that can easily be rectified!

Attended an event at this particular hotel and I enjoyed how nice the hotel looked and the employees were very friendly. I did find a unique employee that was dedicated to his job, I felt bad that our group was big but he still managed to clean the restrooms with no worries and would leave them in good clean order. Didn't catch his name since he seemed in a rush to clean the bathrooms but I only remember this young man to be in uniform and wearing glasses using a black cart.. Great job man and keep up the good work! Front desk was also helpful with parking situations but other than that I had a good stay.

I was surprisingly very happy with this hotel.  Friendly staff,  easy check in and out. Great comfy bed! Nice pond to walk aroundfor alittle exercise.  Only complaint is paying for self parking or valet.  Self parking should be free.

No hot water and faucet leak  when she can get over taking cold showers and cleaning up the leak from the faucet the stay was very good love the lake and the walks but just because you get a discounted rate you shouldn't miss out on receiving complimentary breakfast tickets

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. We arrived early on Thursday and our room was ready at noon, pleasant surprise since check in is at 3 pm!  Our room overlooked the man made lake for this complex.  We walked around the lake and it is full of wildlife--ducks, geese, turtles and fish.  A very pleasant walk.  Room was comfortable and clean.  Wifi is only free in the lobby, if you want it in the room, you have to pay.  The hotel offers a shuttle to local businesses.  While my husband was at his seminar, I utilized the shuttle to go to the mall.  The driver was very courteous and answered my many questions.  When I was tired of the mall, the wait for him to return was very short.  A couple of glitches--one of the elevators went out and the "plug" in the bathtub did not work.

Clean, friendly, helpful, beautiful  hotel.  The breakfast and environment are nice.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, nice art.  The staff is friendly and helpful. We would stay here again, the Egyptian Geese greeted us as we arrrived.

Summary Heading: Watch out for the pipes to back up on you
Summary: This hotel has very poor plumbing, the sink backed up twice and the hotel did not move me to a different room, never apologized or said anything other then "it happens all the time".  Say away from this hotel.  I travel for work over 200 days per year and I would stay in a Motel 6 before I would come back here.

DoubleTree Hilton airport we stayed at Hilton in April we had a basketball tournament in Anaheim and the staff welcomed us extremely friendly and accommodated us with great breakfast thank you again Mike

Full disclosure, I stay about 75 days a year in Hilton properties of all types and locations, my review is taking into account stays at over 100 differs properties in the US.   This DoubleTree is and older property that is in need of some updates. The rooms are clean despite a lot of wear.  Sadly I had to take cold showers 2 days in a row as the hot water did not work in the room.  I did request maintenance take a look the first day to no avail, making for a chilling experience.   The staff is fantastic!  Very friendly and helpful in all things.   Other then the cold shower all of my needs were met, making for an enjoyable stay.

I booked a suite and it took 5-8 minutes to get warm water.  I complained.  They sent the maintenance man.  No hot water again for many minutes.  I moved suites.  Again, too long for hot water:  5-8 minutes.  Over my 2-day stay, I probably ran the faucet/tub for 60-75 minutes to get hot water before I could use it.  But, on the mirror was a sticker asking me to "save water!"  What a waste of water!  I was comp'd the extra cost of the suite and 1 night's lodging, but I will never stay there again!!!

The Doubletree in Santa Ana was fun, clean, pleasant and centrally located. Though its near the Orange County airport, you do not hear any planes. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was great. It is very family friendly. I recommend this Doubletree without hesitation.

We have stayed at this hotel several times as it is primarily our sons water polo team hotel when we have tournaments out here.  Great location, lake to walk around, wonderful accommodations pertaining family or couples get-a-way.  The rates are reasonable.  I would even recommend this hotel for business meetings.  The lake is beautiful stocked full of cat fish, turtles and ducks AND a great evening or morning walk or jog.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, clean rooms and more!
Summary: Throughout my stay the staff always greeted me and my family with a welcoming smile. They always asked how I'm doing, which I loved. The hotel was very kid friendly. The duck pond just right outside with duck food to keep the kids busy as well as the pool! Complimentary breakfast was kept fresh. Parking was a bit of a hassle with the big tour busses in the way most of the time.. But overall my family and I enjoyed our stay. One more thing, I also have to compliment the housekeepers for doing a fantastic job in adding personal touches to the hotel room.

I give this property 5***** for location, easy in and out, great breakfast and very nice outdoor accommodations. Typical public areas, business center and workout room. Many restaurant options , fantastic shopping and beaches are an easy drive away.

Very nice place to stay especially for the price. Hot water was a little off in the bath so I recommend letting it run for a bit. The view is lovely and the beds are extremely comfy. It is a rather nice location because it seems to be in the middle of everything with easy driving range. I definitely would come back again. A great place for a budgeter plus Starbucks is right there.

Very close to the freeway and John Waybe Airport. Shopping is very close as well. Pretty little pond and walkway for a morning walk or jog, or evening stroll. Starbucks and quick but type restaurant is right around the corner.

Nice hotel with comfortable rooms and a great staff.  Front desk was helpful and privide good suggestions.  The resturant was for breakfast was great.  The bar for evening cocktails was great for a long day of business meeting.

The staff at this Double Tree are great! Super helpful and friendly, they helped me find nearby pharmacy and were always friendly when entering and leaving. The cookies and the breakfast are AWESOME, definitely add to the quality. Great value and great stay.

The Doubletree Club is located in a business park in Santa Ana, very close to the freeway for easy use.   There is a different Doubletree located up the street which is in a little bit busier area.   If you are looking for a hotel that is a bit more tucked away, this is a perfect choice.   The location was excellent, is located next to several newer condos and in walking distance of a little shopping center with a Starbucks, several restaurants (Indian, Japanese, American style) and a medical clinic.   Traveling solo it felt very safe and was easy to get around.   It was about 10 minutes to downtown Santa Ana and non-highway routed.  You do have to pay to park (self or valet), which seemed a little unusual for a hotel in a corporate park, but might have to do with them just

Summary Heading: Surf City Marathon & Super Bowl Stay
Summary: I ran the Surf City Marathon in February 2016 and stayed here as it was one of the "host hotels".  They provided shuttles to the start line included in the price package (and probably shuttles back from the finish, but we had our own transportation).  They provide cookies upon check-in and any other time you ask, and they are quite tasty!  The only reason I didn't rate them 5 out of 5 is because of the poor satellite reception during the Super Bowl (which was the same day as the marathon), and we were unable to watch most of it.

Excellent Hotel....the staff, the facility, comfort, ambiance and security all speak to the exceptional quality of this and all other Hilton Hotels for business and personal travel. A special thanks to all the staff who made this a great experience.

Needed an hotel in the OC and chose this one. Very happy I did. Very friendly staff at all levels. Good location. 15 mins to Disneyland w/o traffic. Close to Newport Beach. JW/OC airport close. Good breakfast. Safe area. Anyways, I highly recommend it and will return.

Summary Heading: Great Service in Charm Free Area
Summary: If you have to travel to Santa Ana area on business, stay at the Double Tree.  Staff here are excellent and caring, hotel quiet, food is good.  I had some requests during my stay that were taken care of quickly and without complaint.  There's a small "lake" in front of the hotel with live and sculpted waterfowl. If you need something to do other than your business meetings, you can take a shuttle to the South Coast Plaza.  But there's not much surrounding the hotel but offices and apartments.  I recommend this as a business hotel.

Very good hotel, I've been here for a business trip more than 8 days and all the staff is very friendly and the hotel manager is always available for any request. Good price (breakfast included)  compared to other hotels in the area, strategic position close to the airport, not so far from Disneyland , Newport, Huntington beach.

One of the best places to stay.  Very friendly staff and very clean rooms and property. We were greeted with a smile and the room was excellent.  Highly recommended!!! Great value also!!!  And the cookies were great, the front desk clerk even let me come back for seconds.

I like Doubletree and I have stayed in about 10 of them. The staff as always were great. but one lat night we ordered a pizza. Love the place hate the pizza. and becus you must have 200 characters I am typing this

It was a nice place and adhered to the traditional Double Tree standards.  Free Happy Hour appetizers was a nice little bonus. I am a Hilton Gold Member and this is my third time at this property.  My only concern with this place is the self-parking fee ($11). Unfortunately, I think this is the trend for most hotels in metropolitan areas as this was common amongst hotels near John Wayne Airport.

Summary Heading: If you like COLD SHOWERS, come on in.
Summary: Cold water for four days, heater went out, chair was broken when I arrived to the room, housekeeping is stingy with amenities and threw away a personal item, slab popped outside of exit doors which you want to take due to slow elevators, food is middle of the road there.

Good Service at the counter.  Room was kept clean.  The breakfast was decent, did not have variety.  Dinner was ok for the price of the plates.  Service was good though. The fitness room was small and crowded.  There was only one treadmill and a couple of elliptical  machines which were alway occupied. I will return.

Rooms were clean and the service from the front desk all the way through to the cleaners were great.. The cookies we were given at the front desk was delicious - would definitely recommend and will stay again if I am in the area again 😉😉😉😉😉

This Doubletree Club has been on our list of 3 favorite places to stay since we first discovered it over 10 years ago.  After our most recent stay, I will reconsider not staying here again unless other choices are not available.  We checked in late because we were at DL all day.  Started off good - we had pre-checked in and picked our room, so we were greeted, thanked for being an Honors member and told we would receive free internet (that's a new thing - but it is "basic" internet and if you want "premium" you have to pay) and 2 bottles of Arrowhead water.  It always makes me chuckle - only in a hotel is being given a bottle of water I can buy at Costco for 25 cents considered a reward.  Lady asked if we were aware of their parking policy (code for "are you aware we charge you

Maybe it's because it's a "Doubletree Club" but it didn't live up to a Doubletree standard. Bad bed, noisy neighbors and tired property. The only standard item was the cookie.   Another Doubletree is around the corner and I recommend staying there.
Manager Response: Dear David S, Thank you for your review. I was disappointed to read that you didn't enjoy your stay with us. Should you allow us another opportunity in serving you we will do our very best to make sure your experience will not mirror your prior visit.   Sincerely, Sanjay

Summary: Stayed here for 1 night as I needed to be at the airport early. This hotel is near some offices so in the evening the area is dead with little within walkable distance except for a small strip mall with a couple of places to eat. Don't confuse this with the Doubletree which is just around the corner from this one.  The hotel looks like it was built in the 80s and has had a refit of the rooms which are OK except for the awfully loud fridge which I unplugged and the bathroom which was old and had cracked tiles where someone had pulled the shower curtain rail which was half hanging off and someone had tried to replace with tape!   I didn't eat in the hotel or use the pool.  If I am ever in the area again I would try the other Doubletree as it looked much newer.

This was an overnight busniness/leisure trip so the location was important as was a reasonable price.  This hotel offered airport/city location with very good service at a reasonable price. The room was clean and the bed comfortable.

Stayed here for the Surf City Marathon.  The hotel is clean and adequate for a short stay. The room was good sized. Not old or dirty. The bathroom was a little tired mainly the shower stall. Bleach the tile or something to make it look clean, it just looked more like an old motel shower stall. There is a restaurant on sight. But the property is very basic. Be advised there is a Doubletree 2 blocks down the street.  We made the mistake of the going there 1st not realizing the Doubletree Club was within a 1/4 mile. The staff was friendly. After returning from the marathon the staff gathered in the lobby and applauded all the runners that returned. Very sweet. Love it.  There really isn't anything nearby the property. Some little eateries like Togos and Starbucks are within walking

This is a standard hotel.  I never seen a hilton property so old, this should not belong to Hilton and should not represent Doubletree.  This hotel has 4 suites only.  Hamptons look better than this hotel.

Nice hotel, great service. The check in goes smooth. The hotel is on a man made lake, and it is a delight to walk around it. But the breakfast is rubbery and tasteless. Also every time I've come here the elevator breaks.

I stayed a night here on a business trip and on arrival my room wasn't available. Diego, the front desk attended took care of me and quickly got my room situation taken care of. Gotta love it when the people who are working at the hotel understand and work as quickly as possible to get you situated

Was driving down from the Bay area and had a late start. Called to confirm we would be checking in uber late..between 1-2 am...and was advised that would be no issue...and it wasn't nice quick check...hotel had convenient access to freeway..but not so close as to be bothered by freeway noise..

Summary Heading: great place to stay while on business
Summary: first time ever in Santa Ana for a business class actually held at the hotel (CCIM course).  Super convenient - John Wayne airport is a better airport to fly into than LAX.  Loved the cookie!  Business office had an Ethernet connection for my antiquated government computer!

We were not only greeted with great service on our check in day, but the ease of the shuttle to the marathon was amazing and then we were greeted by the wonderful staff with cheering, warm cookies, water and excitement when we returned from the Surf City Marathon.  They made us feel so special for running 26.2 miles!! thank you!!!

Clean rooms and nice view of the lake. It is very near Orange County Airport (about 3 miles). Very easy and convenient to go to offices in Santa Ana and Irvine. Not very far from downtown Los Angeles and of course, Disney.

Summary Heading: This place is great for travelers
Summary: This hotel is hidden behind some office buildings close to the John Wayne Airport.  I like this place because it's reasonable, its quiet, it's close to a lot of shopping at South Coast Plaza and restaurants.

This hotel is a bit outdated, especially the bathrooms.  It seemed clean and perfectly fine, but nothing impressive.  Personally I think the $15 charge to park was gratuitous.  The hot water in our bathroom didn't work, so we were allowed to shower in a neighboring room.  Kind of annoying, but it wasn't terrible.  Given the price of other nearby hotels, I'd stay here again.

Staff were genuinely friendly. I liked how they have a security in front at night. I felt very safe. It's a small hotel but very efficient. I will definitely stay here again. Their complimentary shuttle is definitely a plus!

LOVED the staff and the maid service. Our room was clean and pristine. They brought us extra towels and blankets and they were warm. They even gave my daughter a card with a cookie tin for her birthday!! This alone was a great gesturer of how our stay would be!

The staff are wonderful. The hotel needs to up its game in the lobby bar and restaurant. Couldn't get lunch at the bar on Sunday afternoon. Was told that I had to order from room service. The front desk were always very helpful when dealing with any issues. For that reason alone I would consider staying here again.

Even though I read quite a number of neutral and negative reviews about this DoubleTree property, I do have a pleasant and satisfied stay.  Check-in:  I use my Hilton app and choose my preferred room in advance.  The map shows clearly and correctly my preference (which is better than my experience in another DoubleTree property).  During the check-in at the counter, I just need to show my ID and then get the keys and the cookies - very efficient.  Room:  I choose a room at higher floor and away from elevator, which is always my preference.  The room 630 is actually of a reasonable size with a comfortable King bed.  Though the room actually faces a highway, I do not hear any traffic.  The Wi-Fi connectivity is also above-par and I do not have any problem in using Skype for

First of all, great service upon arrival from front desk team member named Diego. The room was clean, breakfast was delicious, the gym was great, and the airport shuttle drivers were courteous. Thank you for the great stay. I shall return!!

This hotel has been around but the owners do a great job of making this a comfortable place to stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable and have refrigerators. The workout room is small but has what you need including sanitizing wipes for the equipment and a cold water dispenser. I experienced a few problems including no hot water one morning and after contacting Sanjay Patel, he immediately took care if the issue and even had complimentary diet cokes brought to my room (amazingly, i had mentioned i wanted a diet coke when i had checked in a day earlier...the front desk gal must have remembered...impressive!). There is a nice full breakfast offering in the morning. There is valet parking that is the same price as daily parking and they are fast. I look forward to staying here

The Double Tree Hilton by the Los Angles airport wasn't what we expected. The representative that took our reservations told us the beds were queens but were actually full beds. The restaurant located in their hotel served our food at different times so we couldn't eat all together. The food was overcooked, very hard and they only had two servers for the entire restaurant.

Here for only one night. They hand you warm cookies on your arrival, which is nice better touch to leave in the room for your arrival. The room was clean, overlooked the man made lake. There were no towels in the room so had to get housekeeping. Amenities are basic. Parking was reasonable. Probably best suited for single night business travel. There are better hotels for airport location. Hutton Center is a business complex. Location is good for freeway access.

The room was clean, hotel staff was pleasant and efficient. Had to pay extra $20 to check-in early as no room with one queen bed available, so had to upgrade to two queen beds.  Hotel felt a bit dated but it was clean. The hotel offers a free shuttle to/from Disneyland but only from 9:00 AM to 10:30 PM.  A nice perk since far from Disneyland and not on ART route.  Skip the breakfast.  Costly and no better than Continental Breakfast although advertised as hot etc.  The food was truly barely edible. The oatmeal was really watery and the eggs were cold.  The bread and danish were stale. My daughter ended up having cereal although without milk since the date on the cartoon was old.  A shame I had to pay for two when really only ended up with a dry box of cereal and an apple.

This hotel is exactly as photographed.  With only two right turns onto the freeway, you can't beat the location - excellent for business travelers!  Not recommended for families unless you will spend most of your time off-site; the lobby is small and meetings will use the restaurant/bar area. The lake and pool are both nice.

Clean and comfortable room and bathroom.  I got a very good rate for this level of hotel.  My only complaint was the mini refrigerator made a low buzzing noise.  So unplugged it.  However, later when I turned on the air conditioning, I realized unplugging the refrigerator was not necessary as the AC made such a loud racket it would have been drowned out!  If I was staying more than one night I would have mentioned the issue.  I am confident they would have moved me to another room.

It is a good Hotel, The usual Doubletree Amentities.  They are focused on Service.  Location is veryconvenient to John Wayne Airport, San Ana, Costa Mesa and other areas,  Not long way from the Beach either

Summary Heading: DoubleTree staff excels to resolve unforseen issue
Summary: WE had planned a family Christmas celebration in a suite at the Double Tree Club near Orange County airport. Because of a maintenance issue no suites were available, Staff was very responsive by providing various options to resolve the issue. Once we choose an option they were further responsive in execution of the solution. Our kudos to DT staff and to Hilton for enabling capable people to resolve issues.

Stayed here for two days, and my room wasn't service had to re-use dirty towels the following day. My bed never made. The day I check out they keep knocking my door at 8am it was so annoying. I thought check-out is 12noon. I am not sure if I ever wanna come back to this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear 9F1B1,  Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We are very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service. We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our team. We appreciate your feedback, and will keep your comments in mind while we work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.   Thank you,  Sanjay Patel

Summary: Stayed twice in the past month.  This is a privately owned Hilton brand hotel.  Hotel shuttle was efficient.  Staff were mixed (some were helpful, others were somewhat indifferent).  Breakfast buffet is adequate.  Exercise room is adequate.  Internet was slow.  If the price is right, would stay again.

Summary Heading: Rooms can be very noisy based on location
Summary: Parking overflow can be far away. Breakfast is just average. Usually price to quality ratio is good given the older rooms. Be aware that room close.to the freeway tend to be noisy. HVAC unit in rooms are very noisy too.

Very efficient DoubleTree Club, close to the Orange County Airport and Costa Mesa businesses.  Free airport shuttle.  The staff are extremely knowledgeable about things to do in the area.  Situated next to a small lake, really lets you relax after a day on the road.

Love the location of this hotel. The free shuttle is a *WOW* factor each time. Also, enjoy the welcoming warm cookies and how each of the employees seems to like what they do.   The price I was able to secure on Black Friday sales makes the value really high.

Hotel Needs to be updated. Very hard to find, went to the wrong one. Great shuttle service and Valets. This hotel is close to the airport and has a nice lake water view. Nice patio for dining. Very poor HVAC system and shower head must be as old as the hotel. Doubletree should fork up another $5 bucks for a decent shower head and hot water is sporadic. Goes from luke warm to hot, back to Luke warm. Alejandra at the Front desk is great!

Great rooms, great views, great service, oh so friendly staff, feels like coming home whenever we are here - and the lake and the ducks are an added bonus! Doubletree is one of the best hotel chains, and this particular Doubletree is at the top of the list!

Everything there was very awesome, very clean, great professional staff. Rooms were great. Food was good. From the valet parking to the housekeeping ladies, to the security guard, the entire staff was great. easy check in, easy check out. the food at the restaurant was good, the drinks were priced decent and good also. We had a short stay, but enjoyed it very much. the price was also decent. the hotel did not stink, it was very clean. and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. only thing, would be if they offered free internet.

The property has large comfortable rooms. There is a nice desk with large workspace and plenty of light. The beds are very comfortable (firm with a soft top) and loaded with down pillows. The breakfast buffet was nice too.  Located with easy access to the 55 freeway, close to John Wayne Airport (SNA).

Summary Heading: Exactly what you expect from Doubletree--a good thing!
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for two nights. I ordered room service for dinner both nights, and I was impressed with the variety on the menu and quick delivery. My room was clean, spacious (one queen bed and a couch with coffee table, perfect when traveling alone.) and well maintained. Hotel shuttle to the airport must be scheduled, but it is a quick 10-15 minute trip. Only thing lacking was a gift/snack area in the lobby to grab a water or snack on the way out. Vending machines on the room floors only take dollars, not credit cards and I didn't have change.

Every time I stay at the Doubletree Club, I am greeted by the same friendly people. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The food is very good, and the night bar staff (Julio) is always pleasant and professional. This is my spot for this area.

Overall, this was a very nice hotel.  I arrived early, and had to wait for 45 minutes for my room to be cleaned before check in, which was a little stressful as I was there for a meeting and had to get ready for my presentation.  Once they got me into the room though, it was excellent.  The staff was very friendly, professional and courteous.  The room was very nice, clean and enjoyable.  A great experience, as I have grown to expect from the Doubletree brand.  A!

Very different experience for a Hilton property. Decent staff and rooms. The decor is a bit outdated. The rooms were decent other than some old fixtures and the shower was very uninviting. I travel all over for work and this was one of the lesser delightful experiences in a Hilton.

The staff at this hotel are consistently great.  Warm, friendly and welcoming.  I have stayed here on business for 4 months.  They are attentive and seek to please the guests.  Rooms are clean and neat.  Public space is clean and neat.  Internet works.  Dean, at the front desk at night is amazingly attentive.   He follows through and makes the stay comfortable if you are coming in late. Beds are comfortable.  Towels available at the pool.

It was clean, the staffs were very helpful, the location is good and the lake is very beautiful, our stay did not consist of breakfast, so we did not try it. They charge 11$  daily for parking. The warm cookies were excellent. I highly recommend it.

I travel frequently for business and stay nearly exclusively at Hilton properties.  When I'm in Orange County, I generally stay at Embassy Suites, but this time ended up at the DoubleTree Club.  I hope that I don't have to stay here again(I'm here right now and feel the need to write this review).  First negative-there is hardly any parking for  hotel this size.  Although the valet parking is the same price, it was a little frustrating to arrive at 6:30pm and not be able to get my own spot, have to circle back around to drop the car at valet.  Negative two-I checked in online the day before and received a confirmation text about my two queen bed room.  Upon check in at the front desk, they had absolutely no record of this...(maybe not their fault, but the Embassy and Hilton
