Again, luckily they had a room open and I was able to switch.  Nice, helpful people, especially Chris.  Thank you again.

The staff (front desk and restaurant) were wonderfully friendly and helpful.  I was disappointed in having to pay for parking, but it was only $12.  Room furnishings were dated and room was small, but everything worked and the room was quiet.

We were allowed to check in at 1pm, not given room upgrades for being gold member though.  Cookies and Breakfast vouchers were given as well.  The room is on the smaller side, but it's clean and well kept.  We especially like the pond in front of the hotel, which you can see some animals.  Starbucks is within walking distance.

Come here twice a year for a scrapbooking retreat.  The place is awesome for their staff alone.  Some of same people have been here for the six years I have been coming.  Am always welcomed with hugs, saying how glad they are to see me.  Great service at meals.  Always eager to please in every way.  Perfect location for all types of visitors.  Great place to stay.

This hotel was great for the price! The customer service was excellent! We were there for a cruise the following day and the guy behind the counter was engaging and even printed directions to Long Beach Pier!  The rooms were very clean and had a fresh clean smell! There was soft music playing as we entered the room which was a nice touch!  The bed was extremely comfortable! Fell right asleep! I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in the area! You wouldn't be disappointed!

This was the worse double tree hotel ever. The customer serves is very poor, and the facilities are dirty. I made a reservation for a lakeside view on the 6th floor, they did not have my reservation available and they downgraded me to a two bed king side room, on the second floor. I was unable to sleep because my room was right next to the freeway and there were a lot of cars driving by. There was dust and hair next to the nigh stands. It was disgusting.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are very sorry that you weren't happy with your guestroom during your recent trip. We try to accommodate all reservations but occasionally a hotel guest may extend their stay, which may cause a room type to be unavailable.We do our best  to accommodate our guests requests. Our housekeeping team has been made aware of your comments to ensure that they are checking the area around our nightstands when they are servicing our rooms. Your feedback is greatly appreciated, and we hope you will give us a second chance if you return to the area.  Best regards, Kara Kellogg

Summary: This double tree was clean and the service was good and fast. check in was a breeze and staff were very nice and personable. I was only there for one night, but the place was great. The front desk was great!

Stayed here several times and if it wasn't for the food staff would stay somewhere else. I am a Diamond member and have even called ahead to ask for a lakeside room. The front desk has never been accommodating, even told me I have to pay extra for that. ( not what you should say, if anything say you'll make a note of it and will try) remember I am aDiamond member, upgrades are usually part of the perks so I understand they can't accommodate you always but it is nice if they do. So, this reservation I paid the additional fee for the lakeside. Got to the hotel and it wasn't available, what??, so rather than changing my room fee, gave me free parking....then, even after saying just give me a quiet room away from the freeway what do I get? The very end room directly by the

The hotel is going thru renovation and access is limited to the fitness center. I asked for access early so I can get my run in and the front desk clerk won't accommodate me. She refused because "the route to the fitness center was limited" - it has nothing to do with the operating hours.  I had to change my routine to a night run.  The treadmill stop working after 15 min. I told the front desk clerk and all she can say was she'll call maintenance.  My shuttle wait from the airport was over 35 min. after I had called to be picked up.  During the wait, the shuttle for the other Double Tree (across the street) had made 2 trips. Not a very good experience. Left feedback for Manager and no one care enough to contact me.

The rooms are smallish and if you had more than 3 people in the room it would be a tight fit.  These rooms although nice, you can tell they are old as there is popcorn ceiling, stains on the sofa and small chipped and crusted edges on some of the furniture. If you plan to stay at this location request for the lake view as the other side would face toward ever busy highway US 55.

The hotel was clean although the fan on the AC was very loud and I had to sleep with a pillow over my head. While breakfast was good, there were not a lot of choices. This didn't bother me since what I wanted was there, but a co-worker did mention the lack of variety.
Manager Response: Thank you for the TripAdvisor review! We look forward to hearing our guests reviews whether positive or negative. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay over all. We are in the process of replacing our AC units with newer, quieter ones, and are constantly working on new breakfast items to keep up with all  our guests different dietary needs.  We hope that you will return if your travels bring you back to Orange County.  Best regards, Kara Kellogg

Summary: Old hotel that badly needs updating.  Reminds me more of a motel setting than what I expect of a Doubletree hotel.  The beds were too soft and very uncomfortable.  The breakfast buffett was a bunch of cheap carbs and not a quality meal.
Manager Response: Dan,  Thank you for your feedback. We’re sorry the food quality at breakfast didn’t meet your expectations. At our property, we want to serve fresh, tasty dishes with the caring touches of home. We work continually to improve our menu offerings, and your comments will help us improve. We hope you’ll stay with us the next time you’re in the area, and let us make it right.  Kind Regards, Kara Kellogg

Summary: The staff are always helpful, the rooms lovely and spacious, the breakfast buffet fresh and delicious!  We like that there are two good newspapers and all is always nice and clean.  This is an outstanding hotel both for business and leisure, family, single or couple.  Of course, the cookies are delicious, the parking and proximity to SCP mall, along with 4-mile radius hotel shuttle, extremely, convenient!  The beautiful (person-made) lake and fountain are serene, with bevies of ducks at any glance.  It is a sheer delight to stay at this hotel.  Again, the staff are consistently outstanding in their commitment to guests--It's the hallmark of this Doubletree!

We spent 2 nights at the DoubleTree, Santa Ana, CA.  Because our daughter was playing in a softball tournament we were up early and down to the breakfast at 6am when the doors opened.  The food was ready, hot and there was plenty to choose from.  There was a great assortment of breakfast items for every person from bacon/eggs, French toast to hot oatmeal, cold cereal, fruit, coffee, juice, milk.   We realized hours after our check-out before our 7 hour drive home that we had left a bag of clothes in the room.  By the time I made the phone call and returned to the hotel they had our bag and 3 hot cookies for us.  Excellent customer service - will definitely return to this DoubleTree on our next visit.

Stay away until construction is complete.  Hotel was noticeably old and construction was under way to improve facility.  However, construction noise was noticeable and distracting.  No apology for construction was provided by staff and price was not adjusted to a lower Double Tree rate considering the poor hotel circumstances.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay. We’re very sorry you were unhappy with your experience at our hotel. We appreciate hearing from you, and wanted to let you know that we will be completing the renovation soon. The carpet installation will be finished by Monday, October 6. We apologize that the noise from the construction disturbed your comfort. We had hoped with the hours of work being done between am to 6pm we could keep noise to a minimum. We do apologize and if yours travels bring you to our area, we hope we have the opportunity to make it right.  Kind Regards, Kara Kellogg

Summary Heading: Fabulous Place to stay!! will return!
Summary: The hotel is perfect! much prettier inside than out. the pool is warm & the hot tub is perfection. we were upgraded for free-but all the rooms are clean & welcoming. you will enjoy it! the breakfast is great too- pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, toast/bagels, muffins, cereal bar etc. Ask for Garrison, he is a pleasure to work with.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful 5 Star review! We are so happy that you had such a great stay. Everything from the room and food, to our staff. Garrison is one of our newest team members, and we will certainly be sharing your comments with him.  We hope to see you back for another great stay when your travels bring you back this way. See you soon!  Kara Kellogg

Summary: I have stayed here multiple times for business, and always look forward to it! Clean, modern property, close to airport and restaurants, and the staff is first class!  Great breakfast buffet and evening drink service.  The staff is always in a good mood and willing to help. Highly recommend this property;  great value for the money!

Very convenient location wise - close to airport and office in Santa Ana. Would have appreciated complimentary breakfast in the room charges. Lot of options for dinner in walking distance to the hotel. A very hotel for business traveler.

Spent two nights.  Front desk, valet and the staff handling the ample breakfast buffet were very cordial.  I felt the management and staff were motivated to provide the best service and a clean room.  Very pleased and will stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great 5 star review! We are so happy to hear the wonderful comments regarding our staff. With all of the different hotels to choose from, making our guests feel special and treating them well is a must. Our loyal and return guests are what we work towards. I am glad we succeeded. We look forward to your next stay and making you feel “at home”.  See you soon! Kara Kellogg

Summary Heading: Fine property in an office complex
Summary: Quick and easy check in. Reasonably priced valet parking. Great warm cookies. Updated and comfortable room overlooking the "lake" Decent breakfast ( nothing special ) Pleasant staff. Very Warm elevator waiting areas on HHonors floor. Wouldnt be my first choice whilst on vacation but for business travel it works just fine. Very clean outdoor pool.

Great check in; room was clean.  Room carpets were worn out and had holes. Furniture is in need of replacement.This hotel, a Doubletree Club, is badly in need of renovation and updating. the location ids near the airport.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review! We are sorry that you were not completely satisfied with your guest room. We are happy to let you know that we have been undergoing a guest room carpet renovation that should be completed by the end of September. We are  also in the process of updating our desk chairs to a new ergonomic style, installing in-room safes, drapery sheers, and resurfacing our bathroom tubs. We hope you will give us another opportunity to show you our freshly updated rooms, when you return to the OC. Regards, Kara Kellogg DOS

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel over the last year multiple times. I have had an excellent experience each time. The staff are friendly and thoughtful. I felt like I was coming home each time that I have stayed at this location. Carnetta works at the front desk and every time she always makes me feel like I am the most important person and she cares about my day, my stay and does what is necessary to make my stay to be the best. She is just one example of the incredible staff. I enjoy coming to this hotel.

The staff was incredibly friendly, the room was clean and cool when I checked in and the bed was really comfy.  I liked how the towels were folded like flowers, and even the tissues were made to look like a rose.  This place also had a great price and I will most definitely stay here again the next time I'm in town. I really enjoyed the lake view room as well!
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 star review!  We really appreciate the great comments about our staff and hotel. I will definitely be sharing your nice comments with our employees. We are happy you enjoyed your visit and hope to see you on your next trip to Orange County.  Sincerely, Kara Kellogg  Director of Sales

Summary: We stayed for one night to attend a friend's wedding. The room was nice, the beds were comfortable, and we were happy with our stay. The front desk staff Carnetta and Marissa were wonderful. We were allowed to stay well past checkout at no extra charge to get ready for a friend's wedding. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. We are so pleased that you had a great stay. We know weddings can be a stressful time and am glad we were able to accommodate you with a late check out. We will definitely pass along your nice comments about Carnetta and Marissa. They will appreciate it. We hope to see you back when your travels bring you back to Orange County.  Regards,  Kara Kellogg

Summary: This property is very convienent to SNA airport.  However is you are going to be visiting other areas, such as LA, Disney, knots berry farm, Hollywood area you will need a car.  Hotel is about a 20-40 minute drive to the la / Hollywood area and about 10 minute drive to Disney.  All depends on traffic. Good location if you have a morning flight out of SNA and need a place nearby. Reasonable room rate.  Property does have a pool and fitness center.  If you do have a car charge is $11 per night for self serve or valet.  Room was clean.  If you drive, use your gps as it can be a bit confusing.  My only issue that if had was it was a bit warm in the room. I was in a corner room and it had 2 units.  1 was running constantly, the other one was running minimally even at high speed.

I had a Good two week stay. Not much around to do. Need a car to travel everywhere but since work was close i decided to stay here. Food was fresh and staff was very friendly and welcoming. Overall Nice atmosphere

5th floor AC outside of elevators in the hallway blew out hot air - with slow elevators, it was miserable standing there waiting with the hot air blowing on you. Also - the bar wasn't open during the afternoon.

I travel a bit on business and stay at Hiltons.  .   My room was on the second floor - my profile states that I prefer higher floors.  When I checked in the desk clerk said they were sold out - maybe next time I can get a room on the upper floor.  The room was stuffy when I walked in.  The air conditioner was blowing up the blackout curtain and cooling the window.  I rearranged the curtain and removed the filters to allow for better air flow.  The filters were clogged and dirty, the bathroom was dingy.   I would not stay at this location again.  There are other Doubletree hotels close to the Orange County Airport that will get my business in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay with us. We are very sorry that you were disappointed with the cleanliness of your guest room. We try to be very vigilant in this area because we know how important it is for our guests. Based upon your review, we are actively working with our housekeeping staff so this situation doesn’t happen again. We will also be installing new guest room carpet and replacing our air conditioners over the next month. We hope that if your travels bring you back to the area, you’ll give us another opportunity to serve you and make it right. Kind regards, Kara Kellogg Director of Sales

Summary: Just to say thank you to Lindsay, Garrison & Denise for being so helpful and making us feel comfortable.  Even the parking lot attendant was great.  He played soccer like my daughter (do not recall his name).

location is very nice, convenient to Orange County airport - literally just off property.  On arrival - self parking is a breeze though valet parking is available. Outside restaurant there is a pretty outdoor space (large patios) to relax, a couple of patios bordering a man made lake with a perimeter walking path.  Staff was very nice.  Plan to stay at this hotel again - all future trips.

Summary Heading: Slightly older but well kept in nice location
Summary: The age of this structure is apparent, especially in the guest rooms, but management has done a good job overall of making the hotel feel modern and nice.  The elevators are fast and spacious.  The setting on a small lake is pleasant and makes for a great place to take a short walk.  My request for a quiet room was granted allowing for two restful nights sleep.  I would surely return to this location for my business lodging needs.

Do not pick the lake side view, you will be kept up by the noise from the patio below.  I could not fall asleep due to the loud noise and I was on the 4th floor.  I had to turn the AC down to 69 to keep the fan going and reduce the noise.
Manager Response: We’re very sorry for the noise issue you encountered during your stay at our hotel. Your comfort and safety is our number one concern, and we appreciate that you brought this to our attention.We will be reviewing this issue with our department heads and security personnel. This will help us correct similar issues in the future. We hope that the next time you’re in the area you’ll consider staying with us again. Best regards, Kara Kellogg Director Of Sales

Summary: When I first arrived, the housekeeper opened the door and made sure the cooler was on. The room was comfortable and clean. The food at the restaurant was good and at the proper so the soup was hot and the ice-cream was not melted.

We reserved 3 rooms to attend a wedding.  When we arrived we were told they only had 2 rooms available even though I was standing there with the confirmations.  Better than the people next to me who were told that even though they thought they had a reservation through a 3rd party website, they did not. We stayed in the two rooms that night until we could find another place to stay the next day. One room was fairly nice - a corner king, while the other one was pretty run down. Very disappointing for a Hilton property. Don't let their website picture fool you either.  While there is a pond out front, it is totally circled by tall buildings. Again, not what I expected from one of their Club properties. Lots of "not our problem" and no help from the staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We are truly sorry that we fell short on making your stay an enjoyable one. I will be reviewing the situation with our front desk and reservations managers to help ensure all 3rd party bookings do not have this problem in the future. Our biggest priority is to have our guests enjoy a problem free stay. We hope if you return to the Orange County area, that you will give us another try. Please feel free to contact me directly.  Sincerely, Kara Kellogg

Summary: My husband and I spent a long weekend here while attending a family wedding in a nearby venue. We were very comfortable, the bed and shower were great. Breakfast was just ok. Antonio gets a shout out for terrific service & a warm greeting each morning. The surrounding grounds & man made lake provide a scenic walking path. The gym was clean and equipment was fine. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again if I visit the area.

Summary Heading: Very accommodating - Thank you very much!
Summary: This hotel is a great place to stay - clean and comfortable.  It is close to the mall, restaurants, and events.  The front desk staff (male) was very accommodating, efficient, and professional.  I apologize that I do not have his name - Thank you very much for helping with my mistake. I truly appreciate your assistance in starting our mini vacation off to a great start.
Manager Response: Dear Leilani A,  We want to thank you for the 5 Star review! We are happy that one of our agents was able to help you during your stay.I will be sharing your comment with our front desk staff.  I hope you had a great mini vacation and that you will return for the next one.  Happy travels!  Kara Kellogg  Director of Sales

Summary: Easy check-in, quick food service, good burger nice evening of sleep, great car service, fast checkout. Everyone was nice friendly and attentive - couldn't ask for more - nothing over the top luxurious but that was not required. Just a honest clean room with friendly people and quiet

I picked the hotel based on price and almost canceled because the reviews i read said that hotel was in bad shape.  Nothing could be further from the truth.  The decor was modern and comfortable.  I also enjoyed the 52 foot pool which worked out well for lap swimming.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post such a nice review! We really appreciate your comments regarding the decor and comfort of our hotel. We are also pleased you took advantage of our great lap pool. We will continue to update our hotel in September with new guest room carpet, desk chairs, and addition of guest room safes. Look forward to seeing you back with us when your travels bring you back to Orange County. Sincerely, Kara Kellogg

Summary Heading: Convenient location, good value, but DATED
Summary: This would be a great hotel if they remodeled/updated the rooms.  I've stayed here on 5 occasions for business travel.    The rooms feel a little dirty because they are kind of old. The AC machine was super loud and made the bed vibrate!!  Each time I've stayed there have been large parties of poorly-behaved teenagers on sports teams (with parents). They yell and run down the halls, blare music late at night, and make a lot of noise in their rooms.   Some of the front desk staff are very nice and helpful. But one woman was extremely rude to me when I asked her to please tell the teenagers across the hall to stop blaring music late at night.   My employer has a special rate at this hotel so I get free parking, free internet, and free breakfast. These make it a great deal. There's

Summary Heading: Hotel not up to Hilton quality
Summary: This hotel is not what you would expect at a Hilton; the rooms are small, outdated, and the in-room air conditioner was so loud it ruined our stay.  Since they were full there were no rooms to transfer to.  I would not recommend this hotel to fellow travelers.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We are very sorry you were unhappy with the appearance and A/C in your guestroom. We appreciate your feedback.  We are excited to let you know about some of the improvements we are doing in the month of September. We will be doing a complete guest room carpet replacement, along with new desk chairs and on going replacement of A/C units. We hope  you will stay with us again soon and tell us what you think about our improvements. Sincerely, Kara Kellogg Director Of Sales

Summary: The double tree club Hotel was a rewarding experience. It is Quiet, and the rooms are very comfortable for the working person. The Bar and restraint have a very friendly and helpful staff.  The Front Desk was also very helpful. Breakfast and restraint food are quite good, and the Bar is pleasantly staffed.  I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great 5 Star review! We will be sharing your nice comments regarding our front desk and bar staff with all team members. We are glad you had such an enjoyable stay, and hope to see you back with us soon. Sincerely, Kara Kellogg Director Of Sales

Summary: Bed was very comfortable but air conditioner was loud and turned off and on too frequently.  Chairs were dirty and worn.  Also had to pay to park in the hotels parking lot.  Overall experience was average.

On a business trip and find this Doubletree a good choice. It is very close to SNA airport, but no noise from the airplanes. Room is clean, friendly, quiet, convenient. Valet parking cost the same as the self-park so make sure you take advantage of it. Dinning area is next to a garden.

The hotel offered a discount to a block of hotels for a wedding.  We received complimentary parking and complimentary breakfast along with our discounted room.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in a clean, quiet, well appointed room.  The staff were kind and efficient.  I photographed the turtles in the large "lake."  We walked around the lake and enjoyed the ducks.

Thanks for honoring my comment that local calls are no charge. Your people don't have to knock at my door if I need anything. They may insert a note at the bottom of my door for any message they need.  They may call too.  That tiny peep hole at the door is too large.

Summary Heading: The room/door need to check the door all the way shut.
Summary: Please be sure the door all the way closed after room service.clean.  Door was not all the way shut when I came back from my meeting.  Thanks god nothing was missing. I didn't really care about my belonging...my main concerns was my work laptop.

Summary Heading: First time at this hotel - 2 night stay
Summary: The house keeping was not thorogh. They forgot some things to make the coffee in my room. They missed one towel or mat for the bathroom. The trash bin in the room was not completely empty. They did not provide me with breakfast room service requests. When I got there the bulbs in the bedside lamp was out, but they did change it right away. When my room service was delivered, they forgot my steak sauce.  I will stay here if this is the only hotel in the area that has availability, if not I would not recommend this hotel.

I was just an average hotel, service was not that good. It was about 11:30 PM and no one was at the front desk, we had to wait about 10 minutes for someone to check us in.  The breakfast buffet included in the room rate was not good, a waitress asked me if I would like more coffee and I said "Yes" and she did not come back with the coffee.  I would not come back again.

Summary Heading: If you are in the John Wayne Airport Area
Summary: Definitely close 55/405 and JW, but not so close that you can hear it.  A nice setting next to the lake.  If you are working in the area, this is one of better locations.   What I like is the great breakfast (pancakes, real eggs, bacon, fruit, etc) and if you call 10 mins ahead, the valets get your car. Lindsay is a real problem solver and has taught my team what service means.

Small hotel with old style decor and rooms. Dirty. Smelled suspicious. Ice Machine not working on HH designated floor. Limited food options. Breakfast Buffet ends at 10-Exactly!!! Even on Weekend days. Loud noises and neighbors. Many better hotels of equal pricing surround this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We are very sorry you were unhappy during your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback, and will keep your comments in mind about the buffet time and room decor. In September, we will be updating all guest rooms with new carpet to improve our guest’s experience. We hope you’ll stay with us again soon and tell us what you think about our improvements.  Kind Regards, Kara Kellogg

Summary: Nice hotel but nothing in walking distance so you're pretty much stuck with the hotel restaurant. Food is good, rooms are nice. Gym has very nice machines but is about the size of a regular room. Breakfast is good but $17. Despite the fact we were clearly flight crew and Silver members we were refused a breakfast voucher when checking in.  Next morning I saw about half the patrons using a breakfast voucher so that's a little strange.

Summary Heading: Ok hotel but parking is a nightmare
Summary: I'm a frequent user of the Hilton brand but I would probably not stay at this hotel again because the parking situation is a nightmare.  They have limited parking that you have to pay for and if it's full you have to use valet service.  The valet is outsourced and they really don't do a good job.  Also, the property is just very old and the rooms are getting outdated.    The staff was very nice but being nice at a run-down facility can only go so far.  We usually stay at one of the local Hilton's and the service and facilities are much nicer.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We will be sharing your comments with our parking manager and staff. With the very busy summer months ahead of us, our focus is to make your parking experience as easy as possible. To help with this, we do offer the same charge for self or valet parking.  We will also be doing some upgrades to our rooms in September, which includes new carpet in all rooms. We hope if you return to the area you will give us another try, and that  your stay will be as nice as our staff! Regards, Kara Kellogg

Summary: I have been staying at this hotel for several years - both business and pleasure.  They have always had great people that makes the difference. The desk folks starting with Marrissa, Carnetta and Lindsey are very congenial and are truly looking for ways to be of assistance!  The only frustration now-a-days is I have a hard time getting into the hotel when I need to without giving them several weeks notice and room pricing continues to go up!?  Their people truly make the difference! - Mark
Manager Response: Mark, Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review. Having loyal guests like you is what we strive for. We will definitely be sharing your nice comments with Marissa, Carnetta and Lindsey. It will make their day. With the summer months upon us, the hotel does sell out sooner and finding anything in the area is difficult. Make your reservations as soon as possible. If your plans change, you usually have a time frame that you may cancel without penalty. We hope to see you back soon! Kara Kellogg

Summary: My husband and I needed to rest. We were extremely happy with our stay at your Hotel! Thank you! The only problem was the elevator going down was not working but we didn't mind it so much. Our stay was well worth it! By the way, the receiving desk personnel are wonderful and the Hotel workers are very polite. Please thank them for their efforts, hard work, and dedication.         Thank you
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 star review! We are glad that you and your husband had such a nice time. We will definitely be reviewing your nice comments with all of our staff. They will really appreciate it. We hope to see you back soon for another great stay. Sincerely, Kara Kellogg

Summary Heading: Not bad but not great - convenient to airport
Summary: This is your basic Doubletree.  Somewhat dated, basic rooms but spotlessly clean, comfortable and quiet.  Less than 5 minutes (yes, that's true) from John Wayne Airport (at least at 06:00).  Only complaint is that they charge for parking which strikes me as a bit narrow minded for a somewhat suburban, basic hotel.  Valet's were very friendly and responsive - as was all staff.

The staff was very accommodating with my request for an early check in. As someone traveling across timezones, this was appreciated.   Also, the hotel is convenient to the airport and the price was very reasonable for the amenities offered.

It was OK.  Average hotel.  The frig in the room was very loud.  We had to unplug it when we went to sleep.  Room was comfortable.  Close to freeway.  Chocolate chip cookies were very good.  People were very nice.

The location is very good. All the places around that area are new and fashionable. Also, there are many restaurants and close Starbucks. You do not use the car to access them. The other thing the place is very quite. The lake which front the hotel is very beautiful. In addition, all the gays who work there are very nice and helpful. The cookies that they provide is the best cookies that I have tasted in all my life.

Summary Heading: Love the cookies but thats all.
Summary: Front desk staff very unfriendly. Room was just so, so. I expected more from a Hilton property. Coffee maker still had old coffee pods left in it. Bathroom shower had mold in the grout. Fire alarm was set off and there was no one telling guests what was going on even after the fire dept. came and gave the all clear the alarm was still going off.

We had a pleasant stay here while our house was being tented for termites.  The staff was very helpful and only charged one of our cars for parking.  The cookies were delicious and the room was large and clean.  Only odd thing was everything from the frig to the TV was unplugged when we first arrived.

Just completed a 4 night stay here, and won't be back.  I have stayed here several times before, but more recently have been staying at the Doubletree across the street. For reference, I am a Hilton Diamond member and have been so for at least the past 10 years.    My first room smelled AWFUL and the air conditioning unit was making very loud squeaking sounds, which I certainly wasn't going to be able to sleep through.    The second room I was offered (by the front desk attendant who seemed quite annoyed) was right next to the elevator and the vending machine.  At this point, I had traveled cross country and wanted to relax. I couldn't really hear any noise from the elevator or vending machines so it seemed ok.  The rooms in general seem "clean" but upon further inspection
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are truly sorry that you were unhappy with your recent stay. All of your feedback will be discussed with our department heads and addressed. As far as some of the condition comments, we are excited that new sheers, desk chairs and even air conditioners are being replaced. New carpet will be installed in all rooms this September. We hope that you will give us another opportunity to make your stay enjoyable and problem free! Regards, Kara Kellogg Director Of sales

Summary: Booked the trip for "baby moon".  Paid in advance.  Money taken from credit card right away.  Received two confirmation emails.  Wanted it to be perfect.  Even used the hilton honor credit card and am a gold member.  Arrived to hotel and they said "oops, someone wanted to stay an extra day so we don't have a suite for you."  what's the point of paying in advance and joined and climbed up their honor system to "gold" status if they can bump you like you're nothing.  Had to all squeeze into a little room they finally gave us. Obviously they don't care about advanced purchase or honor status. Turn out to be a very bad trip.
Manager Response: We are very sorry for the inconvenience you experienced during your recent trip. Thank you for your flexibility and your review. At our hotel, we hate to not accommodate a guest in the room they have booked. Unfortunately on a sold out weekend, a guest changing their plans can make it difficult for others. As a valued Gold member we failed in not being able to accommodate your request. We have shared your comments with our front office, and we’re evaluating our policies and procedures. We hope that if your travels bring you back to the area you will provide us with another opportunity to make your stay great! Please feel free to contact me, and based on availability I will be happy to upgrade you to one of our suites. Sincerely, Kara Kellogg Kara,Kellogg@hilton.com

Summary: Pros +superb staff; extremely helpful. E.g., I needed to warm my pizza slices, and I had a microwave oven delivered to my room! Beat that! +good rooms w amenities; newer furniture, decor +shuttle service; great crew! +free internet if you've status w the Hilton loyalty program +free cookie-:) +usually have always provided additional toiletries like mouthwash, toothpaste, always useful.  Cons -parking fees  Summary Stayed here multiple times, work close by, and am able to use the shuttle generously! Have complimented the staff several times, and would stay again and recommend it to others.
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 Star review! We strive to offer the highest quality of service to our guests and are pleased that we have succeeded. I will be sharing your great comments with our staff and management. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Sincerely, Kara Kellogg Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel But Rooms Need A Little TLC
Summary: We stayed at the Double Tree Club in Orange County for one night before going to our hotel in  Anaheim. The free shuttle came pretty quickly and the driver was super nice and helpful. Driving up to the hotel, I think my jaw fell open. It is so beautiful and classy looking. Lobby is very nice and the people at the front desk were very helpful and welcoming. A warm chocolate chip cookie doesn't hurt either :-)  The room was very comfortable and quiet. But there were a few things that took away from the elegance and beauty. The bathroom door had a stain on it, kind of looked like a toothpaste stain, and the sink had large cracks in it. I know, little things, but things that should be fixed otherwise it looks like management isn't concerned.  I would stay there again because it's

The employees at this hotel are outstanding. Everyone was friendly, accommodating, and attentive. I would definitely stay here again. My only suggestion, which is not unique to this hotel is to have better lighting and mirrors in the bathrooms. It is hard put makeup on. I usually bring a hand mirror with me but it would be nice to know I did not have to.

Wow, DoubleTree hit it out of the ballpark! We spend Labor Day weekend celebrating our anniversary and my birthday. The staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived the first day to a warm cookie. Although we arrived early our room was ready. They made sure that whatever request we had was promptly fulfilled. Our room was on the second floor with a view of the pond. It was nice to go out and enjoy nature, the fountain and the surroundings. It sure was a fine hotel with way more amenities than I even used. The only thing wrong was not having a cookie everyday!
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 star review! We are so glad that you enjoyed your special weekend with us. We hope to see you back  next year, and will have the Doubletree Cookies waitng.  Sincerely, Kara Kellogg

Summary Heading: Inconsiderate and no follow up, nice location and slept well
Summary: Made reservations to stay for 2 nights.  Flight from Chicago to Orange County/John Wayne was canceled after the hotel cancellation deadline of 6PM Pacific Time.  There was no way to inform Doubletree of hotel cancellation prior to the 6PM PT deadline.  After the flight was canceled, I called Doubletree to cancel the first night.  When informed I would be charged I asked to not be charged because the flight was canceled after the hotel cancellation deadline.  I was told the manager would review and get back before I checked out after the second day.  I never heard back, but the final bill showed the charges for the first night.   Thus, Poor on Service (no management follow up) and Value (was charged 2X for 1 night).
Manager Response: We’re sorry about your experience dealing with your room cancellation. We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel and your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and please feel free to reach out to me so that we can discuss your situation further. Kind Regards, Kara Kellogg, Director of Sales

Summary: After a long day of moving two kids out of college, got to the hotel very late and had dinner around 9:30pm.  Food was good and service excellent.  Breakfast service was excellent also.   The valet service was very convenient and they will shuttle you within a 4 mile radius, very short wait for the valet.  Of course the cookies help.

This is one of our preferred hotels when we visit Disneyland.  Because we plan trips in advance, we can usually get a rate of less than $90/day.  The only time we stay in Anaheim is when our other preferred Hilton hotels (Hampton Inn or Garden Inn) have special rates/promotions.  The hotel is beautiful, the beds and pillows to die for, the rooms are soundproofed well (HHonors members are usually on the 4th or 5th floor), the staff FANTASTIC, and we can take Harbor Blvd to Disneyland from the hotel (lots of restaurants and shopping on the way) and avoid the freeway.  The hotel charges $11 for parking whether you valet or not, but we get Wi-Fi for free because we're Hilton Honors members, so I don't mind (most hotels in the area worth staying at charge for parking).  We come back
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post such a great review! Having loyal guests such as you are what we strive for. With so many Hilton properties in the area, we are pleased that for 10 years you have chosen to stay with us. I will share your comments with all of our wonderful staff. It will make their day! We hope to see you back soon on your next trip. Please feel free to contact me if you ever need assistance with reservations. Sincerely, Kara Kellogg Director of Sales

Summary Heading: in past great, this time not so great
Summary: first room smelled horrible, second room smelled horrible, third room fine. front desk very kind and helpful throughout though.  returned from an event to a full self-parking lot. told we would just have to wait until someone in self parking left. could only park via valet. offered to pay for valet, just let us park ourselves. refused. after some hassle finally allowed to park.   besides the smelly rooms, the rooms are really comfortable, and quiet. staff, besides parking attendant issue, really helpful and nice.

I had the corner room with lots of windows.  I spent quite a bit of time in my room studying and working and all the windows made it a very enjoyable place.  The room was pretty spacious.  All of the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating.  I interacted with a couple valets, a couple front desk people, and a couple of the staff that work in the restaurant and could not have been happier with their service.  They let me into my room earlier than check in.  When my wife came to visit for a few hours with the kids they let her park for free in the lot.   They gave me some vouchers for free breakfast.  (The food was good, but I would never have paid full price for it so I appreciated the vouchers.)   The staff in the restaurant were attentive and very nice.    The only real

The rooms were nice...kids like the pond that you could walk around and feed the ducks. Breakfast was good with hot food. The staff was very helpful and pleasant! We really liked that there was a mini-fridge in the room. We will be back next year. The only thing was that the pool was right by the fwy and it was kinda noisy but it didn't seem to bother the kids.

Summary Heading: Room was clean service was average
Summary: As title says it was clean and the service was ok. Nothing really stood out to outstanding at this hotel. The are surrounding the hotel has a handfull of great restaurants that are quick and easy to access. Also perfect distance to beach and Angels Stadium.

If your on a budget, want quality stay and awesome customer service...highly recommend booking here. I Frequently stay here and always receive no more no less than best customer service. It's super clean rooms, polite staff willing to go the extra mile for its customers without hesitation.

Older hotel but wonderfully kept.  Staff is excellent at customer satisfaction.  Shuttle drivers very friendly and helpful.  Close to Starbucks where we gathered to visit.  In California for family reunion and several members stayed here.  A great experience.

As always Doubletree knock the ball out of the park! This is a great place for business conferences and staying together in one place! The service was excellent and they even have shuttle's to take you anywhere in a 5 mile direction!

Stayed here on a recent trip to the area.  Room was a bit outdated but clean and comfortable.  They also provide a free shuttle to local businesses and restaurants which is convenient if you do not want to hassle with parking. There is a restaurant and small bar at the hotel as well.  Was not terribly impressed with the snack I had there in the evening but the breakfast was fine. Front desk and shuttle service was very good.

Summary Heading: Diamond Member Appalled at Credit Card Policy
Summary: I arrived at the front desk to this alert: "If you provide a DEBIT or CREDIT CARD at check-in, Hotel will place a hold on your card for the total amount of your stay, plus $50.00 per day. This hold will not drop off for at least 72 hours following CHECK-OUT". As a business traveler and Hilton Honors Diamond member, this is a totally unacceptable policy.   When I asked front desk personnel about it, the young lady stated the policy was only for travelers who reserved rooms through 3rd party business travel systems and not if you made the reservation directly with the hotel. Another front desk person the next day actually blamed the policy on "Hilton Corp" and that it was included in my reservation confirmation. I checked my reservation documents and this policy was never included

Warning: There's another DoubleTree immediately across the street. We drove here with in-laws and ended up at different hotels (good thing!) Cookie at check-in is nice touch but would rather trade that for free WiFi. Cheapo hotels have it, a hotel specializing in business travelers should too (good LTE cell coverage though). Curtains left a gap due to bad design vs A/C placement but a well placed pillow is an easy fix and seemingly a frequent curse. Fixtures are nice, bed is amazingly soft and comfortable, good cleanliness, staff was pleasant. Would stay here again but will check price vs other Doubletree across the street. In-laws room was $30 cheaper.

We stayed one night while in town for a wedding. Room was very comfortable, though a/c was noisy. Breakfast and parking were included with wedding arrangement; breakfast was a complete hot meal, eggs and all.  Would stay here again if in the area.

Stayed here 3-4 times from 2005-2009 and it was a decent property.  Stayed there this past weekend for the first time in 5 years.  Sad to say, no one seems to take any pride in the place anymore.  The room I was given had a carpet that was absolutely filthy with dark dirt spots everywhere.  (There is a member of their housekeeping staff that vacuums that carpet everyday without ever once looking at how filthy it is and saying we really need to get that washed).  There was some sort of white stain on the arm of the armchair.  Who knows what that was.  The furniture was worn and tired.  When I arrived they had no cookies.  It's their signature amenity, in all of their ads.  How freakin' hard is it to make sure you have enough cookies especially with another Doubletree property 750
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay with us. We are very sorry that you were disappointed with the cleanliness of your guest room. We try to be very vigilant in this area because we know how important it is for our guests. Based upon your review, we are actively working with our housekeeping staff so they know when it is appropriate to deep wash our carpets and replace our furniture. We apologize that our signature cookies were not available to you on check-in and this will not be an issue in the future. We are very sorry that you did not have the experience that our guests usually receive and deserve. We hope you will give us another opportunity if your travels bring you back to the area.  Kind Regards,  Kara Kellogg Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Review of Doubletree By Hilton Orange County Airport
Summary: The hotel room was clean and fresh with plenty of room for our luggage and for us to go around. Room service and cleaning services were really nice also. The lake view was really beautiful as well. I would like to see two armchairs in such a room when I have booked the room for two so that I can sit and relax with my roommate, not one at a time. Also to have wifi internet access as a separate cost is totally ridiculous! We are living in the technology era and wifi access is the basic in almost all hotels. I have not seen any hotel or even a hostel without it in whole Europe!

Price of Breakfast Buffet was outrageous.  Don't recall seeing any signage about cost.  Quality of food was only average.  Otherwise great place with good value for room.  Very easy to get to airport.  No airport noise.  They keep wanting me to write a minimum of 200 Characters but don't know what else to say.

We enjoy the family feeling during our stays. Great location to all area attractions. Easy to freeway Quiet rooms, any time service is requested, quick to provide perfect service Great Food Always clean Great customer service

Summary Heading: Easy Experience and Worth Every Cent!
Summary: I got a deal from the Hilton website that offered free Breakfast, Wifi, and Parking for $140 a night. During checkout they welcomed my party with a warm cookie and made the checkout process easy. The double rooms where spacious and overlooking the lake. The gym is small but had the latest equipment machines with many towels. The breakfast experience offered many basic items from cereal, eggs, and drinks. I couldn't ask for more and my experience was great for the price I got for this Hotel.

Front office staff (Denise & Lyndsey) were incredibly friendly and helpful.  Front Office Manager Chris was stellar in dealing with a problem (not related to the hotel) that we were having.  This team exemplifies customer service.  Valets were also kind and helpful.

Should communicate issues with their members. Elevator was down, and we stayed on the 6th floor with a 2yr old that we had in a stroller. A simple phone call or a apology would of helped. Location was very nice and quite.

The location for business travel south of Los Angeles for meetings in Long Beach, Santa Ana and Irvine is fantastic.  Hotel staff is welcoming, friendly and eager to please.  I would not hesitate to stay here for any hotel needs in this area.

The Hotel wonderful. The staff fabulous. Amenities spectacular.  They really went out of their way to make me feel at home. Highly recommend anyone traveling though the Anaheim Area to stay here if at all possible. The cookies alone are worth it.

Summary Heading: Excellent Property - Great Management and Staff
Summary: This property is well maintained and the staff are very helpful.  It has a very good restaurant and nearby restaurants and shopping.  There is a fantastic pond and ducks right outside to walk around and lessen your stress.  Great place to stay for business or pleasure. Huge band for your buck!

I picked this property as I was looking for a place to stay to jump on an early flight out of John Wayne airport.  This property is approximately a couple of miles (by road) from the airport.  The hotel offers a shuttle on demand, but at least it is not shared with other hotels and was only a 10-20 minute trip, including wait time.  This property should not be confused with another Doubletree that is only a couple of blocks away - this is the one with the lake in front of it.    I did not get any upgrade as a Hilton elite (even with two floors designated as "HHonors") so my room was a standard issue facing the 55 freeway.  Noise was not an issue (thankfully) but I was more concerned with privacy as the office building directly behind had a direct view in.  Keep the curtains

This particular hotel was located a bit too close to major streets and freeway in Southern California.  The pool, while nice and clean, felt as if we were in the middle of the road.  The room was immaculate and fresh, however and we enjoyed our stay.  My kids really enjoy the cookies that are always fresh and hot at every Doubletree Hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post on TripAdvisor. We are glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay, and our warm Doubletree cookies.  We do hope that our  large, family friendly pool  makes up for some of the freeway noise and did not stop the kids from having fun. We hope to see you back soon and will keep the cookies warm.  Kara Kellogg

Summary: The hotel is overall very nice.  The decor is classic.  I love the sconces in the hallways, the hotel "feels" like it has class.  The room was good, but not great.  The restaurant was clean, but rarely had many people in it.  We did not eat there.  The pool and hot tub were great.  The pond is great.  The ducks are great.  I can't believe that we're charging for parking in this area, but just anticipate it.  The number of spaces provided for "Park it yourself" folks were limited.    Back to the room...overall, the room is pretty standard.  Although there are some upscale features, it wasn't much different than the room you'd get at a super 8 or motel 6.  Don't get me wrong, there are some nice features, but for the price, and the overall rating of the hotel, I just didn't see

Comfortabld stay. Clean rooms and public areas. Professional, friencly staff.  Dven though this property is located near a freeway, I hardly noticed any traffic noise.  Their business center has two computers and a printer for use fof guests.  The downside is that the room is enclosed and has no ventilation or air conditioning. After 5 minutesI was sweating BIG TIME.  A Starbucks and 3 or4 food court type restaraunts are located within walking distance. The hotel also has an Orange County bus stop right in front of it.

I had a great time nice facility! Great staff very nice! I was there with my family for pleasure not far from Disneyland! when i checked in i received a cookie very good by the way! Front desk helped me print out some tickets because their business center was closed!

I was very lucky to score an upgrade to "The Balboa Suite" on the top floor. Being on the corner it has almost no noise from other rooms. The suite is huge with dining and living areas, bedroom and large bathroom. The amenities are sparse, with just tea and coffee, but the room service was good.  While there I was able to use the free shuttle to travel to and get picked up from The District shopping Mall in Tustin. If you choose to eat breakfast there, unless you actually like the "American buffet" style of bad scrambled eggs, dessicated bacon and weird tiny fried sausages, I recommend you order from the menu. It's less expensive, and much better food.

Summary Heading: Nice room and staff; ridiculous parking charge
Summary: My opinion follows:  This hotel is in an interesting location, but once you get there is a nice place to stay.  Very close to the airport and equidistant to the beach and Disneyland.  The room is nicely done and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The gym is tiny and the $11 fee for parking is an outrage this far from attractions and the beaches.  There is another Doubletree down the street and around the corner, which created initial confusion.

Great location, not the best Hilton branded hotel.  The room was small, the shower was weak, and the room was very loud.  The staff was helpful, but it was just a mediocre experience.  I would not likely be back to this hotel in the future.

Stay here overnight for a Bible Meet Nearby. The room was clean and had a grea view of the Pond. everyone slept well and we woke up to get a Hot Breakfast at the Hotel. Food was good and had special orders.

I've stayed here a few times. It is really close to John Wayne airport but there are no direct overhead flights.  It's quiet and clean. The staff is friendly and the breakfast is good. It is easy to access all the main highways from here.

Everything was great.  Rooms clean.  Nice location.  Very friendly folks.  My only complaint which is typical of most hotels is that the pillows are feather and compress so much that they are pretty much useless leading to neck and shoulder pain the next day.

This hotel is a nice find for a quiet weekend getaway. Because it is mostly a business hotel the rates on the weekend are generally pretty low. It has a nice pool and hot tub that is practically empty on the weekends. Being right next to a lake that has a wonderful walking path around it is an extra plus. There are a few nice restaurants within walking distance and The District is about 10 minutes away where there are lots of good eateries. The staff are very friendly. We have stayed there at least a half dozen times and always enjoy it.
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 star review. We are so pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and hope to see you back for many more great weekends. See you soon! Kara Kellogg

Summary Heading: Nice room good staff but lacking
Summary: The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. If that's all you need, it's not a bad place to stay. However, the exercise room is small and dated and does not open until 6:00 AM.  They also charge $11 for parking, which is a ridiculous charge.  The other Doubletree down the street is a better stay and better value.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us on TripAdvisor. We are glad to hear your positive comments about our staff and comfortable beds.  We are a smaller property and may not have the largest health club, but we do have the most updated equipment available. We  hope our property still gives our guests the comfort and amenities of a larger property at a great value. We hope that you will give us another try in the future! Kara Kellogg

Summary: It was okay - definitely an older property that is starting to show its age.  Breakfast not as good as a Hilton Garden, but better than recent experiences at Hampton.  Nothing to do withing walking distance, but the price was reasonable.  Could not watch NASCAR as tv service did not have Fox Sports 1 (had Fox Sports West instead).  Staff and service were both fine.

I stayed at a couple of Doubletrees recently and have gotten the general impression that they have the veneer of upscale hotels, but are actually kind of old and run-down now.  Hot cookie upon checkin: nice. Extra fee for parking and internet: not so nice.  In general: it's ok and we got a reasonable price for the area.

Our group was very surprised when, for the first time in months, coffee and tea service were no longer being supplied at our monthly meeting. Evidently our organization refused to pay extra for what they believed, rightly so, to be a bare-minimum service that should be provided as part of the cost of the room.  After all, coffee is supplied in the individual rooms, why would it not be supplied in a conference room?  There are times when hotels must pay attention to the bottom line, and times when they must maintain their credo to make their customers feel welcome, even if it means spending a few pennies more.  I believe that should include coffee and tea service in the conference rooms at no additional cost.  Thank you.  Dr. David L. Raffle, PhD

We really enjoyed our stay at your hotel.  This was the 3rd time in the past 2 years.  This is our first choice when we are in town for the Beach Cities Marathons.  EVERYONE is wonderful and we loved our warm reception after running!

The stay was very pleasant; all together from the check-in to the checkout.  I arrived early in the morning and was allowed to check-in prior to my conference, I was always greeted with a smile, cleanness and general atmosphere was very comforting.  The location and view were a plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great TripAdvisor review. We appreciate all the positive comments from the availability of early check-in to our smiling staff. Our top priority is to provide a positive experience for all our guests. I will be sharing your nice comments with our staff! We hope you choose our hotel when returning to the Orange County area in the future. Kara Kellogg

Summary: Awesome: Service-everyone was over and above being helpful during my stay especially getting us to and from the race.  Transportation-free transport from airport/back and anywhere else after check-in within 4 miles. Food-nice menu which included a variety of food options to include a delicious breakfast. Rooms-Clean but pillows too soft. Safe location-Nice pond (football field size) with water feature, ducks and turtles to walk around for exercise.  Will come back....
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on TripAdvisor! We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to the Surf City Marathon each year, and do our best so that  the runners have a great experience. We hope to see you back next year!

Summary Heading: Great staff and tons of amenities
Summary: Overall, I had a positive experience with this property. My first impression mas made prior to arrival. Due to bad weather expected in my hometown, I flew out to Orange County a day earlier than anticipated. The front desk staff was not only able to add an extra day on to my reservation, they were able to match the rate for the other nights and not charge a higher rate for the first night.  The hotel offers a great breakfast buffet (free for Diamond members), snacks in the evening, a pool and whirlpool, fitness center, and a free shuttle within a 4 mile radius.  My only negative experience occurred toward the end of my stay. I had called for the shuttle to come pick me up at a conference host hotel 3 miles away (as it had done on prior days) but I waited 1 and a half hours for
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review! We are glad you enjoyed our breakfast buffet, evening snacks, other amenities, and helpfulness of our front desk staff. I am sorry that we made you wait so long for a shuttle pick up. I will make sure that this is addressed with our parking staff as to avoid this situation in the future. . We hope to serve you again in the near future. Sincerely, Kara Kellogg

Summary: Customer service is the best I have ever experienced at any hotel.  The hotel rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had a good variety such as bananas, scrambled eggs, oatmeal, breakfast breads, and strong coffee. The staff goes above and beyond. I highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I stayed two nights at the Double Tree Club the weekend of the Surf City Marathon. For previous races we stayed at the Ayres Hotel and Suites a few blocks away. The Double Tree stay was an overall better experience for the following reasons: 1) Highly organized and supportive staff (A large group of staff members cheered for each shuttle load as they entered the lobby after the race).  2) Layout of the Hotel.  3) Breakfast. The hotel breakfast usually doesn't start until after 6 am, but opened at 4:30 am the morning of the race to accommodate early race start times.  I will definitely stay here again!  Join the Hilton Honors program. It costs nothing, and includes perks with most stays.

We stayed here with other family members last weekend for the Surf City Marathon. The staff went far beyond anything we have ever experienced before at any hotel we have stayed at for running events...and we are close to completing our 50 states marathon.  From the pasta dinner, the shuttle service, the standing ovation for each arriving runner after the event to the free late checkout, the staff made everyone feel like a star athlete.  We will definitely stay here, whether business or pleasure.  Thanks Michelle and staff for outstanding hospitality!

This was my 3rd marathon and Michelle and the Double Tree staff made it the best most relaxing trip I've taken in years. Your welcomed with warm cookies. The rooms are clean, bed is comfortable. The staff goes out of thier way to make sure your happy. We literally scheduled the shuttle, ran the race, got back on the shuttle and was welcomed back by the whole staff lining the lobby to cheer us on, give us warm cookies (again) and ice cold water.  I never felt one moment of hustle and bustle that normally goes with doing a marathon. The next time we do the Surf City Marathon this is the only place we'll stay!

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for Surf City Marathon
Summary: Hotel staff is very organized and definitely catered to the needs of the runners.  Breakfast (cold breakfast for marathon; hot and cold for half marathon) and shuttle is included in the hotel price which was very reasonable at under $200!  Shuttle was on time and dropped us off at the Hyatt entrance....almost at starting line.  They provided cookies and water upon return.  They automatically extended checkout time to 2 p.m. which gave us ample time to stick around after the race and still have enough time to shower.  This will be our hotel of choice for Surf City from now one.  Thank you to the staff for a great stay.  Great job to the organizer - Michelle Van Winkle.

This hotel was the best. They shuttled us to and from the race for a mere $15.They had a great pre-race pasta dinner for $13 along with a free late check out so we could shower after the race before heading home. We had a free pre-race breakfast that was great and they started extra early to get us to the start line on time. When returning from the race we were greeted with the entire staff cheering for us and a fresh warm cookie. I've done a lot of races & stayed in a lot of hotels, but this was the best experience I've ever had with a hotel. They made it so easy on the marathoners. I will stay with them every time I do this race. They were friendly, helpful and the room was clean & comfortable.

Summary Heading: Great Service - Surf City Marathon Weekend
Summary: We stayed at this hotel to participate in the Surf City Half Marathon in early February.  I always stay at the "host" hotels right at the start/finish but the hotels for this race were ridiculously over priced.  I was very anxious about staying so far away from the start and finish but this was outstanding.  Very well organized, the staff was incredible!  From the front lobby, to the restaurant, to the event coordinator and the shuttle drivers - WOW - they were fantastic! The shuttle driver knew where he was going, avoided tons of traffic, and dropped us off within a block of the start.  They catered to the runners and accommodated every request.  The staff even automatically gave us a late check (we didn't have to ask)!  We traveled with a toddler and they were also generous

The staff at this hotel was extremely helpful and friendly.  We received excellent service. We were given warm cookies when we checked in, which was a a very nice touch.  Comfortable beds.  Nice breakfast selections

The staff at this hotel went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience!  Stayed here for the Surf City Marathon and it was easy shuttle service.  It was nice to have cheers, water and cookies upon our return from the race.

Out of all the hotels my friends and I have stayed at for races (marathons), this facility was the most accommodating and hospitable. (Thank you, Surf City marathon for putting this hotel on your race website!) When we checked in, a warm cookie was waiting for us and we were able to reserve our seats for the shuttle to and from the race in the lobby with the sales manager Michelle Winkle.  We were impressed that she was there checking in the runners herself and in charge of this on a Saturday! Also, the hotel offered a Carbs dinner buffet (pastas, salad, rolls, chicken) for $13.95 that was tasty and exactly what we wanted. The rooms were clean, quiet, and very comfortable. Race morning, they offered a cold breakfast (fruit, breads, pastries and muffins, oatmeal, hard boiled

We enjoyed staying at Double Tree hotel and thankful for being a great partner for the Surf City Marathon Event.  My husband and I were truly impressed with the overall organization of the event as well as the amazing staff!  From the complementary parking, wifi, breakfast, shuttle servces to/from event, late checkout and of course the "cookies"!!  We were touched when we came back from the race and was greeted with a warm applause by the staff & mgmt when we walked in...with cold water ready for everyone and did I mention more cookies?  It made our stay memorable.  We will definitely stay here again.

We stayed for the surf city marathon weekend. The staff was very friendly, informative, and accommodating for the runners. They offered a shuttle, had a special dinner available to us, and greeted us with cheers after we came back from the race. I would def recommend this hotel.

This is the 3 rd year in a row we have stayed here for the surf city half marathon.  Michelle and staff go over and above to make it a great experience.  The shuttle bus to the race is great, runner friendly foods at breakfast, starting at 4:30 am, it's all good.  We even get an ovation, cookie and cold water upon our return . We love to stay here for the race.  Thanks to all employees who go out of their way for us!

Summary Heading: This is the BEST pre-Surf City race hotel!
Summary: This was our 3rd year in a row staying at this hotel before the Surf City race.  It is by far, the most well-organized race hotel experience.  Michelle does an outstanding job of reaching out to the runners prior to the race to organize shuttles.  She's there for hours greeting guests when they arrive, problem solving and making sure that we all have transportation.  The dining room opens at very early o'clock to accommodate the runners for coffee and hot and cold food.  The best part (besides the warm, yummy cookies) is the reception by the hotel staff when you return from the race.  Who doesn't love a standing ovation?!!

The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and professional. I would definitely stay there again in the future. unfortunately the pool area was under construction, but luckily we did not need the use of it. Overall we were very happy with our stay.

I had stayed at this property previously and therefore when I say that they were one of the official race hotels for the Surf City USA Marathon, I did not hesitate to book a room with them.   The experience could not have been more enjoyable. The staff was warm and welcoming from the moment we arrived and Michelle did an outstanding job of making sure everything went smoothly during sign ups for the shuttle to the starting line and making sure everyone got to the shuttle on Sunday morning. Being able to arrange for late checkout at 2 pm was greatly appreciated as well. The icing on the cake though was the staff lining both sides of the lobby and cheering for us as we returned to the hotel after the race and handing out fresh hot chocolate chip cookies. They definitely went above

Summary Heading: the dining area could use some help
Summary: The service was wonderful and the staff very friendly however, the dining area could use  some ambiance.  The bar area is small, tucked off to the side of a very cavernous  area.  I watched as the people all tried to cram themselves around the small bar.  The dining area has 3 booths, which were occupied quickly, and the rest was a wide open area.  I watched (from my booth) as people studied the tables trying to find a "comfortable" spot  ... all the while a large open area was unoccupied.  The layout could be optimized to offer a come suitable dining experience.  The room was clean and comfortable and the shuttle to the airport was convenient.

My husband and I stayed over the weekend for the Surf City Marathon weekend. We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff is AWESOME, food was amazing. The shuttle to and from the race was very helpful. The staff cheered the runners when they returned from the race. That was AMAZING. We will be staying here again for next years race.

The staff at the hotel makes me feel right at home - I'm always greeted by name by polite, helpful staff. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable, breakfast service good.  This is the perfect place to stay when traveling in Orange County!! Overall rooms are perfect and a very good value!

The hotel is generally clean.  The restaurants in the area tend to stop serving around 9 or 10PM so plan your meals ahead of time as many of the places we called when we first arrived at the hotel (around 10pm) had closed.  The real items to gripe about are the nearly $10 a night internet and similar charges for Parking which increases your nightly stay cost.
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review. We are always happy  to hear what our guests have to say.  For our guests that don't like to pay for the extras, we do have our "Corporate VIP Package". It includes breakfast, parking and internet for a minimal cost. This is bookable on most booking channels and our  hotel website.  We hope to see you back on your next trip to the area!  Kara Kellogg

Summary: For those of you interested in thinking outside of the box (or capable of it), if you drive 300 yards straight out of the hotel parking lot, west on Sandpointe, you will see a parking lot for a large business office on the left, just before Main street.  If you are staying on the weekend, the access arms are locked up, meaning you can park there free (which is what i did).  On weekdays, the 24 hour rate is $8.00.  I found this out all by myself.  I didn't ask anybody's permission, I certainly didn't ask the hotel front desk staff if it was "OK", nobody on Trip Advisor had the wherewithal to figure it out, I just did it.  Refreshing, eh?  It's called liberty.  It's called freedom.  You should try it sometime.

I stayed here for one night before flying out of SNA the next morning and was overall impressed with the value I got for my money. The hotel is in a bit of an unusual location sort of tucked into an office park and another Doubletree within walking distance (which can cause some confusion), but this makes it very quiet in the evening. Unfortunately, this means getting a good meal in the evening, especially on a holiday night like when I stayed, requires driving somewhere. My room was clean and reasonably well equipped, but a little bit on the small side, which was no big deal. One thing which I would change is the TV... it's just too small, even for a hotel room! Breakfast was good, and all staff I interacted with were pleasant.

Summary Heading: Comfy Bed, Friendly Staff, Nice location
Summary: The bed was amazingly comfy. The front desk staff was extra friendly, and the hotel is very close to the airport. I had a great stay, and I am looking forward to returning again. I slept much better than at home - the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was good and quick. Everyone was very happy to see me and took great care of me.

This hotel has a very pleasant atmosphere, the staff is friendly and attentive.  It is close to airport, but quiet.  Also, has close proximity to restaurants and businesses in Irvine.  Jacuzzi is working and nice and hot.

Went to Santa Ana to have some custom work done on my car at a business nearby.  Room was clean and all but the bed was very squishy for my tastes, but besides that it was a nice place.  The breakfast buffet, had eggs that were a little on the running side for me and the sausage was a little spicy.   The people in the restaurant were very friendly, the pm desk crew was also very friendly when we checked in to the hotel.

Summary Heading: Won't use this hotel ever again
Summary: I arrived at the hotel to the pandemonium of a convention/event. I reserved a room several months prior. After check-in, I went to the room to find out it had a single bed. I immediately called the front desk. I noted that 2 beds were needed. They did state up-front that they had no other accomodations and that the event had used all resources. I would not be getting another room assignment, a roll-out bed, or anything else. There was talk of finding another room, and talk of compensation tomorrow night. It did not make for adequate accomodations for me and those in my party. We vacated for a Motel 6 that could serve my needs and, surprisingly, was every bit as comfortable as the Doubletree.
Manager Response: We appreciate your honest feedback and regret we could not make adequate accommodations for you and your family. I have provided your review to our front office team to ensure that our guests comfort is met. We would like to discuss with you further details regarding your reservation. Please feel free to contact me at 714-540-9551  Kind regards, Kara Kellogg

Summary: The location was very convenient. I was able to make it down to the beach in less than 15 minutes for a morning walk. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. For the price I was very satisfied. It is near the airport but not so close you could here planes flying overhead all night.

Very nice staff and accommodations  Very helpful with my needs Responded to calls quickly Customer Service was excellent My room was rather small but very clean and they had a shuttle service to my doctor in a building in the same complex I would recommend this location .

Ask and you shall receive...Awesome customer service. no complaints here. Employees go out of their way to make sure your stay goes accordingly. The cookies are addicting, yummy!!! When I need ot get away, I book here.

pls do ur reasearch on this hotel even if u can get a deal on this hotel dont be fooled by it.... front desk are rude, no words to say. but if u wanna know what im talking about then stay in this crappy hotel..... the only things are ok here is the free wifi and thats it....
Manager Response: We are not pleased to hear about your experience with us during your stay. Our hotel prides itself on our customer service, and it  sounds like we feel short this time.  We have reached out to you to hear more details regarding your experience and hope to use this in a positive way.  We hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: Nice suite for what seems to be an older property, but for some reason there were no glasses in the room.  Room service dinner, horrible tortilla soup and the only light beer available was Miller Lite.  So bad food and poor beverage selection.  However the service was very fast.  Suite was quiet and comfortable.  The "lake view" was kinda silly - not much of a "lake" and even less of a "view".  Good breakfast.

Summary Heading: Most comfortable hotel bed of trip!
Summary: Nice room, exceptionally comfortable bed.  Staff was very helpful and friendly. We arrived on Christmas Eve after their restaurant had closed and all local restaurants seemed closed for the holiday; however the staff tried their best to locate someplace that was open.

PROS: Michael Patterson was a great help in assisting with our reservations and the price offered was very reasonable.  Bonus: Great room rate that also included a full breakfast & free airport shuttle from the John Wayne Santa Ana airport.  CONS: Issues with guaranteed early checkin not available on day of arrival contrary to confirmation received from our reservation agent.  - Recommend honoring additional service fee for guest early check in needs (this was very important as our driver had just completed an overnight 8 hour drive between SF & Santa Ana).
