I was extremely disappointed in the fact that I had asked for a microwave and my request was simply ignored.  Yes, the rooms don't come with a microwave but
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review of your recent stay with us. We sincerely regret that you did not experience the most comfortable stay. We understand how important a good night's rest is while traveling and are sorry your sleep was interrupted. We do provide earplugs for any guests experiencing noise issues and welcome any guest to request them as needed. The issues you experienced with the amenities in your room will be shared with the appropriate team members to ensure we are improving and providing the best guest experience possible. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will consider staying at our hotel again.   Thank you!

Summary: We stayed a week at this hotel. The service was great at every turn. We did not realize that a complimentary breakfast buffet and cocktail hour were included. On demand shuttle was convenient for my wife to do some shopping at South Coast Plaza while I had the car. The room was nicely updated. Slightly bigger than normal with room for a sofa and desk. One drawback was the old style HVAC unit. No thermostat so you just set it to desired level an it stays on all night. A bit noisy. The only other downside is the recent trend of suburban hotels charging for parking. $11 per night.   I would certainly stay here again when in the area.

The stay was excellent, however don't try the breakfast buffet unless you like powdered eggs. The bacon and sausage were barely cooked. The home fries were tasteless (try adding onions, bellpeppers and a little spice. Coffee was good.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest!    Thank you for reviewing us on Tripadvisor.com!  Your feed back is very important to us and I appreciate your comments regarding our breakfast.    We do our very best to provide quality items for our breakfast buffet and cook everything from natural ingredients.    I will definitely address this with the Food & Beverage Director to ensure this gets looked into.   If you have any other concerns feel free to contact me directly at david.arriola2@hilton.com.     Thank you again and I hope to have you stay with us in the near future.  Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Director of Operations & Revenue Management  DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport   Phone: (714) 540-4947

Summary: Hotel was easy to find off the 55 Freeway and close to the 5 and 405 Freeways.  The hotel is a hop,skip, and a jump EPROM the John Wayne Airport, and offers free shuttle service to and from the airport.  There is however an $11.00 parking fee.  Check in was fast, easy, and the hot cookies were great.  W were on the 6th floor in a corner room with windows on two sides allowing a beautiful view of the adjoining lake.  The room was large and well appointed.  The bed was very comfortable and the bath was fine with many amenities.  Room was quiet with very minor freeway noise.  We received coupons for two complimentary drinks with a complimentary light fare.  Both were good.  We also received coupons for a free breakfast which was quite good.  Check out was pleasant And easy.   A

Just stayed at this hotel while in town for the Surf City Marathon.  The staff and accommendations were wonderful.   After the marathon the staff cheered for the runners and had water and cookies for us,  made our stay really special.  So if you are looking for a super hotel, not expensive, great breakfasts and close to everything, this is the place.  We will be back!!

Summary Heading: the added costs are what cost you when you travel
Summary: Checked in for a 3 day tourney in the area, was suprised that the parking area is so small that they suck you in for a so called free vallet, then you have to pay 11 dollars a day for internet. This gets frustrationg when you are coming and going at a hotel.  paying for inter net useage is another weak way to cost the traveler more. ELAVATOR was out of survice on disserent floors and the management could have and should have a repairman out, their is no excuse for this . having to call the front desk to get a elavator when only one person is working at the front desk is uncool

Summary Heading: Double Tree Far Exceeded Our Expectations
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for the Surf City Half Marathon in Huntington Beach.  I chose it because it was an affordable option among the partner hotels listed on the Surf City website.  I was a little concerned because it is not as close to Huntington Beach as I woud have liked, but the location turned out to be not terribly inconvenient, and we had such an amazing experience with the customer service at this hotel that I am so glad I chose it.  First, a staff member at Double Tree emailed all of the Surf City runners a few days before our stay, in order to tell us what to expect for the shuttle to and from the race.  I thought this was so comforting, because it was an exceptionally organized and proactive thing to do.  It showed me that I had nothing to worry about, and I

It is a very good hotel, everyone was very friendly before, during and after my checkin. There is a great staff and everyone is willing to help in anything that you might need to make your stay a great experience.

Summary Heading: A great hotel, located near a little pond.  Wonderful food and service, quiet sleeping accomodations.
Summary: We have stayed here twice for the Surf City  Half marathon.  Great, quiet location and easy to get back on the road.  Wonderful staff, and of course warm cookies!  The lobby is spacious, good business center, excellent restaurant with a full breakfast.  The rooms are big and quiet.  There is a duck pond outside.  It is in a business park, so no traffic noise.  Also, this is the Double Tree CLUB hotel, there is another Double Tree across the way!

My first visit to the Doubletree Club near Orange County Airport was a great stay. Easy parking, quick check-in and excellent service provided by the front desk staff made for superb first impression. Quality of both the in-room dining and breakfast was excellent. My room was very clean and the room furniture and bedding was in great condition.  This hotel will definitely be at the top of the list for future trips to the area.

Summary Heading: Easy on off freeway and good business area location
Summary: This is a good hotel for a quick business trip. Front desk staff was friendly and attentive. The lobby area is small and sits right in front of desk so not a lot of space for lounging. The parking was not cheap or free and was basically nothing special maybe because it was in a business park area.  Hotel was located right off 55/405 fwy and in close proximity to an Arco gas-am/pm, walking distance to some decent fast food options and not far from South Coast Plaza Mall. The rooms are a bit small, so share it with someone you Really Like. Room had a good sleeping bed, and a fridge but no microwave. I went to the pool planning to use the hot tub but it was locked, up which turned out to be ok because it was very dated and in clear view of the freeway traffic and side street.

I stayed here for a marathon nearby and they catered everything to the runner's experience!  From a pre-arranged pasta dinner the night before, to 4:30 AM breakfast buffet and shuttle to the race, it was a great deal and excellent service.  The staff even lined up to cheer our return from the race when the bus dropped us off - very special!  I would definitely recommend this to anyone staying in the area, or anyone running a nearby marathon in the future.

Summary Heading: My experience on Marathon Race trip with Double Tree Hotel was pleasantly enjoyable and peace of mind.
Summary: I stayed here for Surf City this past weekend and Michelle and her staffs did a wonderful job.  Like all other reviews gaving great rating for such great service.....It was top notch level Professionalism.  They CARE, UNDERSTAND and ACCOMMODATED approapriately.

Summary Heading: Good for Surf City Marathon/ Half Marathon
Summary: We stayed here for Surf City this past weekend and they were absolutely wonderful.  They provided shuttle service too and from the race, provided an early breakfast (that started at 4 AM) for us runners and provided post race cookies and water.  The rooms were good size and we were able to go from a queen room with a couch pull out to a 2 bed room which was a plus.  They have parking which is valet or self park. They only thing I don't get is that the price is the same for both.  My parents did the race last year and had a great experience with the hotel back then so if you're doing Surf City, look to stay here!

We booked this hotel for the surf city marathon. The service was excellent. The bus to the marathon was great. When the bus brought us back after the race the entire staff was clapping for us in the lobby, gave is cold water bottles, and warm cookies. The breakfast was good and available very early to accommodate the early start times. The check out time was extended to 2 pm, so we had time to shower and change before we had to check out.  Good job guys! Will stay again.

I stayed here for 2 nights this past week while in town for business.  The rooms are very clean and quite comfortable.  I had a great view of the lake that was in the area and the mountains further off in the distance.  Breakfast was included and quite good.  There were many options to pick from including hot and cold choices.  I also had lunch one day in the restaurant and was quite pleased.  The staff is super friendly and helpful.  I relied on them for transportation to and from the airport.  My only suggestion is around the fitness center.  The equipment is nice, but the facility itself is very small.  It needs to be triple the size at least with multiple bikes, treadmills, and elliptical machines.  I even heard another guest sharing his displeasure with the facility when I

My sweet tooth and I are always excited to stay at DoubleTree properties, mostly due to these delectable delights. Not only that, the staff was friendly, the prices are decent, and for a hotel near the airport, it was quite relaxing and noise-free. Although our room was the closest to the elevator, we couldn't hear any noise, and the cable channel selection was on point! I was impressed with how clean the hallways and the bathroom were, and that they provided water for their guests, and the water was refreshing with lemon. Beautiful lake view is also easy on the eyes.

I have stayed here three times for business, and each time I'm impressed by the hotel, the amenities and the staff.  Everyone I encountered is very professional, helpful and kind, going out of their way to make my stay pleasant and comfortable.  The rooms are always clean and well appointed, and the breakfast provided is amazing.  I appreciate the warm welcome, the cookie, and the attention to customer service.  I would definitely recomment this hotel for business or pleasure travel.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to spent my a weekend at with my husband.  Very close to disneyland.    It was wonderful
Summary: Great suite very clean comfortable. Great room service. Great steak and shrimp fabulous bread pudding for dessert and fabulous wine. Excellent place to spent my a weekend at with my husband. It was wonderful.  Great location and close to Disneyland and south coast plaza for some shopping.  What a trip without some shopping.

Summary Heading: Central location for the orange county area with quick access to freeway
Summary: Great for business travels if you are fling out of John wayne airport or in town on business. Great service with good rooms, also has a pond infront of the properity which is great for jogging or just enjoying some southern California sun. Plenty of outdoor parking that is close to the hotel.

The staff was very nice and helpful. We loved the location, it was very centralized. Close to the beach, Angel Stadium, Disneyland, shopping, and easy to hop onto the freeway! The beds were very comfy and the rooms were really clean. Loved that there was food within walking distance. The kids loved watching the ducks in the lake. The view was nice. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again!! I also didn't feel like the fees for the internet and parking are that high, very reasonably priced for that area.

Summary Heading: nice clean room with a refrig
Summary: The room I booked had a queen bed and a sofa bed with a small refrig. It was very clean and comfortable. Th location is convenient.  The reason I gave  three stars rating is the additional $11 parking fee and $11 internet fee.

We stayed here for our son's birthday. At check it we were greeted by Arturo (manager). Very friendly staff,  of course cookies were yummy.  Room was clean, amenities ate nice.  The lake outside was nice, kids feed ducks,  breakfast nice selection, pool and spa clean and convenient. Room was quiet.  Will most definitely stay again and recommend.

Booked this hotel on Hotwire for a two night stay while in Disneyland.  Its in Santa Ana in an area filled with hotels.  About a 10 minute drive to the park (which I knew about and chose).  The hotel is nice to look at although nothing special.  $11.00 bucks a day to park.    The room was clean.  The beds were ok, although not as plush as other Doubletrees offer.  I got what I paid for from the hotel amenities, so that is not the reason for the low stars.  The place was clean.  My complaint comes from the staff. I did not find them helpful.  I didn't even find them nice.  In fact, they went out of their way to make me and my family feel uncomfortable.  From check-in until check-out there were no smiles, no greetings and sighs whenever any of us asked as question.  I found the

Summary Heading: Not attentive to business guest's needs
Summary: The hotel 1. did not provide the wake up call requested. 2. The gym does not open until 6 AM. Since they missed my wake up call that was not an issue 3. The gym equipment was not working properly and there was no sound on the TV attached to the elyptical 4. I was only provided one bath towel

I spent one night here in January. It is very close to the airport. After calling the hotel they were very prompt in coming to the airport. Check in was quick and efficient. The staff was very friendly and professional. The hotel is small, which is nice. The room was very comforable, pleasent and clean. Lighting was good. The beds were comfortable and bathrooms modern. Transport back to the airport was not on a schedule but on request, which is very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Who knew this hotel was out here, tucked in a little office park right in front of a nice lake/pond.  Quiet and convenient.  Shuttle bus will take you to the mall or to a close by restaurant. Room was clean and comfortable. Lobby was nice, and the cookie was great.  We only stayed one night, but would stay again.  Good price and convenient.  No complaints.

Summary Heading: Oasis of peace in busy Orange County
Summary: This hotel is located about 10 minutes from John Wayne Airport in a secluded park like setting with a lake and trees but a short walk to Starbucks and other sites.  It is a quick hop on the 405 or 55 to any area in So Cal.  Rooms are very nice with big windows and comfortable beds.  Roughly equivalent to a 4 Points or Courtyard, not much in terms of amenities but quiet location and nice rooms make it a good base for work or play in OC.

Upon check-in, you will receive a warm chocolate chip cookie:) The staff at the front desk were very helpful! They took care of my check-in immediately and I was inside my room shortly afterwards. Unfortunately, the parking lot has a fee and it was full requiring myself and others to use the valet service, which made the cost higher.   The room had a nice double bed with a LG 42 inch television. The bathroom facilities was well kept with an adequate amount of towels and bars of soap.   The breakfast buffet was nice the following morning. It had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, potatoes, fresh fruit and bagels/toast. It was a nice meal to start the morning.  There is a nice pond next to the hotel allowing guests to enjoy the scenery and work off the food eaten

My wife and I stayed at the Doubletree Club Costa Mesa for one night in December 2012.  This was not our first experience with Doubletree hotels but it was our first stay in a Doubletree Club property. The hotel is located in the business district, in Costa Mesa, so the area is secluded and quite yet close to the South Coast Plazza and restaurants. The Hotel is six stories and overlooks a man made lake (ask for room with lakeview). The overall apperance of the hotel was very clean and well maintained, although most Doubletree's are older properties. The staff was friendly and helpful, everyone from the parking valet to the maids. We asked for a lakeview room with a king bed. The room was on the sixth floor and came with a fridge and coffee in the room. The rooms had been

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, but parking lot is like an obstacle course
Summary: Had the chance to stay here at great rates and enjoy shopping at South Coast Plaza less than 2 miles away. Overall our stay was OK. Rooms were clean, and the chocolate chip cookies were excellent as always. Only thing is they make parking a premium by charging $11 for self-parking. Two hotel vans are parked on driveway loop blocking most of it, plus they put a post that further blocks driveway such that it almost hits your side mirrors when you try to maneuver through it. It wasn't just one time, but 3 times I passed through it at night and in the morning. Cones and posts are all over, limiting self parking spaces, and reserved for valet parking. So, arrive early or you might be stuck having to valet park just to save a few steps to walk in the hotel. Also, we can hear doors

Repeat guest with a continuing, outstanding experience, and who is looking forward to the next visit.  The visit was pleaant in every respect, from the check-in to departure.  The meeting room and meal preparation was flawless, the entire STAFF MEMBERS in this hotel were pleasant, effective and responsive.  A special thanks goes to Tim Turino!  The guest room was clean, and well-equipped.  The warm, fresh chocolate chip cookie topped off this fun visit.

Summary Heading: Good hotel with cookies at check in
Summary: We were in Orange county for a family Christmas gathering and stayed at the Doubletree by the OC airport. The price of the rooms was very reasonable for the accommodations. The hotel was very nice, clean, and the staff very pleasant. When you check in they give you fresh chocolate chip cookies which were yummy and went well with the Wolfgang Puck coffee in the room.

Impressive hotel, with friendly staff and top notch rooms. This place caters to the business traveler with attention to small details such as ample plug ins at the desk in the guest rooms. Tennis and basketball courts a plus. Breakfast was just so so and wish they offered free self parking. Overall a pretty good value.

Summary Heading: okay hotel to spend the night.  Management need training...
Summary: Location is great.  Rooms are decent.   Should have been a perfect place for business traveler to spend a night or two.   However, I don't know where did they hire these front desk people.   I've seen more than one of them smoke just right outside the front door lobby.  In their uniforms.  (I guess they think it's okay to do that during their break time.).     Yes, it is, but don't do it in front of your lobby front door.   It just make you and your team look unprofessional.   Also, one night I came back at around 9pm, but the Valet parking guy was already gone.   So I went up to the front desk and asked, the guy told me just go do self-park.   Fine, no problem at all.   However, he didn't even bother to offer to give me a discount on parking.  (I was already charged more for
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Tripadvisor.com!     We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned with staff professionalism as well as your valet charges.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel and your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity soon to make your stay the best it can be.  If you would like to discuss this in further detail,  feel free to contact me directly at anytime.     Best Regards,  David Arriola Operations Manager/Director of Revenue & Social Media Marketing       DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport (714) 751-2400 david.arriola2@hilton.com

Summary: Nice place, very clean. Great pool outside. Good room service breakfast. Only bummer was the free wifi in the lobby bit they want to charge you in the room. The lowest end hotel all offer at least free wifi. Wifi is available at every place in the neighborhood except your room. Free wifi is a must in the hotel business.

I have been coming to this hotel for over 15 years for weekend getaways and it continues to be an excellent value. Although room rates seem to have increased quite a bit over the past couple of years and self-parking is no longer included, the location and the can-do attitude of the staff are superb!  The addition of in-room coffee makers a few years ago was a welcome touch, too. Rooms are decent sized and beds/pillows are very comfortable--these are the rare hotel beds in which I look forward to sleeping.  Staff is always helpful and prompt; any problems are addressed and resolved quickly (for example, the coffee maker in my room was not working properly and a brand new one was brought to the room in minutes).  The breakfast buffet can become crowded on the weekend, but nothing

Stayed one night for a business trip.  Would not be considered a "destination" hotel, but I would certainly stay again.  The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, the rooms were comfortable and the facilities were nice.  Can’t beat the location night near the airport and convenient for much of Orange County.  Nice breakfast buffet.  Had dinner there because I arrived late and I enjoyed it. The restaurant made a great burger. I assume the building is a little old (given the slow elevator and the old style shower in the bathroom) but it must have been updated because overall it’s a very pleasant place on this artificial lake.  I switched to Hilton brands because I have had such bad experiences W Hotels (even though I am Starwood Gold) and I have to say that I have not been

The beds were divine....everything was clean.. definately a 3.5 star, not a 3 star, not a 4 star. We were happy to just lay in bed and watch TV...comfy....The breakfast buffett was too expensive for breakfast but had a nice selection of food... Sits on the freeway but the view out the window was still good... It was worth it for under $90. For full price,,, not...

Well I dont get the club part? Its another doubletree its in a great location to all attractions. The pool area was a little disappointing next to the freeway and 30 ft. from the city street. Nice dinning room,lobby and public areas.Lobby staff needs a little help.Rooms are a little old need a little updating to keep up with the hilton brand...I think I will stay down the street 200 yards at the other doubletree and skip the lake and take a free breakfast.

Location, Location, Location, 10 mins from the beach  5 minutes drive to one of the best malls Southern California has to offer and a little known place called Disneyland is about 15 minutes away. The staff here were very helpful I found the rooms clean and the breakfast was ok The pool was always empty and it is really nice to walk around the lake I would not hesitate to stay here again and look forward to. Top marks to the polite reception staff who helped me swap rooms when the elevators were being upgraded .
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Tripadvisor.com!   We value your feedback and I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed the location of our property.   I always say that we’re in the middle of everything which you personally experienced!   Isn’t the lake a nice touch?  Some of the staff feel so attached to the ducks that they named a few of them.   Customer service is something we take pride in and it pleases me to hear that our staff provided great service during your stay.  We hope to have you back in the near future and thank you again for you review.     Warm Regards,  David Arriola Operations Manager/Director of Revenue Management & Social Media Email: david.arriola2@hilton.com Phone: 714-540-4947

Summary Heading: Don't take the room by the fitness center
Summary: We did not enjoy our stay at the Doubletree Club. Our room was next to the fitness room. We heard most of the activity including weights being moved and dropped, a group of teenagers that yelled and screamed while goofing around in there and the smell was always present.  Our AC unit had a loud whine every time the fan turned on. Other rooms in other locations in the hotel may be better but room 230 is one to avoid.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Tripadvisor.com!   We value your feedback and appreciate you taking the time out of your busy schedule to let us know how to improve our hotel.    I apologize for the disturbance you experienced by the group that was in the fitness center.  Our management staff & security are consistently walking the floors to ensure everyone is courtesy to their surrounding neighbors.  Your comment was forwarded to the appropriate department and I can assure you that we’re taking every precaution from this happening in the future.   I also had my engineering department inspect the A/C unit in the room you occupied and we immediately fixed the unit.   Thank you for your feedback and we hope to have you stay with us in the near future.   Best Regards,  David Arriola Operations Manager/Director of Revenue & Social Media David.arriola2@hilton.com 714-540-4947

Summary Heading: For a DoubleTree Club, I was impressed; Response to Bed Bug Reviews
Summary: Foremost, with respect to the bed bugs comment, it is unfortunate.  But as travelers we take that risk anywhere we travel. Some of the most expensive hotels have bed bugs.  To me, its not that a hotel has bed bugs, it's how they handle me when I request a different room.  If they accommodate, and even check before hand for no bugs, that's what I expect.  Anything else is not satisfactory in my opinion.  Not sure where the other bad reviews come from, but being a loyal HHonors member and DoubleTree guest, I think this is one of the better "Clubs" I have been to.  Front desk and checkin was very pleasant. Valet was quick and a short walk to front desk.  Room was spacious and clean. It was my first time staying there and I got upgraded to a suite and received a letter from the

Bed Bug Galore. This Hotel is complete fraud. Starting with the exterior picture (The tall building is not part of the hotel but portrayed in all the pictures) all the way to the fabricated high ratings. I checked in and out within two hours of my stay due to extremely loud & old A/C units, Filthy shower, and being bitten by bed bugs upon my arrival. This is an old privately owned motel and now franchised by Double Tree because of its good location. I requested to be moved to a higher class Double tree with no bugs in the area and I was told they couldn’t honor the same corporate rate because the other hotel was also privately owned. I ended up moving to a Hilton hotel at higher rate.  Shame on you Hilton, just because a hotel is a private franchise doesn’t mean they shouldn’t
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Tripadvisor.com!   Your feedback and comments are very important to us and we value your opinion.   We take bed bug reports very seriously.   When this was brought to our attention we immediately contacted a certified pest control company to inspect the room you occupied.  The pest control company did not identify any bed bugs or any other pest activities.   I also addressed the shower and the A/C unit with the appropriate departments.  We take pride in cleanliness and the condition of your hotel so your feedback was very much appreciated.  Please contact me directly if you have any additional comments or concerns.   Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Operations Manager/Director of Revenue & Social Media  David.arriola2@hilton.com 714-540-4947

Summary: Was there on the weekend of 08/10/12 with family. Pleasant staff, They even brought us  microwave and baby crib when requested. Restaurant meal was delicious although buffet breakfast was not as tasty nor diverse like those of a regular Hilton hotel. Nice mall and endleiss eateries within vicinity. Of course, the welcome cookie was delicious!

I stayed here last May and am only now getting to this review. I am taking the time to write it because other Tripadvisor members should be aware of this hotel's "damage" policy. When I checked in I noticed a very large yellow notice taped to the counter stating that credit cards would be billed $50 PER NIGHT as a "damage" deposit.  When I inquired, I was told that if there was no damage to the room, the amount would be credited back to the hotel within three working days. Really?? I told the desk clerk this was not acceptable to me and I would not agree to having my card debited for anything but the room charge. I checked in at 9 p.m. but I was so irritatedat their policy that I was willing to leave at that late time and find another hotel. The clerk agreed to my request
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Tripadvisor.com!  Your comments and feedback are greatly appreciated.  I wanted to clarify that the additional authorization on your method of payment was meant for any incidentals that you might have incurred during your stay.  We do not collect deposits for damages.  The main purpose of the authorization is to provide a convenient way for our guests to utilize services such as video on demand and/or room service without providing different method of payments for each transaction.   I apologize for any misunderstanding that may have occurred and I would love to invite you back to the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport when you return to the area.  Please contact me with any additional concerns at (714) 540-4947 or at david.arriola2@hilton.com.     Best regards,  David Arriola Operations Manager/Director of Revenue Management & Social Media  DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport Phone: (714) 751-2400 Email: david.arriola2@hilton.com

Summary: This was an excellent stay for me.  Front desk and restaurant staff were friendly (the only staff I really interacted with much.)  Had dinner in the restaurant one evening and it was excellent -- especially enjoyed the outdoor seating overlooking the lake.  My room also overlooked this lake.   Property is a fairly well done renovation of an older property -- this is obvious only in some of the "little" things like the climate control system which is the older type of system that doesn't have a digital thermostat and can be a little loud (I actually don't mind, and kind of like, the sound of these fans).     Parking is either self park or valet both for the same price of $11 per day with a reduced rate for guests coming to visit you.  (I think $3 per hour.)  This is pretty much

Got a great price ($79 a night) so cant complain....however, front desk messed up our room so I had to go back downstairs and get us switched....for the inconvenience we did recieve 4 free breakfast coupons!  Buffet breakfast was fantastic!  Lots of choices and VERY fresh.  Hotel is older and it shows....but rooms are clean with comfy beds.  Great choice for a quick stay.

Summary Heading: Odd number rooms have water view.
Summary: When we checked in, a wedding party was going on and parking was almost full. Fortunately we found a space to park without waiting.Parking rate was $11.  Our room was prepared as we requested but the room keys didn't work. We were not upgraded as a HH gold elite at this hotel but received buffett breakfast for 2. and 2 drink coupons at the bar. We ordered a glass of white and a glass of red house wine. Both were horrible. We sipped 2 times but couldn't drink anymore as wine lovers. We hope they change the selection of their house wine.  Good quality breakfast for both drinks and food plus the restaurant service was efficient and excellent. The restaurant has a nice view facing a  pond with a fountain. Even after a wedding party the hotel was very clean including hallways and
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Tripadvisor.com!   Your comments are very important to us and we value your feedback.   I wanted to apologize for your keys not working upon check in.  We try our best to audit all doors to ensure they are in working order.  Please feel free to email me directly with your room number and I’ll double check the room to ensure the issue has been resolved.  As a HHonors Member, we value your patronage to the Hilton Family and we always upgrade our Diamond/Gold Members if we have rooms available.  I wanted to point out that our Diamond and Gold members are provided complimentary hot breakfast buffet and complimentary drink tickets which is special and specific to our property.  These upgraded services always make our Diamond and Gold members excited to stay with us!  I will pass along your comments regarding our house wine selection to the Food & Beverage Director.   If you have any other comments or concerns, please email me directly at david.arriola2@hilton.com or call me directly at (714) 540-4947.    Thank you again for your review.    Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Operations Manager/Director of Revenue Management & Social Media DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport  Email:  david.arriola2@hilton.com Phone: (714) 540-4947

Summary Heading: Free shuttle to South coast plaza
Summary: Its a small cosy place to stay for visiting Disney which is only a 10 min drive. The hotel shuttle takes u anywhere in a 4mile radius which includes South coast plaza which is one of the biggest malls . The shuttle service is prompt and when i got lost  after the mall closed, they located my whereabouts and reached me. Since doubletree is celeberating its 25 yrs, u get very yum free chocolate cookies made fresh every morning. There's a small lake with ducks in front and if u walk by its side on a narrow path , there's a starbucks, a thai ,mexican & japanese eateries.The japanese called Wasabi was very good and u can enjoy the food outside in the sun rather than eat in the hotel. Free breakfast was for all 4 of us in the room unlike  many hotels where it is only for 2 guests per
Manager Response: Thank you for responding on Tripadvisor.com!   Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.   We take pride in servicing all our guests and it brings a smile to my face to know you enjoyed the local attractions that are conveniently located near the hotel.  It’s great to know that my Front Desk staff took good care of you and your family during your stay.   We look forward to your return!      Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Operation/Director of Revenue & Social Media DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport  Email: david.arriola2@hilton.com Phone: (714) 540-4947

Summary Heading: Great location and a great value for what is provided
Summary: Stayed at very few hotels in CA or Santa Ana, but I've been in a few across the country. So I'll give a quick review. If you're going to stay at a double tree it pays to be a Hilton honors member.   Why? Here's a few reasons. 1) Free Wi-Fi in your room, otherwise you'll pay $10 per day or you'll have to use it in the lobby.  2) Free breakfast buffet, which is otherwise $22 per person and is only worth about half that. Don't get me wrong it's a very nice spread of hot, cold, juices, fruits and prepared dishes to choose from, but that price is outrageous especially if you have a family.  The business center is excellent and has a very convenient and helpful coupon book that's a must for travelers which will be dining locally.   Valet and self parking is the same price $11 so
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Tripadvisor.com!   Your comments are greatly appreciated and I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.   I apologize if you were under the impression that our breakfast buffet was $22 per person.   Breakfast buffet in our Lakeside Bistro is actually $12.50 plus tax.  I want to apologize again for the misunderstanding and I look forward to having you stay at the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport in the near future.   Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Operations Manager/Director of Revenue Management & Social Media DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport (714) 751-2400 david.arriola2@hilton.com

Summary: Stayed for a Confrence, amenities are basic. Lobby is very small and no place to sit and chat. Breakfast has omelettes station which is nice but the food in general is very basic. Service is ok but very slow. Location is good, very close to the airport.

Summary Heading: Meh.  Okay, but the "club" means Doubletree light.
Summary: I never knew the DoubleTree Club brand existed until this stay.  In fact, I put "Double Tree" into the GPS upon picking up my rental car and it took me to the real DoubleTree, which is a couple blocks away.  They were very friendly and directed me to the right place.    The location is great.  Right next to the airport with easy access to the highways.  I walked to an area nearby for a quick dinner and felt super safe and was satisfied with my options.  It is built on an urban corporate park/apartment complex that has a nice lake in front of it.  I ran there in the morning and it is about a .3 miles around and a nice feature.  First impressions are important, and the valet here needs some major help.  I hate valet, and only use it if absolutely necessary.  As I pulled up, I saw

Everyone was smiling and happy, the valet, front desk, restaurant and maid.  The room was quiet, the bed was comfy and I received a complementary chocolate chip cookie.    I booked through hotwire and received a great price but wi fi was extra.

I travel a lot and had one of the best stays at this hotel.  RYes, their "signature" warm cookies were good , but this DoubleTree has a lot more to offer.  My room was very quiet, very clean, and just perfect.  Their breakfast was very nice and setting was beautiful too (you could eat inside or outside, with a lake view.)  Everyone was nice, especially Alturo at front desk with his willingness to go the distance to help guests made this stay even more wonderful.  I didn't have a need for valet parking, but the valet staff were also very pleasant.  Totally recommend it.

We took our daughter down to southern California to tour UC Irvine and we stayed at the double tree club. This hotel is the best deal we've ever seen, considering its great location and comfortable room. Definitely staying here every time we visit our daughter in college.

For the 3rd year in a row, we've brought back our soccer team to this same hotel.  Our tournaments isusually just 30-40 minutes from where most of the players live but we choose to come back every year to Doubletree because of how well operate.  Everything a person can ask for.. clean room and facilities, comfortable beds, breakfast is awesome, the pool is refreshing, the bar is a good stress relief and the staff very accomodating.  Well done.  Kudos to management and staff.

Let me start by saying that i am very particular about my hotels.  That said, my wife booked this one because of the cheap rate and breakfast included.  The rooms were good, not great, but clean.  The staff was very friendly.  The lobby etc was well maintained.  The breafast was better than i expected.  They had much more available than i expected.  This hotel is great for a night or two as a resting point for travels within Orange County.    Happy Trails!

My wife and i stayed here for a wedding.Our room was nice ,clean and served our needs.It was great getting on the local highways . very close to the airport we checked out and were at the airport in a few minutes. We did not pay for parking, nor were asked to pay.

Summary Heading: A three star hotel that made us feel like we were in a five star.
Summary: Beds are nice and big, not to mention VERY comfortable. The nicest surprise was the warm cookies we were served at check-in. The best cookies we've ever eaten in our lives! The only negatives, was that you have to pay for parking and there is no in-room wifi. You have to use the lobby or the business center.

Stayed here for business. Great location close to the John Wayne airport. Outside area very pleasant great patio to eat out on looking over a pond with fountain. Walking path around pond. Room & amenities very nice. Crabtree & Evelyn bath products. Refrigerator in room. WIFI fast so made it great to work at night.  Room very quiet never heard any neighbors.  They are refurbishing the elevators so only one was workin therefore slow. Overall great hotel.  They let me order the kids scrambled egg breakfast. Which was a good portion of eggs, bacon, potatoes, fruit & toast for only $4.95.

My husband has been staying here for business for a number of months and I recently joined him for a quick vacation.  The outside property is well cared for and the pond outside is very pleasant.  It is very centrally located, convenient to the John Wayne airport and to nearby highways, so getting to recreational areas (i.e. Disney, Newport Beach, etc.) is very easy.  The breakfast buffet offers many good choices, both healthy and/or hearty.  The rooms were immaculately cared for by the housekeeping staff and the beds are VERY comfortable.  There's a nice heated pool and whirlpool outside.  My only negative comment would be the front desk staff.  Many were very nice, one in particular had very poor customer service skills.  And, after visiting there every week for several

Summary Heading: Nice stay and would stay here again
Summary: The hotel, from the entrance to the rooms, were all immaculate.  Hotel service was good and the front desk went out of their way to help me with questions.  The hotel restaurant was mediocre and there are plenty of restaurant choices near the hotel.  I got in late and was not in the mood to find a restaurant.  The hotel restaurant wasn't the best choice around the area.  A few things to consider when staying near the airport.  The first planes take off at 7AM at John Wayne.  The first shuttle at this hotel leaves at 5:30 - 5:45. If you like to leave the west coast early like I do, prepare yourself for a hectic time and long lines at airport security.  There is also another Doubletree hotel down the street and it is easy to get them confused with each other.  It would interesting

Near airport and freeway; staff and rooms are a cut above both the wider competition and other properties within the brand.  Particularly wish to single out the front desk staff for being thoughtful and helpful on multiple stays.  Rooms are quiet (no overhearing your neighbor or the hallway - appreciated) and breakfast buffet had a lot of good, healthy options.  I've stayed at many of the choices around John Wayne - this is probably the best.

Summary Heading: Check this hotel out if you are in the area!
Summary: This is a fabulous hotel. The service is excellent. The rooms are spacious and well- decorated. The famous cookies were delicious. I enjoyed Mt stay and highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice smaller hotel very near the O.C. airport
Summary: A bit smaller than most DoubleTree hotels (6 floors) but nicely renovated (except for the elevators, which were in the process of being redone and only one was working) in a small, upscale, office park a couple of miles from the airport.  Restaurant was okay and not crowded ... good service.  Shuttle to the airport in the morning was as easy as possible: no set time, no need to call ahead, just go to the front desk when you're ready to leave, ask for the shuttle, they have the driver meet you out in front of the hotel in about 10 mins, and then you're at the airport in another 10 mins!

Summary Heading: Close to freeways / airport, good value
Summary: We recently stayed here over aweekend while in town for a sports tournament. We found the location, immediately next to the freeway, and the price a great fit for our family. The service was better than expected and our rate also included breakfast and parking.

I made my reservation months in advance for 2 rooms I called several times for either joining or right next door and surprise when I get there they said they REALLY tried but the best they could do was at the other end of hall! The room was small but clean.  I was there for marathon, it was 30mins away and out in the middle of no where! Apparently we were considered staff on two occasions my husband was asked by staff to pass empty salad bowls for refill on buffet line and then some other staff asked him to go give message to the front desk! WTH! Never going back and going to think twice before going to another double tree.
Manager Response: Greetings from the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport!    Thank you for taking the time to review us on TripAdvisor.com.   Your feedback and comments are very important to me and  I wanted express my deepest apologizes for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay with us.   We try our best to accommodate every guest request and I am sorry your rooms were not pre-assigned close to each other.    Please contact me directly at david.arriola2@hilton.com or by phone at (714) 540-4947 to discuss the other issues you experienced during your stay.  This is completely unacceptable and I want to address this with the appropriate department managers.  I look forward to our discussion and I apologize again for your stay.    Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Director of Revenue & Social Media Marketing DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport Email:  david.arriola2@hilton.com Phone: (714) 540-4947

Summary Heading: Close enough for convenience, far enough for relaxing
Summary: Very nice Hilton/Double tree property.  Surrounded in a business park, and not directly under the arrival path of SNA.  Close to the Sergerstrom Performing Art Center.  Convenient freeway accessibility.  Room was clean, neat, staff was friendly.   Self park is an additional cost, and the lot looks small and fills up quickly.   Picturesque view from some rooms of a man made lake, for those who would like more than tall buildings to look at.
Manager Response: Greetings from the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport!     I wanted to thank you for taking the time to review our property on TripAdvisor.com!   We really appreciate your feedback and I'm happy to hear that your stay was a great one.   We look forward to your future visits and I encourage you to provide feedback so we can continue improving all areas of our service and product.    Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Director of Revenue & Social Media DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport david.arriola2@hilton.com (714) 751-2400

Summary Heading: Eh...thin walls, older hotel, many other options in the area
Summary: I came to this hotel on a work trip. It's a smaller hotel that's a bit older. The walls are really thin, when the person next door is showering, flushing the toliet, etc it sounds like it's in your room. When anyone opens or closes the door around you it shakes your whole room which is a bit scary if you are staying alone.  The room is clean enough. I would probably try out a different hotel next time.
Manager Response: Greetings from the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County!   Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay with us.  I'm sorry to hear that you were not happy with certain aspects of our property.   Our public areas were recently remodeled and we're constantly improving the appearance of all areas of the hotel.  Just this week we finished our elevators and they are beautiful!   Please allow us a second chance to show you that our hotel is one of the best in the Orange County area.  I addressed the door issues with the appropriate department and I will definitely pass on any other issues you may have had.    Thank you again for your feedback and if you have any questions please contact me directly.    Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Director of Revenue & Social Media Marketing DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport (714) 751-2400 david.arriola2@hilton.com

Summary: Just spent another 10 night here. Great little hotel off the main road with everything you could need for a good base. Proximity to all shops etc ( Fashion Island, SCP, Irvine Spec.)etc is great. About 1 hour from Palm Springs  ( and outlets)!!! The shuttle service is a great bonus as next time I wont bother to hire a car.... Friendly and efficient staff - our housekeeper was esp. fabulous. The hotel was very clean. Rubio's, Starbucks and other similar eateries only 5 min walk away. Our package included free parking and a good varied hot/cold buffet breakfast at an amazing price as we booked a while ago on Thomas Cook. Self serve $1.25 laundry on site. Fabulously comfortable bed!
Manager Response: Hello from the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport!    Thank you for reviewing us for the second time on TripAdvisor.com!   I am extremely grateful for your honesty and I value your feedback.   I am happy you had a wonderful experience with us during your past stay.  I see that you had a couple of negative highlights about your stay and would love to address them.   In regards to parking, we have a wonderful package that not only includes complimentary parking but includes complimentary breakfast and internet!  It's our Corporate VIP Package and it's priced at wonderful value!  Check it out next time you book at our hotel.   I completely understand your concern about our smoking rooms.   We can add a special comment to your next reservation to keep you away from this floor.   This will ensure a flawless experience which I'm confident we can provide.   Please contact me with any questions and continue providing us feedback so we can improve all areas of our hotel.    Thank you again for your honesty!    Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Director of Revenue & Social Media Marketing DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport (714) 751-2400 david.arriola2@hilton.com

Summary: This is my second review of this property.  For my money this property represents the best value for you money in the area.                                          Negatives  Parking Situation/Cost Some smoking rooms  Positives  Staff                                                               Restuarant & Lounge on-site                         Breakfast Buffet Internet Service Business Center Rate  Shuttle Service  Overall I highly recommend this property.  The staff is exceptional and despite what some reviewers say the rooms clean and well appointed.
Manager Response: Greetings for the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport!     Thank you for reviewing our property on Tripadvisor.com!   We value your feedback and I am extremely happy you enjoyed your stay.    I wanted to let you know about our Corporate VIP Package.   This package includes complimentary breakfast buffet, internet, and parking.  The Corporate VIP Package is always priced at an amazing value which will hopefully become one of your "positives"!   I understand your "con" about the smoking rooms.   I would recommend letting our Front Desk staff know to place you on a floor that does not have any smoking rooms.   If you would like,  I can place special notes on a Hilton Honors profile that can customize each stay to your preference.   Please contact me and I will be more than happy to sign you up for this program.   It's free and you get amazing perks for frequent travelling.     Thank you again for taking the time to tell us about your experience.   Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Director of Revenue & Social Media (714) 751-2400 david.arriola2@hilton.com

Summary: We booked our non-smoking king bed suite w/ sofa bed couple of months ago. Shuttle from airport was very convenient and it took only 5-10 minutes to get to the hotel. Arrived after 10 PM and were told that the room we had booked was not available. The only room that could accommodate 4 of us was a smoking room with 2 queen beds. Agreed to take it after the management said they would spray the room (with some deodorizer). They also comped us 4 breakfasts and a parking voucher to sweeten the deal. The room was not bad after it was sprayed, though my daughter complained about the smell of cigarettes. Beds were very comfortable though everything else could use some maintenance. Our room was near the freeway so we heard the sound of traffic all night (though we were so tired that it
Manager Response: Greetings from the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport:  Thank you for your feedback regarding your past stay.   I wanted to personally apologize for not being able to accommodate your confirmed room type.  This is so disappointing to me and I will address this with the Front Office Manager.   I am pleased you enjoyed our breakfast.  Our breakfast buffet is always a hit and I'm glad your family had the opportunity to eat in our Lakeside Bistro.     I would love to invite you and family to stay with us again.  Please contact me directly at david.arriola2@hilton.com at your earliest convenience.     Best Regards,  David J. Arriola Director of Revenue Management and Social Media Marketing 714-751-2400

Summary: This old property fails on so many levels.  Front desk staff are inexperienced and have not been trained to be more responsive to customer needs.  When checking out saw a $12 charge for an $8.00 laundry charge.  Their response, "you didn't read the small print.  It says there is a $2.00 'bundling charge' and a $10.00 minimum.  You need to call the laundry if you have any questions."  Attitude was aggressive, answer was wrong and for the first time in recent memory, they refused to modify the charge.  Upon checking in had a welcome letter inviting me to the free h'ourdreves served during happy hour (free with the purchase of a drink).  Upon arriving and starting to explore the three options, set upon by a bartender demanding what drink I wanted.  Told him I wasn't sure yet.  Put
Manager Response: Greetings from the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport!   I wanted to thank you for surveying your overall experience at the DoubleTree  Club by Hilton Orange County Airport . Here at the DoubleTree Club we encourage  our guests to survey our products, services, and amenities. I apologize that you had a bad experience at our property and would love to discuss this personally.   Please contact me directly so I may address your issues and relay your experience with the appropriate hotel managers.  Sincerely,  David Arriola Director of Revenue Management & Social Media Marketing Doubletree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport david.arriola2@hilton.com  714-751-2400

Summary: I had 7 nights at the hotel, frustrated by the parking charges. I had no problems and on the whole and found it comfortable. It does appear quite dated but with the rate I paid through Expedia I could not complain. Staff on the whole were very attentive and friendly, the room was clean but the bathroom looked old. If you get the right rate, I would recommend.

Full Disclosure:  I am a Hilton Diamond member, and the Doubletree brand is my least favorite of all of their hotels - These hotels lack a real personality, and do not have consistency in terms of property condition.  This Doubletree is decent enough - Clean, VERY friendly, and in a central location.  They will pick you up from the airport (which is why I stayed there), but it will require a call to the hotel, and a 15-20 minute wait.  My room was basic - Nothing outstanding, and the furniture was in varying states of "old." - The fridge cabinet was pretty beat up, and the stains on the chair looked pretty suspect.  There was an open outlet in the extension cord behind the nightstand, which was nice, but I still like to see something a bit more accessible (Like built into the

Summary Heading: Clean and quiet - nice stay for the price
Summary: The Double Tree Club is a nice “no frills” kind of hotel.  It’s not perfect, but you’ll get a clean and comfortable room in a pretty quiet area.  Be prepared to pay for parking because there is no street parking available.  Pros: Close to Disneyland and Restaurants (if you have a car) Clean and comfortable Smoking room didn’t smell like the typical smoking room Business center in lobby Warm cookie  Cons: Small parking lot and no street parking – forced to valet Be sure to check your bill before checkout  I used the Double Tree Club as a resting place for a short 2 day Disneyland weekend.  The hotel is relatively close to Disneyland and has the benefit of being away from all of the tourist chaos.  We actually ate at a “normal” restaurant instead of the usual greasy vacation

Booked a room through hotwire for a reasonable price. Upon checking in was given a queen bed for 3 people. Had no rollaway beds so my son had to sleep on the floor. Didn't even offer extra blankets. Called and got the last 3 blankets they had. Overbooked and poor service make for a very forgettable experience. Will not be returning to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Pay the Difference for The Suite, it's Worth Every Penny!
Summary: I booked a stay here and paid for a regular room and tried to request the lake view but at the time front desk said there was none available for the weekend we were arriving.  I called back 15 minutes later after I booked through Hotels.com and spoke to the manager, Andy just to make sure we couldn't get a lake view.  Since there were no lake views for our room type, he UPGRADED us to the Balboa Suite, Room #633.  We checked in, and I was FLOORED!  This was the most amazing suite ever! Spacious, a table for our party to play Apples to Apples... THE VIEW!!!!!!!!!!! WOW!!! I love panoramic views.  Maybe other hotels can learn from this hotel about how much the view can add to the quality of their customers stay! Fabulous!  However, if you book any room beneath room #633, your
Not that fancy as the photo shows. A little bit old. However, still a good hotel with good service. The breakfast here is nice(buffet)
Manager Response: Greetings!   I wanted to thank you for surveying your overall experience at the DoubleTree  Club by Hilton Orange County Airport . Here at the Doubletree Club we encourage  our guests to survey our products, services, and amenities. I apologize that you felt our property was dated. We went through a public renovation last year and are consistantly updating major features of the hotel.    I  am happy to hear that you were pleased with our services.   We take pride in customer service and we hope you return soon.    I look forward to your future stay!   Sincerely,  David Arriola Director of Revenue Management & Social Media Marketing Doubletree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport david.arriola2@hilton.com  714-751-2400

Summary Heading: Nice property, parking challenging, BEST breakfast EVER
Summary: I've started at this hotel at least 6 times in the last year. It's a fine choice. The parking is my biggest issue. Self parking is limited. They always offer free valet parking when they get full, but I like having my keys with me so I can access my car whenever I want to get the things I always forget to carry into the room!  The breakfast buffet at this hotel is the best ever. My kids LOVE it, and I do too. The food is restaurant quality, creative, HOT, fresh, and they always offer a great variety. My kids will skip other breakfasts at different hotels, but always wake up for this breakfast! Great fitness room, ice machines on every floor,  pool is nice, and laundry facility is roomy. Good place to stay.
Manager Response: Greetings!    I wanted to thank you for surveying your overall experience at the DoubleTree  Club by Hilton Orange County Airport .   Here at the Doubletree Club we encourage  our guests to survey our products, services, and amenities.  I apologize that you had issues with our parking lot being filled. We try our best to plan for every guest to be accommodated and I will be sure to address your issues with our parking company.    I am very pleased to hear that your children enjoy our hot breakfast buffet!   We take pride in our Lakeside Bistro Restaurant and our overall goal is to ensure you have a "Home Away from Home"  experience.     I look forward to your future stay!    Sincerely,  David Arriola Director of Revenue Management & Social Media Marketing Doubletree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport david.arriola2@hilton.com  714-751-2400

Summary: I was kind of iffy on giving this hotel a 3 or 4 rating.  I went with a 4 because while I don't have anything to discount it further, I just wasn't impressed. Our room had two queen beds and was an adequate size for the one night we stayed before a trip to Disneyland.  Our room was clean.  The front desk staff was friendly.  When we arrived the gentleman at the front desk only had one not-so-warm cookie so he gave us vouchers for two more when we checked out.  Upon check-out the person at the front desk gave us four cookies.  My husband was pleased. I felt like our room was just okay.  It seemed small.  The bathroom had a hard to move pocket door.  The parking was $11 (not mentioned to us, just added to our bill) and the lot was pretty dark late at night (had to venture back to
Manager Response: Greetings from the DoubleTree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport!      I wanted to thank you for surveying your overall experience at the DoubleTree  Club by Hilton Orange County Airport .   Here at the Doubletree Club we encourage  our guests to survey our products, services, and amenities.  I apologize that you had a bad experience at our property and would love to discuss this personally.   Please contact me directly so I may address your issues and relay your experience with the appropriate hotel management.    Sincerely,  David Arriola Director of Revenue Management & Social Media Marketing Doubletree Club by Hilton Orange County Airport david.arriola2@hilton.com  714-751-2400

Summary Heading: Decent hotel with great service and very helpful staff
Summary: I have been flying to Santa Ana once a month for about two years to attend a study program. I always enjoyed hotel service. They provide free shuttle from the airport and give you a cookie or a bottle of water when you arrive. The rooms are spacious and clean. Excellent air conditioner and they recently updated common areas. You can work out in their small but nicely equipped fitness room or walk around the artificial lake. There are many choices to eat nearby. Cleaning ladies are hard working and always smile.

Summary Heading: Cookies always yummy but other DoubleTrees have been better!
Summary: Well we stayed here two nights 4th of July weekend. First off the room we reserved wasn't ready at check-in. Then an hour later they say they have to put us in another room because the one we booked someone smoked in it and wouldn't be ready because they had to shampoo the carpet. A real inconvience we had to store our belongings in another family memebers room. The rooms are small and the air conditioning is loud. the refrigerator was also in a cabinet which at night was loud also. This hotel is for business people. The morning hot cooked breakfast and the Cookies were it's best feautures!

My wife and I had planned on staying here for five nights however after arriving in a nice entrance and updated lobby things went progressively bogus! The elevators are slow and some of the floor indicator lights are not working.The hallways are really dark old and uninviting..When we opened the door to our room we knew instantly that this is going to be a bogus stay at this hotel.The door to the bathroom (its a pocket style) looked like it had been patched and semi quasi painted numerous times, and it didn't close against its jam...Nice! The rooms have a had a update in the past few years but someone forgot to come back and finish it all..Some newly updated area's alongside old outdated..Hmmmm.. The A/C unit is a struggler to keep that room cool but yet sounds like its working

The DoubleTree Club Hotel in Santa Ana is a perfectly adequate but relatively unremarkable hotel. Its best features are its location and the rates and upgrades available when guests book through HiltonHHonors.com.  The DoubleTree Club Hotel is a basic business hotel. It’s a bit smaller than many similar properties in the Hilton family, it’s well kept and attractive, and the staff members are polite and pleasant enough. The on-site restaurant and lounge are convenient, as are the fitness and business centers, but “adequate” is probably the highest praise they deserve.  The DoubleTree Club Hotel is close to John Wayne Airport in Orange County, making it a relatively short drive to Disneyland and other Southland attractions, but not right in the middle of the craziness. That’s

I have used hotwire.com several times to book a room at this hotel. At $49/night it is a steal if you just want a place to sleep.  The rooms are nice and clean and check-in is fast and efficient. The last time I stayed there I messed up and arrived a day earlier than my hotwire reservation called for. The manager was nice enough to switch my reservation around although the reservation issue was clearly my own fault.  The hotel is located in a large office park, which empties out at night. The place is almost deserted on weekends, which serves me just fine.   I have not eaten at the hotel restaurant, but....the menu looks somewhat "basic". There are not too many, if any, other eating establishments within easy walking distance. However, Orange County's biggest shopping

Summary Heading: Very pleased with the property and would stay again.
Summary: I found this hotel on Priceline when I was looking for a pre-cruise hotel stay not too far from Long Beach.  It is a Hilton property and I was very pleased with the room and would stay here again.  They heard everyone's complaints about the parking so they contracted out with valet parking for those that get there late.  We didn't have a problem getting a parking spot but when we woke up the next day, we saw cars parked in every nook & cranny possible.  Self-park is $11/day and valet park is $13/day.  It used to be free but since they got complaints they subcontracted it out.  You pay an extra couple bucks to the valet if you get there late.    Our room was clean, large, flat screen tv, had a view of the pond/lake out front and close to the freeway.  At $45/day plus $11 parking

Summary Heading: this is just average, in a commercial area
Summary: We would not stay here again, the hotel is nice but the issue with parking is enough to say do not stay again.  Once the parking lot is full ( valet parking pretty much is the only way you get to park here) you have to use an over-flow parking parkade several blocks away, dark and out of the way.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Jacked Up Parking Situation
Summary: I needed a property near Orange County Airport that had a shuttle and wouldn't wear the numbers off my credit card.  In the baggage claim area I noticed they have kiosks which directly connect you to local hotels for shuttle service, well sort of, only three hotels were listed and the Doubletree was not one of them.  Once I dug the number out and called the hotel they picked me out in about 15 minutes.  Front desk staff was very nice and pointed out the restaurant/lounge area, explained how the types and hours of meal service.  Room was what I expected, clean and updated.  My room faced the 55, but the road noise was not noticable.  The staff at the restaurant were attentive and it seemed to me that many of the guest were regulars and there was always lively conversation in the

I am a filmmaker who travels with specialized and expensive electronics equipment. I had to attend an event at this hotel and was not afforded an opportunity to self-park my car and retain the keys to my vehicle. The valet manager insisted that I would have to let the valet park the car, or park a block away in a retail area and walk to the hotel in the dark on a nearly deserted walkway around a man made lake.   I could not explain to the valet that I had this equipment because I am concerned with the security of my gear. But, I feel others who travel with expensive merchandise or equipment would also be opposed to giving their keys to a valet.  I have attended a monthly meeting at this hotel for a very long time. This is a very new policy. I hope the management re-thinks this

We enjoyed the 3 night stay at the Doubletree Club Orange County Airport. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping  was good. We did have an issue with the sofabed not having clean bedding, but when we called the problem was quickly rectified with a housekeeper quickly making up the sofabed with all new bedding. We liked the location and we were able to take advantage of the "Make my weekend" special that included a nice breakfast buffet. The room AC/fan is a little noisy but we didn't need to use it much. Note: Our parking was free, but they will be charging $11/night  self parking starting Nov. 1. Unfortunately It seems like all the hotels are doing this now. The current free parking did influence our decision to stay here though. Lastly the

Large quiet room with fridge  - very clean and modern. Great varied Neutrogena products in bathroom.   Woolfgangpuck coffee and herbal teas.  Great position near South Coast Plaza and John Wayne Airport.  Starbucks etc  2 mins away. Free wii fii in lobby.  Very welcoming staff on check in.  Nice pool + jacuzzi.  Easy free parking on site - Very enjoyable comfortable problem free stay.

We stayed here for a baseball tournament and hotel was a great surprise.  Rooms very clean and updated with refrigerators and microwaves in the room.  Parking was free.  Warm cookies at checkin is always nice and the staff was very friendly, informative and accommodating.  Location was great because of proximity to the freeways and very close to South Coast Plaza.  Would definitely stay there again.  Only minus was no free wireless internet.

Summary Heading: Glad they are renovating/don't get room above 55
Summary: The high end hotels around the airport/Irvine area are an incredible deal on weekends.  We have been taking advantage of this for some years as we travel to Irvine area for lots of youth sports.  Normally stay at the Doubletree down the street, but the gauging for parking there has put us off that place.  This doubletree is nice but we got a corner room facing the 55 and I have never been in a noisier room.  Good thing I always travel w/ earplugs. It was really bad.  The room was a bit run down and I was thinking of this while checking out when I saw the signs alerting patrons to ongoing renovations - good.  Parking can be an adventure but its free.  Have stayed here before and will again - but not on the freeway side!

I spent the night here, purchasing the room sight unseen on hotwire, and was very satisfied.  The room came with a refrigerator, iron, ironing board, lighted closet, and comfortable bed with a clock/radio and tv.  The choice of tv channels was somewhat limited but sufficient. I purchased the somewhat expensive buffet breakfast and the in-room internet connection cost another $10.  However, I was VERY pleased with service and quality. (the waiter even suggested I take a cup of coffee away with me)  The entire staff was cheerful and courteous, the check in cookie was yummy, and the entire experience was pleasant.  I especially appreciated the prompt shuttle which picked me up at the airport and dropped me off at another hotel so I could rent an off-airport rental car, which was

Stayed here for 4 nights.  Located between I405 and 55.  Staff was great, everything was really clean, beds VERY comfortable.  The service in the restaurant was top notch and the food was really good.  We had complimentary breakfast, and it was actually very good.  Had a burger and pizza and salad during our stay and all were terrific.  The pool and jacuzzi are outside and were very clean.  They are right next to the freeway though, so a bit noisy when you're out there.  But, kids don't care.  ;-)  We had a group of us there, and supposedly had a group rate of $99.  Interesting that someone I talked to had a rate of $89 though the same night we were there.  So, not sure that was such a good deal, but still not bad at all.  Parking is kind of a hassle if you get there late.

Summary Heading: quiet (yes even though close to Airport)
Summary: Very impressed by quality for the money Very up to date, polished...my wife the hotel inspector gave it a thumbs up. FREE PARKING!! ( which seems a raity at S. Cal hotels... Very convenient as a last night destination before an early flight home my only regret is that I was unaware of the close proximity to "in and out burger"  Walk or jog around the landscaped lake  Good stay.

This was a fantastic Hotel.  I got it for $60/night on priceline name your own price and thought it was going to be just okay.  When I arrived, they checked me right in and gave me a warm chocolate chip cookie.   The loby was incredible too.  Very fancy inside.  Looks like a resort!  The hotel room was outstanding.  The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were real down feather pillows.  Very comfortable.  I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a Super hotel for a great price.  It is in a very safe and nice area too.  I would love to stay their again!
Excellent customer service and rooms... cookies are the best... I would love to stay there again

Summary Heading: What you look for in a hotel
Summary: I was here for one night with my wife. She wanted to go to the nearby shopping centers. South Coast Mall and Fashion Island are very close to this hotel. The hotel was conveniently located, clean and quiet. The parking was free, the internet, in your room, was not. In the lobby there was no charge. If you are looking for a big dramatic interior, this is not the place. It is more like a Marriott Courtyard, and probably caters to business clientele. That said, I loved it. No BS, just a nice hotel.

This is an excellent choice if you need to be near the airport.  The hotel rooms were very clean, good-sized, and very comfortable.  Our room overlooked their lake/pond, which was very pretty and a great place for a walk.  The hotel has easy access to the freeways.  We opted for a breakfast package, and were happy we did.  Scrambled eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, it was much better than average.  The staff were very helpful.

We booked this hotel for two nights through hotwire.  I got a very good deal with a half price deal.  The location is at the business center of Santa Ana.  It was a weekend, so the place was very quiet and not busy. Upon arrival and check in, treatment was not as the other hotwire bookers reported as lousy.  They accomodated us really well and answered all our questions.  Warm cookies were served for us at the counter. The rooms are immaculately bright and clean. But the aisle carpets are old and needs replacement.  We got a fifth floor room facing the airport and we can see planes coming and going in front of our huge glass window.  We love watching the planes and there's no airport noise at all.  The TV is quiet dated, I was expecting a plasma flat screen TV.  Channels are

Summary Heading: Great for the Business Traveler--Nice Staff and Solid Value
Summary: Took me only 40 minutes from LAX--straight down the 405.  Staff was great at check-in.  Rooms appear to be recently remodeled, not new but nice, I would say the decor is comparable to the Doubletree at the Ontario, CA airport.  Breakfast was good with what you expect from a business focused propery, there was plenty to choose from, and reasonably priced.  I had a corner room on the 5th floor, lot's of windows, and updated linens etc made for a nice stay.    Easy walk to Starbucks, and a few other small eateries.  Convenient to the freeway, and provides a good jumping off point to Irvine, Tustin, etc.  Accidently turned into the newer property, but was redirected to this remodeled hotel two blocks away.

Summary Heading: Great location, great price and all the amenities of most Hilton Properties
Summary: I have stayed here about 3 times a year, for the past 4 years or so, but have never written an overdue review.    The location is 2 minutes from the 55 freeway with extremely easy access to John Wayne, Newport Beach and the 405 freeways.  Additionally, the location is very quiet and it is in a business park setting and a lagoon.  The property is as glamorous as an Embassy Suites or larger Hilton properties, but for the price you can't go wrong.  Full Breakfast  and evening receptionis included for Hilton Honors Gold members.  Parking is ample and always available.   The only caveat are the rooms;  it all depends who your neighbor will be that evening.  Noise levels from the hallway can be annoying.   I would also refrain from taking rooms that are 201, 301, etc. since you would

I stayed here at the Doubletree Club on business recently and had a fine experience.  Check-in was quick and easy... the desk staff was very friendly.  My room was clean and tidy, both in appearance and smell.  I had a very nice view of the lake/pond out my window.  The only drawbacks were a lack of a fan in the bathroom and that the high-speed internet access didn't work at first.  However, after a quick call to the (800)# provided regarding internet service, I was up and running.  The fitness room was a little small... bike, elliptical, treadmill and some free weights, but served it's purpose.  The equipment is well maintained.  The hotel is conveniently located near the airport, the 55 freeway, a major mall, restaurants, gas, banks, etc.  I didn't eat at the hotel, so having
Justa brief stay but the setting was nice and the room very plesant and spacious. Restuarant was good and would return.

I just stayed one night for business in November. This is actually the second time I've stayed at this hotel in the last two months. I think this experience was even better than the last. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. All of the hotel staff were very courteous. I dined in the hotel restaurant and the food was pretty good and reasonably priced. The hotel's proximity to the airport is great; only about a 5-10 minute drive. I will be staying there again the next time I'm in the L.A. area.

A nice simple property if you are staying a few nights. Don't confuse this with the regular Doubletree Hotel about 1/4 mile away. Warm cookie at check in. Room was clean and comfortable. Bed was above average for the price. Bathroom, while not fancy, was roomy and had nice towels, Neutrogena bath products, and had good ventilation to take the steam out after showering.
