The A/C is the noisier, non-central type in the wall to the outside, but to be expected at a 3 star type property. I would return and stay here again for a one night stay.

WE have had two family reunions at this hotel over a five year period.  It is located in a business district so it is a bit out of the way, however it is worth finding.  Rooms are clean, pool is nice but located near highway so rather noisy!!  Breakfast is great- hot scrambled eggs, french toast, hash browns, fruit, cereal, and great coffee.  Room rates are reasonable and hotel is close to highways, mall and restaurants. Must have access to a car because everything is a short drive away.  The hotel also has a van you can call down to the desk and a driver and van will take you where you need to go within a certain mile radius.  Beaches are a 10 minute drive.  If you are into the night scene you may want to stay somewhere closer to the action but for our needs this hotel was very

My family and I checked into the hotel with the hopes of just a nice place to sleep. Having four children, we live in on a tight budget, and never get to travel. One this one occasion, we were able to take four days to visit family. Keeping below a budget of 60 dollars a night, I found doubletree. I knew it was a nice place, and knew that my family would get a Safe good nights rest.  When we checked in they were wonderful! The man behind the front desk, Mika, was great. I mentioned to him about possibly getting a view of the airport because my autistic son would just love it, he not only did that, but got us a room on the top floor, the Executive Level.  He knew we were on a budget, and had given us comp breakfast (six each day), and comped our parking. He said that he wanted to

I looked at the pictures of this hotel online before flying to OC. I thought it looked nice enough. When I pulled up to the place I was sure I had the wrong Doubletree. Now I know, when I see DoubleTree Club I should pay close attention to the "CLUB" part, and book a different hotel. I would compare this hotel to a Fairfield Inn. Not fancy in any way, shape or form, which is confusing since it is listed as a First Class property type in my booking system (sabre). The price I was paying was too high for this type of property. I only stayed one of the five nights I was supposed to and moved instead to the Marriott Suites Costa Mesa. For one night it works but for business people staying for an entire week? No thanks. The mini-fridge reeked of dead fish (what?)  and there was a

We stayed in this hotel for one night while visiting Irvine, which is just a few minutes away on surface streets (or freeway).  We got our room for $50 per night on Priceline, and it was a terrific value.  At first, though, we drove to the wrong hotel.  There are two Doubletrees within a couple of blocks of each other.  The other one looked fancier, but this was the one we got.  Check-in went smoothly, the parking was free, and our accommodations were very nice.  The TV had the standard (not expanded) number of channels.  No problem with noise at night since we brought a sound machine--not sure there would have been any problem even without it.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  When, Sunday evening, we discovered that there weren't any weekend newspapers in the bin

I stay in OC alot and the only way I would stay in this hotel again was if it was free.  Here is a list of the issues    1. Hard to find because of construction 2. Checked in online only to be given a different room 3. Elevator takes forever and floor buttons don't light up, so you don't know what's going on. 4. Hallways (time for upgrade, colors and smell are both bad) 5. Room needs updating.  Was there a contest to see how much furniture would fit in the room.  Also, the wall unit was loud.  Bathroom seemed to be the most spacious room 6. Beds were hard (True at all DTs I've stayed at) 7. Had breakfast in restaurant.  Staff was hanging out, singing and whistling the entire time (Not that I'm against fun, but a little over the top) 8. Was in the place for an hour and only once

We stayed here for 2 nights over President's day weekend.  The hotel is very nice.  My only complaint was there was no refrigerator in the room....but you tend to run into this with higher end hotels.

Plainly a horrible place to stay. Checked in at 11pm on a Sunday night, had to wait 15 minutes to get someone to check me in. Paid for a lake view room, which was old, tired and a little musty. The bathroom had grout everywhere and the showerhead had little force. Room service was late and bad tasting and the free computer internet service in the business service was slow or always overrun by little kids. Though the location is nice, in a corporate park, it has nothing else going for it. I would skip this place.

The Doubletree Club has recently been renovated and is a really nice property now!  The hotel overlooks a pretty lake that is home to many ducks, swan and geese. It sits in the middle of a quiet office park but the hotel is very close to the freeway, so be sure to request a room away from the highway.   The bedding is very soft and comfortable and the furnishings and carpet are new. This is a great hotel for business travelers because the rooms are quite large, and there is ample workspace (and a nice desk too). Wireless internet is free in public areas, but costs about $10 a day for in-room service.  The hotel offers free self parking, though spots are a bit hard to come by, making parking sometimes inconvenient. The hotel has a nice breakfast buffet in the morning with

Summary Heading: A quite Oasis in the busy OC
Summary: Stayed for a weekend on business and could not be happier with the hotel. It was clean and everything worked and was in great condition.  The Maids should be commended my room was spotless and little details when the room was cleaned like folding the towels and tissue in flower shapes gave it that homey feel.  A very quite hotel no doors slamming or outside noise even though it is next to a freeway.  I was not able to try the breakfast but the restaurant looked nice and the grounds were beautiful with a man made lake in front and outdoor seating from the restaurant, this made for a very tranquil oasis in the crazy busy area that surrounds it.  I will be staying here on all future visits.

My occupation has me traveling every week. Therefore, I stay in a different hotel every week. Overall, this is a pretty nice place. However, there is a brand new DoubleTree (Doubletree Hotel Santa Ana/Orange County Airport) only 2 blocks away...think I'd try that property...if not avaliable, I'd book this site again.

We earned a free hotel stay through the Hilton Rewards program and decided on this Doubletree during our trip to Southern California. When we booked the stay we were not able to reserve a room with a King bed. Upon check in, the friendly staff immediately upgraded us to a corner/view room with a King bed. The room was absolutely beautiful. The furnishings seem new and very upscale. It was clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The room is spacious and includes a fridge and microwave. I forgot a few things and the staff gladly helped me out with that.  There is construction going on nearby, but we arrived on a Saturday so there was no one working. Just check with the hotel to make sure your room won't be bothered by it. The hotel is minutes from the

Doubletree Club is a solid hotel.  Front desk staff were friendly and welcoming upon check-in, and the room was spotless.    The fitness room features an exercise bike, treadmill, and elliptical trainer, plus a weight bench and selection of free weights from 5 - 50 pounds--very nice, although the ceiling's a bit low if you're over 6'3" on the elliptical trainer.  Watch your head!  Towels are provided both here and at the pool.  The pool is long enough to feel like you can do a few lengths (but not too long--maybe 40 feet?  Depth ranges from 3.5 - 5 feet), and there is a nice hot tub.  Both are in full view of the interstate and the adjacent office buildings, but I had them to myself on a night the hotel was fairly full.  You can also see the approach path for Orange County

"I am so mad!  Ok. The hotel was clean, free parking, comfortable bed, decent room service. Whatever.  Here's the problem.  I was double charged for the room.  I called the hotel and was told first, that I checked out late.  Then, that I stayed an extra day.  Neither of which was true.  Then I was told that although I'd checked out on the TV I left my stuff in the room and therefore didn't really check out.  Not true either.    The desk guy proceeded to tell me that the computer isn't wrong and he didn't know what to tell me.  After talking to some chick named Steph and a guy named Andy I'm still waiting for "approval" from the GM to reverse the charges.    This is why I never leave home w/o my Amex.  They'll have my back!  And I'll NEVER stay at the DT again!"

Staff does not bother to pick up the front desk phone, especially after 5pm, I had to come down to the lobby every time I needed to speak to someone.  For example, when you need to connect to the Internet, you need a password and they don’t bother giving it to you at check-in.    Had a problem with my Internet connection, when I called tech support at the number provided in the room, they needed to get in touch with the front desk, but guess what?  As always, no one picked up. I couldn't work on my computer for the remainder of that day.   The guy that checked me in seemed very much in a hurry to get rid of me, I didn't even get a chance to ask him a few questions I had.  There is construction going on right next door.  It's not the hotel's fault, but it could be a good idea to

The hotel is located in an office park and faces an attractive man-made lake with public art (sculptures of birds). The property is clean and well-run. The rooms were plenty large and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast included a smaller but better-quality selection of items than would be found in the brand-mate Hampton Inns. Parking is free.  Guests appeared to be a mix of families on vacation, individuals traveling for business, and teams traveling for athletic events.   Although we had a non-smoking room, the smell of cigarettes entered the bathroom via the vent. Covering the vent with a towel removed the problem. The outdoor public areas have more ashtrays than is typical for a California hotel.  The strangest thing about the hotel was how they want you to access the pool.

Summary Heading: Nice Clean Hotel in Good Location
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times for business. My company's office is next to the hotel which makes it very convenient. The rooms are very clean and the beds comfortable. The toiletries were Neutrogena and there was a good selection. My only complaint is the $7.95 a day charge for the internet.

Summary Heading: Friendly and pleasant every time we stay here!
Summary: Have stayed at this hotel at least five times in the last few years.  The hotel is very close to Cal State Irvine and also very close to downtown Irvine.  I have stayed here on business trips and in conjunction with youth basketball league tournaments.  The staff is friendly every.single.time I call or ask for anything.  The buffet breakfast is completely acceptable and usually included in the price of the room at the rate I reserve.  Internet access in the room always works, and the room itself is comfortable and pleasant.  Central air-conditioning would be a bonus, becuase the window air conditioners now in use can be noisy.  It is  a popular hotel for wedding receptions, probably because of the photo opportunity with the adjoining "lake".  It's always fun to see the wedding

Summary Heading: Not a bad hotel, but deffinitly not great
Summary: I booked a non-smoking room for May 5th.  When I arrived we were placed in a VERY stinky Smoking room.  There was a vent that sucked up all the smell supposedly... but it wasn't very efficient because the room smelled something terrible.  Over all the room was clean.  Not very spacious, but deffinitly had enough room for two people.   At the rate of $99 I thought it was a decent value for a hotel of that quality. The rate included a warm cookie check in(extra cookies availbe upon request), buffet breakfast that I did not wake up for... but deffinitly a great affordable hotel. Very close to the Irivine Spetrum, Disneyland, South Coast Plaza along with many other things to do in the area.  If I were visiting from out of town I'd probably stay here again.

staff was friendly and courteous. room was average in size, but very clean. furnishings were new, except for the TV which needs to be updated. shuttle service to the airport was very quick. towels were nice and fluffy. the bed was perfectly comfortable.  in-room A/C unit was noisy but was repaired. tub was slow to drain and was not corrected. maid forgot to leave the bath mat and shampoo on the second day.  there is some construction going on nearby, which can't be heard, but part of the road is closed down.  overall, above average.

From the moment we arrived our stay was amazing. The staff was great, the room was clean and fresh. The breakfast buffet was excellent. I definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone who is in the Orange County area.

When I am in Orange County for business, I normally stay at this hotel. It is centrally located to just about everything I need to get to. The lobby is ok (not very big) BUT when I stay at a hotel, I  am not paying for the lobby...Rooms are not big but they are comfortable/room service is great as well as pool..This is my 5th time staying at this hotel and with ALL the hotels I could pick in Orange County, I keep coming back to this one....should say something about the hotel..Only drawback is when I stayed there in June, there was quite a bit of construction going on, so a lot of things were roped off around the hotel that were open in previous stays....Great access to freeways and John Wayne airport about 1-2 miles down the road but far enough that you don't hear the
exceeded my expectations! doesn't smell. everything looks new and clean! warm cookies at check in! free water!

My daughter and I stayed at the Doubletree Club Orange County on July 4 and were pleasantly surprised given the varied reviews to date.  While there was nothing special about the lobby or check-in process, we found our room clean, quiet, and very comfortable.  We were rushed in the morning but did take advantage of the continental breakfast.  Cooked-to-order meals were also offered as part of our room price, but we did not have time.  All-in-all, this was a very satisfying experience.

Check in was pleasant at first but when we got to the room we discovered they gave us double beds not the queen we reserved. We went downstairs and tried to resolve the issue but were told that since we booked through a third party (Travelocity) that we weren't guaranteed our room request that was for guests who booked through them and paid the full room rate. Only after pushing and finally getting a manager did someone check to see if there was a room at the Double Tree across the street because they were completely booked. He said all they had was a king smoking.   Since we were tired after a long trip we took the room but called corporate and were told that it was indeed policy not to guarantee room requests when purchasing through a third party. We then called the Double

I recently stayed at the Doubletree Club at John Wayne Airport and really appreciated the great attitutde of the staff there.  I'm so tired of the stuffiness I've encountered recently.  I've stayed at some of the other hotels nearby, and this was a refreshing change.  Great location, too!   I got a quiet room right over the lake.  Loved the free wireless connection, too!  Totally recommended!

I make reservations occassionally for a group that travels.  This is our second time here.  We will definitely come back next time we need to go to the Irvine area. Yes, there is a newer and fancier DT across the way, but this one is in quiet area with great staff.  And for a group of families with teens, their rates are much better than the other DT. One Saturday we were late from our very early function getting back for their complete hot buffet breakfast.  We called and told them about 35-40 of us would be arriving about 10-15 minutes before their published closing time.  They were extremely accommodating and when we arrived, they had restocked all the trays full of hot food!  We ended up staying in the dining area well past their regular closing time, and not one complaint

I didn't realize I was booking a reservation at this hotel.  There is a newer Doubletreet across the street.  The front-desk staff was helpful.  I went to my room - it smelled, torn bedspread - just not pleasant.  I asked for a different room and was accommodated.  This room smelled musty, the carpet was stained and the sheet was torn and stained.  It was just gross!  I couldn't stay - I got my money back and went to the Doubletree across the street.

The best thing about this property, as mentioned in other reviews, is its proximity to area attractions.  In addition to the theme parks listed by others, local beaches are also a short 10 - 15 mins. away.    The hotel is not much more than a motel with a lobby and a small bar and restaurant.  If you are accustomed to standard Doubletree luxury, expect to be disappointed.  If it wasn't for the logo and the cookies, you could erect a big blue sign with a red '6' on it.  Rooms are small but well equipped, and the large window (lakeview) is a nice touch.  The staff I encountered was indeed polite and helpful.

I did not find anything out the average with compared to other hotels. Yes, you do get a cookie when you check in and we were also give vouchers for 2 drinks. The check in was fast and people were friendly. Only on elevator was working when we were there so had to wait a while or use the stairs. The pool was not heated but the hot tub was nice. Room was a little bit on the small the side. Overall, this is a nice quiet out of the way hotel in a business district not far from Disneyland about a 15 minute drive or a large shopping mall. The Doubletree is right down the block from them. There is a Starbucks, Juice bar and some restuarants nearby mainly open during business hours. Although the hotel does have a restuarant in it and does provide room serice however, we did not use it

My husband was working in Orange County for two weeks in August of 2003 and I came out here for a long weekend and stayed at the Doubletree Club.  While it was not a luxury hotel, it was just fine for the four days I was here, and my husband said he had no problems for the two weeks he was here.  Our room was very nice and it was bright and cheerful.  The breakfast was good and I enjoyed hanging out at the pool every afternoon.  The staff was extremely friendly, especially the bartender, Forrest.    I am a walker and I was surprised to find a fabulous mall, South Coast Plaza, within walking distance along with several other strip malls along the way.  My favorite hamburger place, In-N-Out, was also close by.  I would definitely stay here again!
The staff at the hotel were very helpful.  Rooms were ok.  Loved the area with shops across the street. Pool was warm and inviting.

The common areas and lobby of this hotel are fine for a Doubletree Club, but the rooms are tired.  I have stayed here a number of times and found the heating/air conditioning system frustrating and the beds uncomfortable.  The staff is friendly enough, but it's not enough for me to stay here again.  A far better choice is the Doubletree Orange County Airport which is right across the street for about the same price.
